properties.name: Modern Brand-New 1-bedroom Pad in Bondi!
properties.summary: Close to the heart of Bondi! It's about a 15-minute walk to Hall Street, which is the main strip of Bondi. Alternatively, it's a 5-minutes walk to Bondi Road where there are plenty of cafe's, bars, restaurants, take-away shops and a local supermarket.. Perfect for couples, solo adventurers, and business travellers.
properties.space: I try and subscribe to a minimalist philosophy of living so I like to keep my space simple, clean, neat and tidy. For a small 1-bedroom apartment, its actually an incredibly functional space. There are great laundry facilities in the apartment (washer/dryer) and the living area is comfortable and spacious.  The balcony is big for the apartment size - but do note it backs onto a main road so it can be noisy - the windows and doors are double glazed so inside its peaceful - but outside you'll experience some traffic. However so long as you're not overly sensitive to traffic noise its great - I often sit outside on the balcony to eat dinner and relax in summer.

properties.neighborhood_overview: Bondi is one of the most popular tourist destinations in Sydney - beautiful beaches, food and lifestyle - it's a unique place to stay, relax or stop if you're passing through.
properties.access: You're welcome to have full access to the place while you're here. When you're not staying, I live in the apartment. I run a business so travel frequently - hence the place is available in those times. Unfortunately there isn't a lot of hanging space in the wardrobes - but if you needed to hang a jacket or dress, you're welcome to push my stuff aside to make room. Please just return the space as you found it :)
properties.interaction: Depending on whether I'm overseas or local will depend how easy it will be to contact me. I'll always be available by email and usually by mobile as well. I have a cleaner come in between the times you're not there so if in an emergency - they can always come to the apartment.
properties.host_about:
I run a training company helping entrepreneurs grow their business and stand out in their industry. Previously lived in Melbourne - now I call Sydney home! Love talking life, liberty and the pursuit of happiness over a red wine and getting out and about for an adventure whenever possible.

For more on me, just search the web for Mike James Reid

properties.host_about: We, Richard and Colin, have created a home out of our shared interests in travel, theater and gardening and design. We have travelled extensively in China, worked in India, and generally enjoyed amongst other places Turkey, Spain, Thailand, USA and Nepal. We moved to the city to be closer to the wonderful arts venues and dining experiences Melbourne has to offer. We were very lucky to find this place where we could create a garden retreat within 5 minutes walk of the CBD. We love Melbourne and traveling and so we are keen that visitors should go a way with a good impression and fond memories of their time here.

properties.name: 'Bellarosa' Californian Bungalow
properties.summary: Welcome :)  We have on offer a renovated and expansive Californian bungalow home surrounded by very pretty gardens, nestled in Beaumaris, the Bayside area of Melbourne.  The house is light filled, with a north-facing living area, and open fireplace.  Located in a very safe neighbourhood, and, being by the beach, the land happens to be very flat, so is fantastic for bike riding and leisurely strolls.
properties.space: The house is quite spacious, and in addition to the bedroom spaces, it includes 3 separate living areas, all with a unique feel, 2 have TVs and the third a piano/reading/resting area.  The large modern kitchen-living area downstairs opens out to a beautiful, sheltered outdoor living decking area, accessed by fully bi-fold French doors. There is also a BBQ area and a lush green garden to enjoy.
properties.description: Welcome :)  We have on offer a renovated and expansive Californian bungalow home surrounded by very pretty gardens, nestled in Beaumaris, the Bayside area of Melbourne.  The house is light filled, with a north-facing living area, and open fireplace.  Located in a very safe neighbourhood, and, being by the beach, the land happens to be very flat, so is fantastic for bike riding and leisurely strolls. The house is quite spacious, and in addition to the bedroom spaces, it includes 3 separate living areas, all with a unique feel, 2 have TVs and the third a piano/reading/resting area.  The large modern kitchen-living area downstairs opens out to a beautiful, sheltered outdoor living decking area, accessed by fully bi-fold French doors. There is also a BBQ area and a lush green garden to enjoy. We are situated towards the beach, off reserve Rd, about a 3 minute drive from a well-known Ricketts Point teahouse and Marine Park which is a very popular tourist destination.  Our house is also arou
properties.neighborhood_overview: We are situated towards the beach, off reserve Rd, about a 3 minute drive from a well-known Ricketts Point teahouse and Marine Park which is a very popular tourist destination.  Our house is also around the corner from the Concourse shops, which is a group of about 50 shops including a supermarket, fruit and vegetable store, fresh fish store, butchers, bakery, quite a few trendy cafes and restaurants including Chinese, Indian, Seafood, Modern Australian and Wood-fired Pizza to name a few.  Also close to local golf courses, the King Club gym and sports recreation centre, and great bike trails along the beach road.  Down Beaumaris Bay is the local Yacht Club, and Dalgetty Beach is a popular family-friendly patrolled swimming beach.
properties.transit: End of street is a local bus stop which goes to Sandringham and Cheltenham stations. Sandringham is a 27 minute train ride to Flinders St Station, Melbourne City Central.
properties.house_rules: Peacefully and with respect for the house.  This is a beautiful sanctuary, a great escape where you can indulge in all the modern comforts in a classical and beautifully stylised home.  Feel free to come and go as you please.  No pets allowed. Non - smoking preferred, but outside is okay. Take the time to enjoy the leafy surrounds of Beaumaris and take yourself on some relaxing strolls down Dalgetty Rd to winding beach cliff paths along the bay.
properties.host_about:
Art and Dance Therapist, self entrepreneur, residing in  Australia. I love new cultures, nature, creativity and adventures. I enjoy socialising and meeting new people and sharing some stories and laughs. I love creating a beautiful and nurturing home atmosphere, and doing things such as cooking delicious meals, pottering about in the garden, going on beach walks, catching up with friends, having quiet time at home and making and creating art. I also love cats!  
My favourite holiday destination so far is Byron Bay and Bali. I love the hot weather, and all things tropical. And the people in both places are very friendly and open minded and fun. 
I like British comedy, Australian drama series on abc, and documentaries by people such as Louis Theroux. 

5 things I can't live without are: a cat, my friends, my expressive dance classes, music, nature and colour!

My style of hosting is to be friendly and warm, yet respect the space and people and allow ease and comfort to prevail. 

The beauty of Airbnb, is that it seems to bend the truth on the line 'there's no place like home'. It is wonderful that there is this system set up, whereby we can travel anywhere and experience other places, like home, but different, and be warmly welcomed, and do the things we do at home. I like that we can belong anywhere we go, with like-minded people, it opens doors which before never would have been explored.

properties.name: Sophisticated Modern Melbourne
properties.summary: Brand new huge 3 bedroom "New York style" apartment in the heart of downtown Melbourne.  With polished concrete floors, big bedrooms, huge kitchen/living and dining areas you will feel at home in your comfy double bed and own bathroom.  Min 2 nights.
properties.space: The bedrooms are larger than normal, with built in wardrobes, which are available for you to put away clothes.  The sheets are crisp and clean and the bed is extremely comfortable.  You will have sole use (except if we have visitors) of the toilet and shower rooms.  Towels are supplied, as are soap, shampoo and conditioner.

properties.neighborhood_overview: The apartment is situated in the CBD, yet quiet and private.  The best coffee is downstairs at Hugo's and the Japanese restaurant (also downstairs) makes the most amazing chicken curry.  Restaurants, pubs and nightclubs are within a 5 minute walk and it is only a 5 minute free tram ride to Chinatown and the theatres.  Southbank and the Casino are a short five minute walk, as are two Direct Factory Outlets, a supermarket and the Exhibition Buildings.
properties.notes: This is a secure building and we are on the 1st floor.
properties.transit: The apartment is five minutes walk from the Skybus Terminal to and from Tullamarine Airport (bus leaves every 10 minutes, 24 hours a day).  We are two minutes to Southern Cross Railway station and close to trams.  All trams in the city are free and the City Circle tram is a great way to orientate yourself with the city.
properties.access: Access is available to the rest of the living area, such as lounge, dining room and kitchen.  Please feel free to make a tea or coffee in the kitchen.
properties.interaction: Being a traveller myself and knowing what the tourist attractions are, I will be available to help with directions, places to go and 'what's on' in Melbourne during your stay.  Guide books and maps are provided.  Love to share a wine or beer and hear about your day as you unwind.  Very happy to help plan your itinerary to get the most out of your stay in this beautiful city. Interaction with Guests I look forward to warmly welcoming you and making you comfortable. You'll be treated like friends staying with me - I live here too. I will take care of you, but don't fuss. If you need anything I'm always available. Am happy to help you with your plans, or leave you in peace and quiet. Whatever works best! The best coffee in Melbourne is right downstairs at Hugo's.   Queen Victoria Market has fresh food and souvenirs (10 mins walk). Walk into the CBD for shopping, cafes, bars and restaurants. At the end of the day when you want to rest, my place is comfortable, relaxing and quiet.
properties.house_rules: As this is my home, I would expect guests to treat it, and myself, with respect.   This is a no-smoking apartment. Check in time 2.00pm.  Check out 10.00am.
properties.host_about: Love to travel and living in an apartment gives you the opportunity to interact with local people, rather than other tourists in a hotel.  Love to catch a show whilst away and also sample the local cuisine and try the local wine (or beer).  Interested in architectural buildings, art, theatre and trying to help out others not as fortunate as we are - do a lot for orphans in many countries.

properties.name: SouthYarra Designers Delight (2br)
properties.space: Located in the heart of South Yarra's most premium quadrant - one of Melbourne's finest addresses with a variety of stately mansions, beautiful terrace houses and stunning apartments. This 2bedroom apartment is mere minutes from Melbourne's CBD and major attractions. It's ideal for professionals working in the city or at one of the nearby hospitals, or those coming to Melbourne for a holiday or our large array of special events...  Almost at the gates of Melbourne High School, SEE comprises of 74 apartments over 14 levels and is set in the Forrest Hill precinct of South Yarra, an area formerly home to commercial and light industrial development. The factories are disappearing and Forrest Hill is being reinvented as a trendy residential hub on the doorstep of the Chapel Street and Toorak Road shopping and dining strips. - x 2 Double Bedrooms with double/queen beds, also with BIR (linen and towels supplied)  Beds as per pictures.  Sleeping arrangements: we do our best to customise based

properties.neighborhood_overview: What's South Yarra like? Who wouldn't love staying in the center of Melbourne's best shopping, best restaurants, best night life and entertainment. From here you can walk to some of Melbourne's finest spots, the Yarra River, the Botanical Gardens, Fed Square,the city, Southbank and more. Dine on street, people watch, enjoy fashion, glamour and style all day, every day, all year round. Shopping’s the name of the game in South Yarra, where Chapel Street reigns supreme. The fashion strip contains all manner of high-end designer boutiques, chain-stores, hipster hang-outs, cinemas and gift shops. There’s also a seemingly unlimited array of cafes and restaurants to help revive weary shoppers by day, and bars and clubs to keep the buzz going at night. Naturally then, South Yarra attracts the young, hip and fashion conscious, at least on its main strip and the streets immediately surrounding. The residents are a mix of young professionals, families and empty nesters – all attracted to this sal
properties.house_rules: x1 small request: please water apartment's plant(s) in sink, every 2 days or so. We don't like fake plants so we have real plants but obviously they need to drink when we're not there to water them myself! Thanks in co-operation here!  Apart from that we don't mind what you do during your stay as long as you respect the apartment and it's contents. Thanks :)
properties.host_about:
UNIQUE SHORT STAYS, SOUTH YARRA

Hi There!

I'm a corporate events professional based in East Melbourne/South Yarra in Melbourne. Friendly, easy going & accommodating. I am passionate about events, travel, food, wine, meeting new people & new experiences! 

Our homes are in inner city Melbourne. South Yarra/St Kilda Rd Precinct/East Melbourne. Brillant access to CBD but slightly removed for peace and quiet at night. They are certainly mere minutes from Melbourne's CBD and all major inner Melbourne attractions that make Melbourne "Marvellous".

We aim to provide the most cost effective and best value designer/boutique accommodation in inner Melbourne.  

They are ideal for leisure travellers who are looking for a unique place to call home whilst in Melbourne,or for corporate professionals working short-term in CBD/inner city. Perhaps you're coming to our fair city for one of our many special events....?

If you are interested in one of the properties i have listed but the dates are unavailable, please check my other listings under my profile or please email me through airbnb messaging system, as l will likely have another apartment/home available that will suit your needs.  I am here to provide suggestions where you see fit

Any questions please don't hesitate to call out, look forward to chatting with you about your finer requirements. 

Myself and our events network are here to assist you. More than happy to provide sights/restaurant/event/cafe or transport tips to ensure a memorable, extraordinary, safe  and convenient trip!

I have airbnb on my iphone, so i normally reply rapidly.

properties.name: Private Sunny Room in Fitzroy North
properties.summary: An art filled apt in the best area. Lots of light, an open planned living area w/a turntable, a well-stocked kitchen, bathroom with a shower. The room has a touch of Mexico, a new double bed, speakers and lots of light.  Trams are close by.
properties.space: My cozy two bedroom apartment is on a tree lined street close to a park, walking track and Ceres.  The apartment is very sunny and filled with art. If you are offended by nudity then this may not be the place for you. My place is centrally located near plenty of public transport, cafes and bars. We are between two fantastic tram lines. The city is 20 minutes away. You can walk to Fitzroy and Lygon st. in 20 minutes.  I have a TV but it only gets internet,  Netflix and Stan. There is a turntable, full kitchen and a small dog. My dog is super friendly. If you are allergic to animals, this probably not the best place to come.  I work Monday to Friday. There is construction across the street, they have dampened the sound by making a container wall. The area is still beautiful. There is no construction on the weekends.

properties.neighborhood_overview: Located on the border of Fitzroy North and Brunswick East. There is tons of stuff to check out in the neighborhood. The closes cafe is Julio's on Miller st. It is a 5 minute walk.  Popular cafe's in the area. Pope Joan (URL HIDDEN) Milkwood (URL HIDDEN) If you walk to Lygon st you will be spoiled for choice for cafes and bars. There's a very tasty gelato bar. There are a few cool bars within walking distance called B.EAST, Green Park and Atticus Finch. Northcote is a 20 minute walk. There are heaps of  shops, bars and cafes there also.  If you want to experience a great Melbourne neighbourhood. Then take a 20 minute walk up to Westgarth and  check out LUPA on HIgh St. They specialize in Melbourne designed and made fashion.  There are also lots of cafes and another fantastic gelato place. Brunswick and Brunswick East are also a hop skip and jump away. Sydney road has fashion and a good variety of food from Middle Eastern to Chicken Parma's. The city is easy to get to and the neighbourho
properties.notes: Small dogs are welcomed. The charge is an extra 10 per day. Chicken necks and dry food are available on request.
properties.transit: I have a bike that you can use. Although you may need to pump up the tyres.  Trams are the easiest way to get around. There is a Myki card available to use for a 10 dollar deposit. The Myki card is the only way to pay for trams in this city. They are not available on the trams. Ride without one except in the free city zone and  you may receive a  more expensive pay later option. The 96 tram is the fastest way to get to the city. This tram will also take you to St Kilda beach. You can grab the 112 or the 11 on St Georges road. These trams will take you to the Bourke St mall and Southern Cross Station.  At Southern Cross Station you can grab a bus to the airport. To take the famous 86 tram you'll have to walk up the hill to Westgarth/Northcote to High St. This tram takes you to Bourke St Mall also. The 86 tram travels along Smith St where you will find discount stores, second hand clothing shops, vintage furniture stores, Messina and an assortment of cool bars and restaurants. You can wa
properties.access: Internet  Full kitchen Laundry  Television  DVD player Harddrive Television on request Smoking outside only Turntable and records
properties.interaction: I am a pretty social person. The apartment is cozy so we will definitely run into each other. Especially Friday to Sunday. I leave for work at about 9:15am and return around 7pm. You can spend as little or much time in your room or the living space as you like.
properties.house_rules: Smoking outside only Music is encouraged Laughing is also welcome Clever conversation is a godsend No guests without permission No overnight guest allowed If you break something tell me. I may or may not charge you.  You may enter at anytime.  No loud music past 11pm. That does not mean that you can not play music in your room quietly. You are welcome to use the kitchen but clean up after yourself. No dishes are to be left in the sink. It's a war you know, the critters are winning. No loud talking outside the apartment. Be mindful of my neighbours. Parking is off street only. Do not discuss AirBnB with my neighbours.
properties.host_about:
I am a citizen of the world. I was born in Los Angeles, I've lived in Canada, France, Germany, England and Holland. 

I love meeting people who are interesting.

properties.neighborhood_overview: South Yarra Place is perfectly located close to many of Melbourne¹s most frequented attractions. A 5 minute walk from the front door, through the picturesque leafy side streets and you will be right on Toorak Road or further along to fashionable Chapel Street  (shopping here is amongst Melbourne's best!). This area is also home to many of Melbourne¹s best restaurants and cafes, including France Soir, Caffé e Cucina, and Da Noi just to mention a few.   A 5 minute walk in the other direction, across Punt Road and you can enjoy beautiful Fawkner Park and further along to trendy Domain Road and the Melbourne Botanical Gardens.
properties.notes: Our Rates: Sunday - Thursday: 360 per night Friday and Saturday: 395 per night Whilst we have a 2 night minimum stay - the minimum charge for any booking is 1150 .
properties.transit: Getting around is easy as the closest tram stop is only 5 minutes walk from our front door plus the South Yarra Train station is about 7 minutes walk. We also have parking on site (for up to 2 cars).
properties.access: Some of the things you'll find INCLUDED FREE OF CHARGE  when staying at this beautiful property are:  - Free wireless internet - Luxury Gilchrist and Soames toiletries - Foxtel cable TV - Luxury 5 star quality linen and fluffy towels  - Undercover garage parking AND off street parking  (2 spaces) - Interim or weekly cleaning for stays of 8 nights and longer  - Exit cleaning  - All utilities - Gourmet starter pack including quality teas, espresso coffee pods, biscuits, milk, sugar, - All the necessities for a comfortable stay, such as olive oil, cooking oil, glad wrap, salt, pepper etc.
properties.interaction: Guests enjoy the entire property in privacy. Telephone assistance is available.
properties.house_rules: To ensure comfort for all our guests and the peace of our neighbours, we require that there be no smoking, no parties, no pets. Detailed terms of stay provided separately.
properties.host_about: I manage professionally designed apartments in Melbourne, the South Pacific and Asia - all catered towards discerning travellers who want to experience the destination as a local - I am always here to assist with advice as I have spent many years in each destination.

properties.host_about:
UNIQUE SHORT STAYS, SOUTH YARRA

Hi There!

I'm a corporate events professional based in East Melbourne/South Yarra in Melbourne. Friendly, easy going & accommodating. I am passionate about events, travel, food, wine, meeting new people & new experiences! 

Our homes are in inner city Melbourne. South Yarra/St Kilda Rd Precinct/East Melbourne. Brillant access to CBD but slightly removed for peace and quiet at night. They are certainly mere minutes from Melbourne's CBD and all major inner Melbourne attractions that make Melbourne "Marvellous".

We aim to provide the most cost effective and best value designer/boutique accommodation in inner Melbourne.  

They are ideal for leisure travellers who are looking for a unique place to call home whilst in Melbourne,or for corporate professionals working short-term in CBD/inner city. Perhaps you're coming to our fair city for one of our many special events....?

If you are interested in one of the properties i have listed but the dates are unavailable, please check my other listings under my profile or please email me through airbnb messaging system, as l will likely have another apartment/home available that will suit your needs.  I am here to provide suggestions where you see fit

Any questions please don't hesitate to call out, look forward to chatting with you about your finer requirements. 

Myself and our events network are here to assist you. More than happy to provide sights/restaurant/event/cafe or transport tips to ensure a memorable, extraordinary, safe  and convenient trip!

I have airbnb on my iphone, so i normally reply rapidly.

Feel free to contact me anytime.

Cheers Alex, Unique Short Stays

properties.space: These large private rooms are upstairs in a 2-story townhouse. Our room is downstairs with its own bathroom, so upstairs is pretty much all yours. We are a relaxed couple and share downstairs with our 2-year old labrador named Bentley. He is an excitable pup, but spends all his time with us and won't bother you. (Unless you are up for doggie cuddles, which then he will be happy to oblige).  Only 7kms from Melbourne CBD and a 3-minute walk to West Footscray train station - only 15 minutes to the heart of the city! The rooms have either a comfy double bed or single bed (one room is single, two rooms are double beds) with all linen, pillows and comforter/doona. properties.neighborhood_overview: We are located in a new estate so everything is brand new. Everyone is super friendly and the area has a great community feel to it.  The house is walking distance from Barkly Street shopping strip with lots of fantastic ethnic restaurants, KFC, Nandos, ATMs and a post office. Highpoint Shopping Centre is an easy 10mins away by bus if you need a shopping fix.
properties.notes: We are a 5minute walk from a supermarket, so you can always stock up on anything you need.
properties.transit: We are located a short 3minute walk from West Footscray train station. The train is a quick 15minute ride into the heart of the Melbourne CBD.  If you need to get to the airport we are about 20 minutes away by car depending on traffic. Our home is a great spot no matter where you are going in Melbourne. You can get around everywhere very easily.
properties.access: Upstairs will be your space: bedrooms, bathroom and small lounge room with a couch and a TV (we have Netflix for you to enjoy =D ). We venture upstairs only sometimes as we store clothes in the closets, and also our computer is up there. But we like to give our space guests so won't be up there often.  Downstairs you will have access to the dining room, kitchen, laundry, reading room and another small bathroom. We use downstairs a bit but are always up for a chat. You are welcome to cook in the kitchen and do your washing in the laundry. We provide all cutlery, pots, pans and plates. There's space in the fridge and pantry for your own groceries.  We have an outdoor deck area with a BBQ if you ever need fresh air/for the smokers.
properties.interaction: We are both avid travellers that have used AirBnB and stayed at a-many hostels! We understand that some guests like to interact or prefer privacy and to do their own thing! We are happy with whatever you prefer. We work the usual 9am-5pm Monday-Friday (with Steve sometimes working nights) jobs but are always up for a chat or to let you know some cool places to visit and how to get there!  Our puppy is usually with us, but he is always open to pats from someone new - so if you are a dog person, he will be glad to hang out with you constantly. But if animals are not your thing - never fear - we will keep him with us so he doesn't bother you.
properties.house_rules: • Check-in time is 11AM. Checkout is 10AM.  • No parties or events We are pretty relaxed and laid back. Only rules would be: - No Smoking Inside  - If you cook, please clean up afterwards (though we have a dishwasher which makes it easier =D )  - Front door to be shut at all times to avoid our pup escaping!  - On weekdays ideally no super loud noise after 11pm as we have work early in the morning, but weekends are fine
properties.host_about:
Hi there - I am Simone, 26-year old from Melbourne Australia! My husband Steve is 29-years old and we have an adorable fur child - a 3yr old labrador named Bentley. 

We are avid travels, covering most of Asia in the past few years. In 2015 spent 6 weeks in Europe and had an absolute blast. 2016 we explored Japan to for 4 weeks and are attempted to learn some language before hand!  

We are pretty geeky and enjoy watching a good movie or reading fantasy novels. We are mildly obsessed with Nandos chicken and sleeping in. Overall we are pretty laid back and just want to enjoy everything the world has to offer!

properties.neighborhood_overview: St Kilda is the best place in Victoria. On the beach and close to the city. Accessible by lots of public transport it is a vibey and alive place that caters for young and young at heart. You will never want to leave as there is so much to do.
properties.notes: St Kilda Twilight Market is on every Thursday night from 5pm right through Summer under the palm trees in the park outside Luna Park.   It is the place to meet, eat, buy, create, enjoy and share in the heart of St Kilda. The St Kilda Festival is on the middle weekend of February. The Albert Park Grand Prix track is within walking distance. Located inbetween 2 golf courses.
properties.transit: FREE underground secure parking can be provided on site with lift access. Airport shuttle bus to the door. So many forms of public transport within a stones throw, but you will need a MYKI card.  Let me know if you need some or they can be purchased from 7/11 and other places. Easy to walk everywhere as everything is so close. We often park our car downstairs there and walk to lots of things in St Kilda - even at night.
properties.access: FREE underground secure parking with lift access. Unlimited Wi Fi Coffee Machine Fridge Washing Machine Dryer Dishwasher Crockery Ironing board & iron Body wash Shampoo & conditioner Hair Dryer Storage for your bags/suitcases
properties.interaction: I'm a stone throw away, so here if you need me.  I leave contact up to you but I have to say that I enjoyed my last guest so much after cocktails together, dinner and a few catch ups, that we will be life long friends.  The guests prior to that were a couple and were great. Although I dropped a new iron & ironing board off for them, we never actually met but they were lovely to deal with and I'd happily have them back.
properties.house_rules: This is a beautiful space with everything brand new.  We ask that you are respectful.  We want you to enjoy your stay.  This is strictly not a place for parties. Please enjoy your holiday, but remember that there are people that live in the block that have to go to work. Price is for 2 people.  There is a sofa bed but extra linen and towels provided on request.  80 cleaning fee per booking which is included by Air BnB Although we do allow smoking, this is STRICTLY outside in the large courtyard ONLY - and with the doors and windows to the apartment closed. Any damages will be taken from your bond.
properties.host_about:
A Melbourne girl who wants everyone to be able to experience the best about the area where she lives.
After growing up in the Eastern suburbs of Melbourne, I moved to the bayside area where everyday makes me feel alive and like I am on a holiday.
I love being surrounded by so many fabulous restaurants all within walking distance and too many to name.

The vibe makes me feel alive.

properties.name: Basic Private Apartment
properties.summary: This unique apartment is set above our recycled timber furniture showroom. It's fully fitted out with all the necessities for a comfortable stay - all within 10minutes of the CBD.
properties.space: The apartment is a private space located above our recycled furniture showroom. We are only open on weekends although we also take viewings by appointment during the week, so really you have the entire building to yourself most of your stay! In spite of being above the showroom, the space is completely private with a latch on the door above the stairs, to which we will have no access. The apartment has a medium-sized bedroom with a spacious lounge/dining/study combo with all the necessities to keep you comfortable. The apartment comes with a large radiator heater on the lounge and a smaller but powerful oil heater for the bedroom to keep you nice and cozy in Melbourne's chilly winter season. It's  not the fanciest place in the world, but should be more than suitable for those after a warm bed and good wifi for their stay in Melbourne.

properties.neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in the beautiful suburb of Abbotsford, that is a ten minute stroll to the Yarra Reserve and Dights Falls (a baby waterfall in inner city Melbourne!). The apartment is also convenient located within walking distance to a 24hr service station for midnight ice-cream runs, and the local grocery store, as well as delicious coffee, pizza and beers. The Smith St shopping/bar strip is a 15 minute walk away.
properties.notes: The house is well furnished and would suit someone who is after a quirky, no-frills stay in Melbourne.
properties.transit: The train station is a two minute walk away and will take ten minutes to get you into the city centre of Melbourne and there are about six bus lines within a minute's walk away that will take you into Fitzroy, and Lygon St strip in Carlton.  If you drive, there is cheeky/free parking on Turner St, or you can park right outside the house most hours of the day - it's a clearway zone from 430-630pm on weekdays.
properties.access: You will enter via the front door of the showroom and will have full access to the upstairs apartment.
properties.interaction: We are around downstairs during showroom opening hours between 12-4pm on weekends, and potentially on and off on weekdays, as we do viewings by appointment. We are also always available on phone and email in case of emergencies.
properties.house_rules: As you will be sharing the building with our showroom (although the upstairs apartment is completely private), we do expect guests to be very respectful of the space. Unfortunately we are not able to accommodate large gatherings and and parties, and certainly not in the downstairs area where furniture is at risk of getting damaged. You will be entering the apartment via the showroom so we ask that you are mindful of keeping the door locked behind you when you enter/leave. Otherwise, we hope you enjoy your stay!
properties.host_about:
We are Nadia and Troy, and Singaporean-American couple who have found Melbourne to be home. 

Nadia is a creative studio manager and peddles linen bedding on the side, and Troy makes furniture out of recycled timber.  
 
In the last few years, we have made lots of lovely friends by being hosts and guests on airbnb and are always open to having more!

So please, no parties. Registered guests only.
properties.host_about: I'm an avid traveller when possible, and an IT lawyer the rest of the time. Airbnb provides a whole different angle to the travel experience that I love - the local touch and comfort!

properties.host_about:
UNIQUE SHORT STAYS, SOUTH YARRA

Hi There!

I'm a corporate events professional based in East Melbourne/South Yarra in Melbourne. Friendly, easy going & accommodating. I am passionate about events, travel, food, wine, meeting new people & new experiences! 

Our homes are in inner city Melbourne. South Yarra/St Kilda Rd Precinct/East Melbourne. Brillant access to CBD but slightly removed for peace and quiet at night. They are certainly mere minutes from Melbourne's CBD and all major inner Melbourne attractions that make Melbourne "Marvellous".

We aim to provide the most cost effective and best value designer/boutique accommodation in inner Melbourne.  

They are ideal for leisure travellers who are looking for a unique place to call home whilst in Melbourne,or for corporate professionals working short-term in CBD/inner city. Perhaps you're coming to our fair city for one of our many special events....?

If you are interested in one of the properties i have listed but the dates are unavailable, please check my other listings under my profile or please email me through airbnb messaging system, as l will likely have another apartment/home available that will suit your needs.  I am here to provide suggestions where you see fit

Any questions please don't hesitate to call out, look forward to chatting with you about your finer requirements. 

Myself and our events network are here to assist you. More than happy to provide sights/restaurant/event/cafe or transport tips to ensure a memorable, extraordinary, safe  and convenient trip!

I have airbnb on my iphone, so i normally reply rapidly.

Feel free to contact me anytime.

Cheers Alex, Unique Short Stays

(If interested, ask me about a second available guest room with private bathroom for 1 adult at an additional price).
properties.interaction: Typically I will also greet you with your key and a welcome discussion to orient you to the area and chat about the requirements for your stay.  A guest sheet of "fast-start" suggestions of things to see and do are also provided upon arrival.  In general,  also like to touch base with you within 24 hours of arrival and upon departure.  At the end of the day, it's your time here, so interact as little or as much as you like!  Come upstairs for a convo or nestle into your room - It's your time!  Cheers, Tracey
properties.house_rules: - Respect for eachother and premises - No Pets - No more than two people at any time without prior arrangement - Cover of laundry expenses of 10 per load if staying s free - If anything breaks, please advise.  Also if you notice anything that does not com up to the quality you are expecting, please let us know Thank you.
properties.host_about:
Whew!  Just returned home from a 2 minute stroll to the South Melbourne Market....couldn't choose from the incredible array of amazing cuisine, incredible stalls, music and friendly community spirit that we are famous for! 

I had comrades tonight including my daughter who shares my love for South Melbourne and our cool 4 bedroom, 3 level townhouse with stunning city views.  The good news is that your space is on the ground level which provides ease of access.  You will have a lovely bedroom overlooking a petite garden area with a private bathroom ensuite which is yours to enjoy. The private room is fully air-conditioned with a slim line TV and tea/coffee making facilities.   This space would suit an executive, couple or a single.

I've lived in this area for over 20 years and love the proximity to Albert Park Village, Gas Works Park, MSAC, the vibrancy of St Kilda, Luna Park, Sunday Market, beaches, Melbourne bikes, 24/7 Gym, Community Bus, 3 tram routes (1, 96, 112) which transports you to the best that inner Melbourne has to offer.   

Back to my evening....I'm about to venture onto the main balcony with a glass of vino and dinner....sauvignon  blanc is appealing tonight....light and crisp.  

That's a little bit about me, your host!  I would love to see you soon as a guest here in South Melbourne!

Jackson's Landing is the exclusive area of the suburb and features high rise apartments with full views of the city, with very little street parking available. The Star casino is 2 mins away and popular Darling Harbour is about 10 mins away by walk. Also the apartment is nearby the Sydney Fish Markets, Wentworth Park and Central.
properties.notes: FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS ABOUT THE PLACE: Q: Is this like a hotel? A: No, this is not a hotel. This is a fully functioning apartment with two adults who live here every day as well as a small business and family commitments. We have guests. We eat dinner. We watch television. We have a cleaner, housekeeper, work guests, etc. We like to interact with guests, though we give them privacy. If you prefer to not speak to anyone you see, have an entire house to yourself or want to stay in a place that is like a hotel - please do not book with us.  Q: Can children stay with you? A: As said in our listing, we do not encourage parents with children or young babies to stay with us. Our home is not childproof and we can not ensure that it is safe for your children at all times. I would recommend you getting your own "entire place" on Airbnb or a hotel. Q: Is it near the Lightrail? A: The apartment is about 5 minutes away (walking) from the Lightrail and easy to get to - it's just around the corn
properties.transit: There is lots of public transport available. Including buses and the light rail. There is also frequent taxi services nearby and many people in this area Uber to get around best.

As noted, there is security in the building so sets of keys will also have a swipe access key to all communal areas and the lifts.  (Loss of keys will be charged to the Guests at our discretion. There will be a replacement cost if you lose the keys. Guests must not break in or attempt to break into premises.)

We always love having a drink or some snacks with our guests and strive to learn about their nationalities and cultures.
properties.house_rules: These rules are merely a formality, to protect us and yourself in the wild world of Airbnb. We are very relaxed guests and are not a strict as these rules makes us seem. These rules are simply an assurance and for our insurance. ------------ We have prepared your room to a high standard. We ask in turn that you show consideration by being neat and tidy, placing wrapped garbage in the bins provided. The other communal spaces in the house are available to all of us and we are not strict on this, only the room you hire. Non-Smoking Policy - Guests acknowledge that smoking inside of the property is not permitted and agree to ensure they and/or their Guests smoke outside only. We request that Guests do everything possible to prevent cigarette smoke from drifting inside the premises and to please safely dispose of their cigarette butts in a tidy manner. Animals are not allowed in or about the premises. Any cleaning or pest treatment costs incurred as a result of an animal being brought or ke
properties.host_about:
Hi we are Eden and Whitney and we run this Airbnb together. Eden works at a hospital and Whitney is a marketing coordinator and fashion designer. We are a couple from Sydney who love to relax, enjoy travelling and are always on the go, either for work or holidaying. We are fortunately to live in one of the best and safest suburbs in inner Sydney and love hosting guests as well as have guests host us while we go place to place. Whitney has recently launched her own fashion line and we love meeting new people to learn from.

As hosts, we like to give our guests space and freedom. With our own hectic schedules, we are happy to accommodate guests required times and are happy to have guests around at any time. We are always available to contact and love offering advice and suggestions on nearby places. We are also always keen for a drink or a snack with our guests and love connecting with new people.

When travelling, we are looking for the personal touch and love being immersed in cultures. We are often travelling to avoid the daily grind at home and love trying new things. Having been to 30 countries combined, our whole lives are travelling and we love speaking to people about their homes.

Our Airbnb experience is about giving guests the best and cleanest room, while also relaxing and giving them the space they want. We are not neat freaks and hold parties now and then, which we invite our guests to interact with. We believe that your room must be cleaned to the highest standard and that you must be completely fulfilled while staying with us. But we do hate Airbnbers who think it is like booking a hotel - don't book with is if this is what you're after!

We are late sleepers and are addicted to keeping up with pop culture, with TV watching always high on our list of things to do. We eat dinner late and are always amending to our busy timetables. We love being busy and have many aspirations that we aim to achieve. 

Our favourite travel destinations are: New York City, San Francisco, Paris, London, Indonesia and Melbourne. 

Or favourite books are: Catcher in the Rye, The Bell Jar, Harry Potter, The Great Gatsby and The Girl With The Dragon Tattoo.

Our favourite TV shows: Game of Thrones, Girls, Keeping Up With The Kardashians, House of Cards, Orange Is The New Black, American Horror Story, Sex and the City and Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt.

Our next trip: Russia, Finland, Sweden, Norway, Denmark, The Netherlands and the UK!

There is a separate toilet from the bathroom and both guest rooms come complete with queen bed, plus ample storage space and built-in wardrobes. properties.neighborhood_overview: This is the wealthy end of South Yarra. There is a mixture of modern and art-deco style apartment blocks mixed in with some classical South Yarra mansions. Domain Road is home to the famed Botanical restaurant and a number of other well known establishments including cafes and restaurants.
properties.notes: There is a parking permit that you can use if driving you need a temporary parking spot.
properties.transit: You are 200 metres from the nearest tram stop which will take you direct to Melbourne's CBD, or the other direction to Chapel St and inner eastern suburbs. South Yarra train station is a 15 minute walk or 5 minute Tax ride. There is also access to the bus network on Alexandra Parade.
properties.access: You'll have access to the entire apartment except my room. There is a separate toilet from the bathroom and both guest rooms come complete with queen bed, plus ample storage space and built-in wardrobes.
properties.interaction: I can help with directions and must see sites right across Melbourne.
properties.house_rules: Prepare your own meals (basic items like coffee, tea, milk and shampoo are provided).  No late night parties during the week and any additional guests must pay if staying. Clean up after yourself and leave the apartment as it was when you arrived.
properties.host_about:
I'm a straight 34 year old male working as a portfolio manager in financial Services in the city. 

Dinner and drinks with friends is my main method of relaxation. I am also a loyal supporter of the Geelong Football Club in the AFL and play amateur cricket in the summer. 

I am a friendly, easy-going person at home who has a natural liking for people. I love hearing other peoples' stories and have travelled extensively so I am attentive to the needs of local and international travelers. 

I am a passive host who likes to let people discover things for themselves. I am more than happy to help when it comes to building a to-do list of must see attractions though. 

If you are here to work then I will leave you alone. 

My favourite quote is from Bruce Lee:

"One does not accumulate but eliminate. It is not daily increase but daily decrease. The height of cultivation always runs to simplicity."
properties.street: South Yarra, South Yarra, VIC 3141, Australia

properties.name: Kanturk Country Retreat hideaway
properties.summary: Sleeps 18 on 3ha of garden and native bushland. It has a three-hole, country style golf course, tennis court, solar-heated swimming pool, bush walks, croquet and bbq facilities. Ideal for romantic getaways or gatherings with family and friends.
properties.space: The cottages:  Kookaburra Cottage is a contemporary-style cottage with an open-plan kitchen-living area, with full kitchen facilities including dishwasher, coffee plunger and orange press. The bathroom facilities include two showers and toilets and a laundry. It has a king-sized bed in one bedroom, a queen in the second, a built-in bunk in the third and a dormitory that sleeps six in the fourth (one on a trundle bed). All linen and bath towels, tea and coffee provisions, home made pure olive oil and coconut oil soap and home made cookies are provided for your secluded retreat.  TV, DVD and CD/radio provided. The Sixth Hole is a one bedroom log cabin with a large open plan kitchen/living area featuring a large stone fireplace. The bedroom features a queen-sized bed and a double sofa bed in the lounge.  Sally makes olive oil and coconut oil soap, shampoo and body scrubs on the premises. If you would like to see her range of products, just ask. They   can also be purchased from her.

properties.neighborhood_overview: Enjoy the natural setting (wallabys and koalas used to live in this area but now are rarely seen) abundant birdlife occasionally sugar gliders in the area of Langwarrin South, just 45 minutes from  Melbourne CBD, five minutes to shopping centres of Somerville, Langwarrin and Pearcedale and 15 minutes to the seaside thriving metropolis of Frankston. Langwarrin South is at the gateway to the beautiful Mornington Peninsula with its stunning beaches, world-class golf courses, wineries and restaurants.  Fishing and boating activities abound at nearby Tooradin, Warneet, Yaringa Boat Harbour and Hastings all about 15 minutes away. And the Langwarrin Flora and Fauna Reserve, Cruden Farm- the home of the late philanthropist Dame Elisabeth Murdoch- Mulberry Hill the former home of the late artist Sir Daryl Lindsay and Lady Joan Lindsay author of 'Picnic at Hanging Rock', and  the award winning Pearcedale Moonlit Sanctuary is five minutes away.
properties.notes: We have a minimum two-night stay for our cottages.  While we are a pet-friendly property, please don't bring any pets without prior arrangement.  Also please note that we charge per person for both adults and children. If the numbers increase the cost will also alter.
properties.transit: Trains run regularly from Melbourne to Frankston. Every 20 minutes in peak hours and approximately hourly until midnight.  Buses run from Frankston to Pearcedale (the 776 buses) which stops at both ends of West Road. However we will usually try and pick you up from Frankston station if we can. This is by prior arrangement obviously. Taxis also operate from Frankston.
properties.access: It is set in country gardens on a property of three hectares with native bush walks, bbq facilities, tennis court, solar-heated swimming pool and country-style golf course. Ideal for book clubs where you can sit around the fire in the log cabin with a glass of wine  and solve the world's problems. Or just enjoy the bird watching. The property is ideal for club getaways, family gatherings, birthday celebrations - the possibilities are endless.  We live on the property in a separate house. The area inside the circle of the driveway is private property.
properties.interaction: We interact as is required. We like to greet guests to show them around if they wish, provide anything they may need like golf clubs, or tennis racquets and balls,  and answer any questions. Other than that, we like to leave things to the guests. We may be involved in property maintenance and gardening if necessary, but generally when guests arrive our work ends.
properties.house_rules: Due respect must be paid to other residents on the property and our neighbours. The property is for the use of the booked in guests only. This means that no visitors may enter the property without prior approval of management.  There is no smoking in the cottages but ash trays are provided on the picnic tables.  One bed is the sofa in the lounge room of the Sixth Hole that may be used as a double bed. While the property is not fenced on one side, pets are OK by prior arrangement so long as they stay outside the cottages and under the effective control of their owners. Golf can only be played on the golf course. If you are a novice, we can provide plastic golf balls to practice your stroke on. This may be done in front of the cottage. Please don't alter the pool umbrellas unless you know how they work. If in doubt just ask and we are happy to help. There are three cottages on the property. Due respect must be shown to the guests in the other cottages.  Our little dogs Jack, Marley and H
properties.host_about: I am a writer and journalist and mother of four young adults. Gary my husband (also a journalist) look after the property, and manage the cottages between a busy life of visiting friends in Melbourne, seeing films and gardening. We love our property and hope you will enjoy it as much as we do.

properties.notes: **This is especially a great retreat if you want to disconnect from technology and relax. I do not provide wifi or access to local TV. However, options are provided below if necessary: -WIFI: The lobby of the car park building provides free, walk-in internet access via Mac computers. If apartment wifi is mandatory, locals recommend signing up for Telstra Air packages for daily or weekly internet access for a small fee. -No local TV, DVDs only: Apart from the apartment DVD player, there is a rooftop cinema where you can watch Foxtel, normal TV or DVDs. No fees or bookings are necessary for casual use. It is open until 10pm every night and located in the same building.
properties.transit: Trams are right on your doorstep If you walk out and turn right you have access to our famous onsite cafes and the shopping centre on either side If you walk left you have private entry to the yarra walking trail If you walk straight you have access to the health and wellness centre that contains the spa sauna gym and pool If you don't walk you can sit by the grass and read a book under the sun Who can compain with that!?!....

Hi!
Born and bred in Melbourne. I have the travel bug. I am simple with my likes - warm weather, gelato, beach. Appreciate taking pride in living spaces so cleanliness is important! 
My place ensures you have access to all necessary facilities and surroundings to relax. Trees, water, walking / riding trail, rooftop spa, rooftop pool, sauna, garden, inhouse massage therapist, yoga centre, rooftop bbq, personal cinema, waxing and beauty treatments. Not to mention that across the road you have a supermarket, IKEA, public cinema, and everything else you can think of at the shopping centre. Outside your doorstep you have trams or you can walk down to trendy cafes on Victoria Street.
I have just started on AirBnB. I have not built a bank of recommendations (yet!) but I hope to host people with the same open mindedness. 
Happy travels...!

properties.host_about: Hello, I am a teacher, a lover of art, nature and good food and music. I like to travel overseas but that has been curtailed over the last 20 years as I have raised 3 children but now with my youngest about to finish school I hope to launch my travels once more. I am a bit of an art tourist which takes me to Sydney, Hobart and Brisbane as well as regional Victoria to see various exhibitions.

properties.host_about:
Hi There,

I'm Jonathan, I'm in my mid 40's, sometimes older sometimes younger and I love to travel. 

In terms of a home I love a comfy couch, I love a deep bath and I love full blockout curtains. 

5 things I can't live without?

Books, I love a good book.
Good food. I love sharing a great meal with others.
Long sleep in's on Sundays or any day really.
Water. I love swimming in the ocean or rivers. Lets keep them clean.
Music. Anything from opera to house.

As your host, I will be on call to make your stay as comfortable as possible. If anything goes wrong during your stay, say the washing machine won't start or something, I will have it sorted immediately. I've had guest stay at my place for 3 month and then extend up to 16 months. I've had guests who moved out and then told me if they could stay forever they would be very happy. 

As someone who has travelled a lot with work and stayed in hotels motels and apartments both long and short term, I set out to create a space that was a real home away from home. Somewhere where you can feel safe, warm and cosy and enjoy a good home cooked meal. It was all about atmosphere. A deep bath to relax in, comfy couches to put your feet up on, a big TV to tune out to and stunning view whilst enjoying your breakfast. In winter turn on the gas log fireplace and enjoy a glass of wine. Head out to one of the many great eating establishments on Chapel St, Fitzroy St or take a tram to the city. the tram stop is a 2 minute walk away.

Everyone who has stayed at Charnwood has enjoyed their stay. I'm sure you will too. Great location, affordably priced and in a very convenient but quiet street.

properties.name: Great Room in Inner City Melbourne!
properties.summary: I love my city, and I love my apartment... I love sharing my little piece of paradise with travelers visiting our great Melbourne.  Have privacy in your own room, but share an apartment with a super approachable, flexible and funny roomie... ME! The apartment is in a quiet street right next to the CBD, surrounded by beautiful gardens. The apartment is on the top floor (second floor) of the building. Please note: like most buildings that height, there is no elevator.
properties.space: A two bedroom apartment with a renovated bathroom, great little kitchen and an open plan living/dining space. There's a balcony so you can smoke there (if you smoke, I do not smoke). The bedroom has a double bed, drawers and a great vintage writing desk, as well as built-in wardrobe for those wishing to stay a little longer! The complex has a pool, spa, gym and sauna. I live walking distance to the city, bar hubs Fitzroy and Richmond, and most excitingly - a three-minute walk to the MCG! If you like the tennis I'm about a 10 minute walk from Rod Laver Arena where the Australian Tennis Open is held, as well as the sporting complexes which hold the soccer and various events. If you're here for the comedy festival or Grand Prix, you will have very easy access to transport or to simply walk to the variety of venues holding those events.  The perfect location.

Have privacy in your own room, but share an apartment with a super approachable, flexible and funny roomie... ME! properties.neighborhood_overview: I'm walking distance to everything! The tram, the train, the CBD is right outside!! If you like sports - this is the place to be! Walking distance to the iconic Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG) only three minutes away, Rod Laver and all other tennis arenas used for the Australian Open, as well as bar/clubbing hubs of Richmond and Fitzroy. I love this location, and I'm sure you will too.
properties.notes: There's no additional parking for guests underground, however, there's plenty of street parking. I can provide a parking permit so guests can park on the streets without getting a fine.
properties.transit: Walking! You'll be close to EVERYTHING. But if that's not your style, the tram line (I'm in the FREE TRAM zone if you're just travelling around the CBD) is only 2-3 minute walk, Jolimont Station is about 5 minutes away, and the central Flinders Street Station is less than 10 minutes away.
properties.access: Very flexible access: I only work about a 20-minute walk away, so can easily come home at any time to let people in with prior booking.  I can also coordinate to leave the key in a specific location if I can't get to you - so I'm very flexible with time as long as I know beforehand. Note: Apartment is in Entrance A (the numbers on the block can get confusing!)
properties.interaction: I live alone and I work long hours, so tend to not be around too much... But when I am, happy to give people a hand, have a chat or share a glass of wine (or two!.... or five). I did include an extra charge for a second person, but that's just if it's additional person for the whole booking period. Totally happy for you to have a friend over on any given day if you're staying for a longer period - pretty lax about that.  Cheers, Elisa
properties.house_rules: I'm pretty flexible and I appreciate common sense. Just some basics: - Men put the toilet sit down please! (I've fallen in before....) - Please keep your most of your things in your room, and if you need to leave toiletries and things in common areas that's absolutely fine, but please be mindful that you're sharing with someone (me!) and I'm clean and tidy - and expect the same from guests.  - I welcome you to use anything in the kitchen loungeroom, but please clean up after yourself. Good knives/pots should be washed by hand after each use and put to dry - but there's a dishwasher for everything else.  - Smoking should be kept to outside only - there is a balcony, or downstairs. Absolutely no smoking inside.  - If in doubt - ask! I'm very approachable and I want your stay to be enjoyable.
properties.host_about:
Born and bred in Brazil, moved to Australia in 1999. Lived 10 years in Sydney and made the move to Melbourne in 2010 - love this city! 
I am a communications professional; I work full time, but I'm also undertaking a masters degree. I love working, love food, love wine, love coffee... hate spiders.
Feel free to contact me if you need to ask me anything.

properties.neighborhood_overview: We have the pleasure of sharing our building with just four other apartments. The building is usually very quiet, so we expect guests to share the space in the same way (no excessively loud music, no parties etc.). You are a short walk to Docklands (including the sport stadium), the Melbourne CBD/downtown, the Queen Victoria Markets, famous Lygon Street in Carlton with its Italian heritage and restaurants, the Melbourne Zoo, and other attractions.
properties.notes: There are construction works occurring nearby between March 2017-March 2018. These works will only occur during the day. We don't anticipate noise or access to be a problem, but we are listing this information in the interest of disclosure and transparency.
properties.transit: The 57 tram is about 40 metres away from the doorstep, the train system is about 10 minutes walk, and the CBD is about a 15 minute walk.
properties.access: The entire second bedroom is quite secluded from the rest of the apartment, as is the attached ensuite. You are free to spend your time within, or share our kitchen, loungeroom and front balcony (brilliant in summer) with us! We have our bedroom and bathroom up the back of the apartment, which is private.

properties.name: Large Private Rooftop Terrace, CBD

All areas of the apartment (living room + kitchen, bedroom, bathroom and outdoor terrace) + gym, pool and sauna in the building. When in Melbourne I am happy to suggest and share many of the 'secrets' that this city tightly holds away from the tourist eye. I work and spend a lot of time around the CBD so always very happy to help with any requests. Collins Street is one of Melbourne's most beautiful streets with so many things to offer. Those that have been to Melbourne know, for all new comers I would suggest a quick web / wiki lo
properties.neighborhood_overview: Collins Street is one of Melbourne's most beautiful streets with so many things to offer. Those that have been to Melbourne know, for all new comers I would suggest a quick web / wiki look at Collins Street and the surrounding area.
properties.notes: This apartment is a TV free environment - yup there is no TV in the house! With all the things to see and all the things to do around the city I personally do not have time (nor have any interest) to watch TV and I would recommend you try and do the same during your stay!  May I suggest a nice bottle of wine on the terrace enjoying the city view instead? That would make a much more memorable experience.  Also please note: the apartment is set on top of a hotel building which also offers many rooms and suites in different shapes and sizes. Although this apartment is unique in its position, aspect, decor, view and use of outdoor space, if you are only concerned with location during your stay then you could have a look at the lower levels of the hotel building to see what other options are there.
properties.transit: The apartment is surrounded by public transport options with 2 tram stops within 1 minute of the building entrance and major train stations within 5-10 minutes walking.  Enjoy the free tram zone all around the cbd from right outside the door!

properties.host_about:
Creative director living in Melbourne and often found overseas and interstate. I love life in Melbourne's CBD and everything it has to offer: the laneways, the restaurants and bars, the ambiance and of course the people. The city base on offer is set in a humble rooftop apartment that reflects everything I love about urban life. No matter what I may have been through during my hard working days or weeks, a few minutes on my terrace soaking the city around me gets me right back to normal. 
After a recent visit to New York City I have decided to open and share my city base with like-minded travelers who may be looking for a unique, hidden city apartment that represents a lot more than just a roof over their heads. I hope you enjoy this humble Melbourne Pied-à-terre during your stay!

properties.neighborhood_overview: SHORT STROLL ALONG THE RIVER TO THE TENNIS Walks along the river, great shopping up chapel street and being surrounded by the best cafes and restaurants in Melbourne. Favourite local eateries;  Cafe e Cucina & 38 chairs - nearby romantic and full italian experience.  Miss Chu's - cheap, quick and delicious asian food.  Francois - for a more expensive and amazing steak frites. properties.host_about:
UNIQUE SHORT STAYS, SOUTH YARRA

Hi There!

I'm a corporate events professional based in East Melbourne/South Yarra in Melbourne. Friendly, easy going & accommodating. I am passionate about events, travel, food, wine, meeting new people & new experiences! 

Our homes are in inner city Melbourne. South Yarra/St Kilda Rd Precinct/East Melbourne. Brillant access to CBD but slightly removed for peace and quiet at night. They are certainly mere minutes from Melbourne's CBD and all major inner Melbourne attractions that make Melbourne "Marvellous".

We aim to provide the most cost effective and best value designer/boutique accommodation in inner Melbourne.  

They are ideal for leisure travellers who are looking for a unique place to call home whilst in Melbourne,or for corporate professionals working short-term in CBD/inner city. Perhaps you're coming to our fair city for one of our many special events....?

If you are interested in one of the properties i have listed but the dates are unavailable, please check my other listings under my profile or please email me through airbnb messaging system, as l will likely have another apartment/home available that will suit your needs.  I am here to provide suggestions where you see fit

Any questions please don't hesitate to call out, look forward to chatting with you about your finer requirements. 

Myself and our events network are here to assist you. More than happy to provide sights/restaurant/event/cafe or transport tips to ensure a memorable, extraordinary, safe  and convenient trip!

I have airbnb on my iphone, so i normally reply rapidly.

Feel free to contact me anytime.

Cheers Alex, Unique Short Stays

properties.name: 1920s Brunswick: B'fast, Tram, Cats
properties.summary: A beautiful 1920s brick house one minute's walk to cafes and trams going past Melbourne Zoo and Victoria Market, with Brunswick cafe culture a stroll away. Enjoy a spacious room with bay window and a sunny back garden.
properties.space: Welcome to our generous single-storey (3 bedroom, 1.5 bathroom) house, art deco stylings circa 1920. Indulge in Brunswick's cafe culture, take the tram out your front door to Melbourne Zoo, Royal Park, or Victoria Market, or just languish with the magnificent weeping elm out the front. The room offers high ceilings, a ceiling fan for hotter days, and a sturdy fold-out sofabed, comfortable for two. Bedding is available for a third person with a small extra charge. We are on a convenient street, bordering nearby Melville Rd. Cafes, takeaways and a small supermarket are just around the corner, and two minutes' tram ride takes you to the Union Square shopping precinct.  Brunswick West is a Melbourne suburb 6km north of the CBD, and a lovely quiet spot in the greater Brunswick precinct. 15 minutes' walk or 3 on the bus gets you to hip shopping, cafes, and all sorts of odds and sods on Sydney Rd. 5 minutes' drive gets you onto the Citylink, with another twenty minutes to Melbourne Airport -

Cafes, takeaways and a small supermarket are just around the corner, and two minutes' tram ride takes you to the Union Square shopping precinct.  Brunswick West is a Melbourne suburb 6km north of the CBD, and a lovely quiet spot in the greater Brunswic
properties.neighborhood_overview: Brunswick West is a Melbourne suburb 6km north of the CBD, and a lovely quiet spot in the greater Brunswick precinct. 15 minutes' walk or 3 on the bus gets you to hip shopping and cafes on Sydney Rd. 5 minutes' drive gets you onto the Citylink, with another twenty minutes to Melbourne Airport - perfect if you're flying in.
properties.notes: Allergy suffers should bear in mind we have both cats and chickens.
properties.transit: Getting around is a breeze - two buses and a tram line past the zoo and into the CBD are outside our door. The nearest train station (Brunswick) is about a 15 minute walk, but a brief trip on the tram also sends you to the door of Royal Park Station.
properties.access: You will have access to the majority of the house, including the kitchen, living room, both bathrooms, and the backyard. Make yourselves at home.
properties.interaction: While we'll be out a fair bit of the time, it is a live-in residence. Advice and recommendations is up for offer should you need it.
properties.house_rules: Please respect the house like you live here. - No smoking indoors. You're welcome to sit on the verandah with an ashtray. - No pets - the cat ecosystem is already a delicate one. - Please keep the kitchen tidy if you're making something. - To our international guests - Australia is a very dry country. Consider restricting your showers to 4-5 minutes. - Help the planet, save power. - No parties, raves, or loud conceptual art happenings. Quiet art is okay.
properties.host_about: A self confessed classical music tragic, I live for music, art and cats! In life, I love the journey rather than the destination. As a musician I have travelled Australia extensively and know the country pretty well. When I travel it's to experience, taste, laugh, listen, live and work rather than look at stuff. As a host, my house is yours and I want to know why you have arrived in this beautiful city to help you make the most of your time here. I am passionate about caring for the environment and have solar panels for energy needs and chooks to minimize any household food wastage. I love food but like to leave the car at home when possible so live near the tram that takes you to the amazing Victoria market.

properties.neighborhood_overview: hopping, fashion, dining and entertainment are the main features of South Yarra's extensive commercial precinct. Busy Chapel Street is lined with exclusive retail outlets, cafes, clubs, the popular Jam Factory entertainment complex, the Como Centre and Vogue Shopping Plaza. Commercial Road, which divides South Yarra from Prahran, is home to more retail shops, the Pran Central Shopping Centre and the iconic Prahran Market with its large selection of gourmet foods and fresh produce. Toorak Road is home to restaurants and many stylish fashion retailers featuring the best of local and imported goods. Many of South Yarra's residential areas consist of attractive tree-lined streets. There are several historic mansions, including Como House which is open to the public, clusters of terrace houses and apartment buildings. South Yarra has a large selection of open space and parkland for visitors and residents. The largest areas of parkland are along the Yarra River and also Fawkner Park along So
properties.transit: - South Yarra Station - under 5mins walk (400metres) - Trams at front door to CBD (short ride). - Sure Carparking for your car or rental car. - Car Sharing (by the hour) nearby
properties.host_about:
UNIQUE SHORT STAYS, SOUTH YARRA

Hi There!

I'm a corporate events professional based in East Melbourne/South Yarra in Melbourne. Friendly, easy going & accommodating. I am passionate about events, travel, food, wine, meeting new people & new experiences! 

Our homes are in inner city Melbourne. South Yarra/St Kilda Rd Precinct/East Melbourne. Brillant access to CBD but slightly removed for peace and quiet at night. They are certainly mere minutes from Melbourne's CBD and all major inner Melbourne attractions that make Melbourne "Marvellous".

We aim to provide the most cost effective and best value designer/boutique accommodation in inner Melbourne.  

They are ideal for leisure travellers who are looking for a unique place to call home whilst in Melbourne,or for corporate professionals working short-term in CBD/inner city. Perhaps you're coming to our fair city for one of our many special events....?

If you are interested in one of the properties i have listed but the dates are unavailable, please check my other listings under my profile or please email me through airbnb messaging system, as l will likely have another apartment/home available that will suit your needs.  I am here to provide suggestions where you see fit

Any questions please don't hesitate to call out, look forward to chatting with you about your finer requirements. 

Myself and our events network are here to assist you. More than happy to provide sights/restaurant/event/cafe or transport tips to ensure a memorable, extraordinary, safe  and convenient trip!

I have airbnb on my iphone, so i normally reply rapidly.

Feel free to contact me anytime.

Cheers Alex, Unique Short Stays

properties.neighborhood_overview: St Kilda East is a suburb of Melbourne, Victoria, Australia, 6 km south-east from Melbourne's Central Business. properties.neighborhood_overview: 1 minute walk to Gertrude St bars, restaurants, galleries, cafes and pubs. There's designer boutiques, factory outlets, vintage everything, vinyl stores and the Rose Street market on weekends.  Being a hipster village, the coffee around here is outstanding and the food is fantastic - try Belle's Hot Chicken, George Calombaris' modern Greek offering Jimmy Grants, hot dog from The Roadhouse, all vegan by Smith and Daughters, and fancy night out at Cutler & Co. Local music venues include The Standard, Labor in Vain, The Workers Club and it's a short walk to the Old Bar, Bar Open and the Night Cat. Other awesome night spots within stumbling distance are the Upside Rooftop Bar, Naked for Satan, Bimbos, Union Club and the Rainbow Hotel. Fitzroy is the home of Melbourne's live music scene and has a drinking venue for just about every taste.  Walk 10 minutes in any direction and you'll either end up in Collingwood, North Fitzroy, Lygon Street Carlton or the city. Directly in between Brunswick
properties.transit: Everything in walking distance! Just a ten minute walk to the top of the city (theatre district/Parliament Train Station) or catch a tram to the CBD from Brunswick, Gertrude, Nicholson Streets or Victoria Parade. If you do want public transport, there is a lot around; 86 tram stops on Gertrude street 1 minute walk away at end of street; trams 12 & 109 on Victoria Parade 3 minutes walk away; tram 30 and 11 also nearby; 12 minutes walk to Parliament train station.

properties.neighborhood_overview: St. Kilda has the best of inner city living and the delights of a beachside holiday. This flat is a 10 minute stroll down a quiet tree lined street to St. Kilda beach, where you can swim, stroll or frolic in the bay. Albert Park is a 5 minute walk and is great for cycling or picnicking. The flat is close to Fitzroy street and there are wonderful cafes, bars and eateries all around, with TheatreWorks only 5 minute walk and the cafes and shops of Acland street are only a 15 minute stroll. The foodies paradise of South Melbourne Markets is only a 10 minute tram ride, and Woolworths, Coles and Aldi are all within walking distance.
properties.notes: This is a queer friendly house, open to most genders and orientations. It is located up 3 flights of stairs, and behind 2 security doors. There is no parking, and street parking is difficult. I am omnivorous, but happy to provide a meat free environment during your stay. You cannot bring your pet(s), but you are welcome to enjoy the one that lives here.
properties.transit: There is limited street parking outside. However, the flat is a 2 minute walk to tram stops which offer a choice of a 20 minute tram ride to Southern Cross Station (96), or to the NGV and arts precinct (16).
properties.access: You get to share the Wifi, the bathroom with a huge bathtub, and the modern kitchen and the lounge/dining area. Downstairs there is a communal laundry and courtyard.
properties.interaction: Your host is an artist and design lecturer who is home some days and some evenings, but busy on others, and a friendly indoors cat who is home all of the time. This would suit quiet singles or couples who are mature, clean, and responsible. When I am home I love cooking and sharing a meal and a drink, and am happy to show you the delights of this beautiful suburb.
properties.house_rules: The flat is strictly non smoking and suits moderate or non-drinkers. Random guests are not permitted to stay, and doors need to be kept closed and locked at all times. Please provide your own food and drinks, and no loud music or post-midnight parties.
properties.host_about: I am a contented crazy cat lady who makes art, writes books, teaches design and loves cooking, meditating, karaoke, dancing, riding my bike and living by the water. I speak French and Spanish as well as English and have couched surfed around Europe and the USA. I love meeting new people and learning new things and showing off my city. But I also appreciate the importance of having a calm cosy nest to retreat to when you are travelling, so that is what I want to provide.
