properties.notes: On weekdays, the keys must be picked up from my office in the city. I'll give you the address. My building and neighbours are lovely and quiet however the building is situated on a main road so there is a little bit of traffic noise.
properties.transit: Lots of bars, restaurants and cafes within walking distance. The famous Reverence Hotel is 200m away for the best Mexican, live music and comedy. Plenty of vegan options.  Happy River Café in the Footscray Arts Centre across the street. There is also the Milking Station Café on Bunbury St. Both make great coffee and breakfast. Footscray Market is 500m away. Coles is in Footscray Central on Paisley St. There are several bottle shops around Footscray Central. All within walking distance. Transport: Footscray train station is about 400m from the apartment. Trains to the city depart around every 10 minutes. The train ride is 8 minutes to the city.  To airport: Take the train to Southern Cross Station (6 minutes) and get the shuttle bus to the airport.  You don't need a car this close to the city but you have exclusive use of an off street car parking space if you need it!
properties.access: Every room except for my bedroom is available for you to use. You will also have your own off street car parking space.
properties.interaction: I'm happy to interact with guests or if they want to be left alone, that's fine too :) Whatever makes people comfortable.
properties.house_rules: No smoking inside, on the balcony is fine No extra people No parties No pets No loud noise after 10pm No access to the hosts food or alcohol Don't leave the apartment without the keys Be tidy and respectful, please clean up after yourself Be mindful of the kitty cat The apartment is a calm and peaceful place, so your calm and peace is welcome :)
properties.host_about:
My motto: "Go with kindness"

A lawyer by day, actor by night. I can't live without, coffee, books, wine and friends.

I like a mix of independence and companionship while I travel. I'm always looking to hang with the locals!

properties.name: Modern Living in Fabulous Fitzroy
properties.summary: This is a two bedroom, two bathroom townhouse with an open floor plan kitchen and living area upstairs. We are located in the heart of Fitzroy, one minute from Smith St and 7 mins to Brunswick St. Tram 86 to the city is 120m away. Perfect location!
properties.space: Downstairs: 2 bedrooms (each with one queen bed) and two separate bathrooms. One bathroom is ensuite and the other is nearly ensuite, just next door to the second bedroom. Upstairs: open floor plan kitchen, dining, and living area. The kitchen is fully equipped and the dining table seats four. One wall of the living room is a giant, sliding glass door which opens onto a balcony - our favorite feature of this house!
properties.description: This is a two bedroom, two bathroom townhouse with an open floor plan kitchen and living area upstairs. We are located in the heart of Fitzroy, one minute from Smith St and 7 mins to Brunswick St. Tram 86 to the city is 120m away. Perfect location! Downstairs: 2 bedrooms (each with one queen bed) and two separate bathrooms. One bathroom is ensuite and the other is nearly ensuite, just next door to the second bedroom. Upstairs: open floor plan kitchen, dining, and living area. The kitchen is fully equipped and the dining table seats four. One wall of the living room is a giant, sliding glass door which opens onto a balcony - our favorite feature of this house! You will have the whole house to yourselves, so enjoy! Fitzroy is, in our humble opinion, the best suburb in Melbourne. It's very close to the city, but it has it's own cool vibe. We live 100m from Smith St, which contains more bars and restaurants than you could even attempt to visit. The are some great cheap eats, as well as ups
properties.neighborhood_overview: Fitzroy is, in our humble opinion, the best suburb in Melbourne. It's very close to the city, but it has it's own cool vibe. We live 100m from Smith St, which contains more bars and restaurants than you could even attempt to visit. The are some great cheap eats, as well as upscale restaurants - and everything in between! We are also just 150m from Coles Supermarket and Liquorland, which is also on Smith St. Gertrude St is less than a 5 minute walk away, and also has cool bars and restaurants. Finally, there is Brunswick St, which is also chock full of places to eat and drink. That's about a 7 minute walk away. The beautiful Fitzroy Gardens is just a 10 minute walk, and Carlton Gardens is less than 15 minutes. You can walk to the north-east edge of the CBD in about 20 minutes.
properties.transit: The number 86 tram is just around the corner, on Smith St, about 120m away. This will take you into the city center, down Bourke St, and all the way to Docklands. The number 11 tram runs along Brunswick, and is about a seven minute walk away. This will also take you into the city, along Collins St and ending at Docklands. Trams are a wonderful way to get around Melbourne and we recommend you use them! We have two spare Myki cards, which you are welcome to use. They enable you to ride on any tram, train, or bus in Melbourne.
properties.access: You will have the whole house to yourselves, so enjoy!
properties.house_rules: This is our home, so we kindly ask that you treat it with respect. We do have neighbors on either side of us, so please be courteous with regards to noise levels. We have never had any problems with noise though, so this shouldn't be an issue.
properties.host_about:
Hi, I'm Barbara. I'm originally from Philadelphia but moved to Melbourne in January, 2015. I absolutely love it here! I love to travel and enjoy meeting new people. In my free time I like to run, bike, hike, eat tasty food, drink tasty wine, and of course spend time with friends and family.
I'm new to hosting on AirBnb but I'm looking forward to sharing my home with friendly people. Fitzroy is a wonderful place to live and I look forward to showing others just how great it is!

properties.name: Sunny 2BR Melbourne flat 7kms CBD
properties.summary: Bright, sunny second floor flat in Northcote/Thornbury (a very cool neighbourhood just 7kms from city) with two bedrooms, separate kitchen and light spacious lounge. Just steps away from tram and train to get to CBD in 20 mins. Sleeps up to 5 people.
properties.space: Bright, sunny second floor flat in Northcote/Thornbury (a very cool neighbourhood just 7kms from city) with two bedrooms, separate kitchen and light spacious lounge.  The apartment is equipped with a washing machine and there is unlimited wifi.  The apartment is a very cosy, comfortable space with lots of light and everything you need for a stay in Melbourne, and most importantly it is spotlessly clean! Even if you're only using it as a place to crash after a day of sightseeing, you want to know you're relaxing in a clean place with freshly laundered linen on the beds and soft towels in the bathroom. Being a 2-bedroom flat, it is best suited to groups of up to four. However, I can arrange a fold-out single bed and linen (and additional towels if required) for a fifth person (or just for those who don't want to share one of the queen beds) at a cost of 10/night. I'm also very family friendly, having a child of my own, and love having families stay. The only thing that I ask is that you

Being a 2-bedroom flat, it is best suited to groups of up to four. However, I can arrange a fold-out single bed and linen (and additional tow
properties.neighborhood_overview: Before all the hipsters moved in (just joking! We love hipsters!) Thornbury has historically been home to many Greek-Australians and Italian-Australians, so there are a plethora of great deli's and food stores. Now they sit comfortably alongside hip cafes, bars, health food stores and music venues, mostly along High St, which is just a few minutes walk.  The flat is walking distance to these great sights and attractions: CERES Community Environment Park - a Community park and garden with a nursery, organic market, cafe and mini farm plots Merri Creek bike and walking path - takes you on a scenic route to the city without needing to ride / walk on the road Wesley Anne bar, eatery and live music venue  Psarakos fruit & vege market - cheap fruit, veges, meat and fish only 10 minutes walk away Thornbury Theatre - live music venue Northcote Social Club - a great pub with good meals and a place to see some of Melbourne's finest bands
properties.transit: Croxton Train Station (on the Epping line, also called the South Morang line) is 300m East and will take you to the CBD (Flinders Street Station) in 19 mins. For footy fans, you can get to the famous MCG in 14 minutes by train! Tram stop (Route 112) is 300m west, taking you directly to Brunswick St (Fitzroy) in 12 mins, Melbourne CBD in 22 mins and St Kilda in 50 minutes.  Tram stop (Route 86) is 500m east, taking you down High St (Northcote) in 5 mins, then to Smith St (Collingwood) in 15 minutes and into the CBD in 25 mins. Off street parking is available for one car.
properties.access: Guests will have access to the entire apartment exclusively for their own use. They also can access a shared space at the back of the block where there are a number of shared clotheslines. They can also use the shared laundry on the ground floor, which has coin-operated clothes drier and washing machine. NB. The apartment is equipped with its own washing machine.
properties.interaction: I like to leave my guests to enjoy their stay in Melbourne without interfering too much.  I'll be in touch in the days leading up to your arrival to confirm what time you'll check-in. Late night check-ins are no problem. I'm available 24/7 on my mobile and email if there are any problems. I will then stay in touch via the odd text message or phone call to make sure everything is going smoothly.
properties.house_rules: Complying with the following House Rules is a requirement for permission to enter and occupy the Property.  4.1 General requirements a) Guest and Visitors must comply with all House Rules and instructions from the Host during their stay; and b) Guests must notify the Host of any disputes or complaints from neighbours as soon as is practicable. 4.2 Noise and Residential amenity a) Guests and Visitors must not create noise which may disturb neighbours, especially between 9pm - 8am and during arrival and departure at any time throughout the occupancy; b) Offensive noise is prohibited and may result in termination of your stay, loss of rental paid and extra charges for security and other expenses which may be deducted from your deposit;  c) Guests and Visitors must not engage in anti-social behaviour and must minimise their impact upon neighbours and local community. 4.3 Visitors a) As the apartment is not large, and is in close proximity to neighbours, no more than two Visitors are permit
properties.host_about:
Shaun is a social worker and a musician and Lanie works in communications. We're from Melbourne, Australia.

We love Melbourne for all it's good things (coffee, shopping, cultural diversity and live music) and all it's one bad thing (unpredictable weather).

We rent out our 2-bedroom flat in Melbourne and love to let our guests in on the little secrets that turn them from a tourist into a traveller.

Things we can't live without: sunshine, books, family, fish'n'chips on the beach in summer.

properties.name: Cosy Room
properties.summary: My place is close to public transport, parks, art and culture, and the airport. You’ll love my place because of the comfy bed, the kitchen, and the cosiness. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers. We have a Pet at home who is our family member.

properties.host_about: We are a small family. Myself and my husband. We are a cool easy going couple, Love to interact with new people, sharing ideas and thoughts, we have a great love for music. We respect others privacy and expect the same.

properties.name: Stylish, modern apartment, great location
properties.summary: Modern warehouse style, two level apartment in Glen Iris.  Minutes walk to train station and tram stop.  Only 9 kms to the city and 5kms to Chapel Street Precinct.  Open plan living complete with north facing courtyard with BBQ and outdoor eating area.  Fully equipped kitchen, with indoor dining area and sunken lounge area.  Upstairs is the master bedroom with ensuite and walk in robe and European laundry.
properties.space: The master bedroom has a queen size bed, two side tables, large double robes with built in draws, LED TV, reverse cycle split system for heating and cooling, double roller blind for block out and privacy and private bathroom with large shower and bath.
properties.description: Modern warehouse style, two level apartment in Glen Iris.  Minutes walk to train station and tram stop.  Only 9 kms to the city and 5kms to Chapel Street Precinct.  Open plan living complete with north facing courtyard with BBQ and outdoor eating area.  Fully equipped kitchen, with indoor dining area and sunken lounge area.  Upstairs is the master bedroom with ensuite and walk in robe and European laundry. The master bedroom has a queen size bed, two side tables, large double robes with built in draws, LED TV, reverse cycle split system for heating and cooling, double roller blind for block out and privacy and private bathroom with large shower and bath. The apartment is three levels however guests will not have access to the top level, the second bedroom or bathroom. Guests can contact us at any time during their stay.  Our numbers will be provided directly to guests after booking. Our place is a short walk to Tooronga Village with Coles supermarket, butcher, fruit/vegetable/deli, Fir
properties.neighborhood_overview: Our place is a short walk to Tooronga Village with Coles supermarket, butcher, fruit/vegetable/deli, First Choice Liquor, nail salon, hair salon, newsagent, chemist, take away foods.  There is also Malvern Road and Glenferrie Road with lots of cafes, restaurant and shops.
properties.notes: A cat lives in the apartment with us when not being rented - while we do our best to keep the place clean and tidy, if you are allergic, please be aware of this.  She will not be there while you stay.     Just so you know - the train station is close enough to hear some noise.  The bedroom is located on the south side away from the train station.  Weekdays the last train is 11:45pm, resuming at 5:15am and weekends from 5:15am and running hourly from midnight throughout the night.  We don't even notice the trains anymore but if you have great hearing, you might hear the train.  We leave earplug for guests who are lighter sleepers - with those in, you won't hear a thing.
properties.transit: BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT: Easy access to Monash Freeway, bike paths in and out of the city plus both train and tram access.   To travel on public transport in Victoria you are required to carry a myki card, with myki money on it. For every journey you will need to touch on when boarding and off when exiting. For information on myki cards, getting around etc, see link: (URL HIDDEN)  TRAIN - the 'Glen Waverley Train Line' runs direct to the CBD from Tooronga Station, a 150m walk from the apartment.  It is a 15 minute trip into Flinders Street Station. However, return trips normally go through the city loop which will be a 30 minute journey. TRAM - The Route 72 tram towards Melbourne University runs past Chapel Street, Prahran and through the CBD. The return tram  is the Route 72 tram towards Camberwell.  A trip into the CBD will take approx 45 min into/out of the CBD. Note trip times can be influenced by peak traffic periods as trams share the roads with cars.
properties.access: The apartment is three levels however guests will not have access to the top level, the second bedroom or bathroom.
properties.interaction: Guests can contact us at any time during their stay.  Our numbers will be provided directly to guests after booking.
properties.house_rules: - Strictly no smoking - The property shares common walls so noise should be kept to a minimum after 10pm

properties.name: Transport, Location, Comfort (TLC)
properties.summary: This 1 BR apartment is in the perfect location: with cafes, bars, restaurants, Westgarth Cinema, Merri Creek, and loads of public transport options, there is plenty to please everyone, all in a 500m radius.
properties.space: If you're needing some down-time after experiencing all that Westgarth and Melbourne have to offer, this is a great place to kick back and relax on the couch or grab a coffee and chill on the balcony. This is a lovely, quiet apartment block, and the apartment is set up with everything you might need for your stay.
properties.description: This 1 BR apartment is in the perfect location: with cafes, bars, restaurants, Westgarth Cinema, Merri Creek, and loads of public transport options, there is plenty to please everyone, all in a 500m radius. You will also have access to the kitchen and laundry facilities if required. I will meet you at the start and end of your trip to exchange the key, and show you around. I have some maps and ideas for places to visit, and will leave my number with you for any questions during your stay. The cafe culture around Westgarth is the best in Melbourne. Enjoy your delicious food and coffee whilst people wa
properties.neighborhood_overview: The cafe culture around Westgarth is the best in Melbourne. Enjoy your delicious food and coffee whilst people watching- this area has a fantastic mix of creative, healthy, and multicultural inhabitants.  The nearby nightlife has loads to offer:  - Wander up to the Westgarth cinema- one of the oldest and most beautiful in Melbourne - Check out a gig at The Northcote Social Club.  - For a special occasion, chef's hatted Estelle Bistro is the ideal restaurant.  With public transport at your fingertips: - Jolimont is a 15min train ride to access the MCG or Rod Laver Arena - Flinders st station is 17mins to access the Arts Centre, Fed square or the city life - 86 tram heads along Smith st to access factory outlets, restaurants, cafes and cool bars in Collingwood and Fitzroy: all within 15 mins
properties.notes: Merri Creek is 200m away, and is a beautiful place to stroll if you need a nature fix.
properties.transit: Public transport is at your fingertips: - the 86 tram stops in front of the apartment then heads along Smith st to access factory outlets, restaurants, cafes and cool bars in Collingwood and Fitzroy: all within 15 mins - 300m walk to Westgarth or 500m to Rushall train stations - Jolimont is a 10 min train ride to access the MCG or Rod Laver Arena - Flinders st station is 13mins to access the Arts Centre, National Gallery of Victoria, Fed square or the city life - the 250 and 251 bus stops 200m away, and will take you to numerous city locations
properties.access: Help yourself to a range of tea, coffee, and the breakfast options provided. You will also have access to the kitchen and laundry facilities if required.
properties.interaction: I will meet you at the start and end of your trip to exchange the key, and show you around. I have some maps and ideas for places to visit, and will leave my number with you for any questions during your stay.
properties.host_about: I love to travel, particularly off the beaten track. Around Melbourne, I often head out for a delicious meal, or to catch some live music, so have plenty of recommendations for fantastic locations.

properties.name: Home Away from Home - Central Melbourne
properties.summary: My apartment is on the first floor and is spacious and full of natural light. Your room has a Queen bed and lots of wardrobe space.  There's a sofa bed in the living room if your group is more than 2 people.  It's centrally located in a leafy & quiet street. You can walk to city centre, Docklands & Carlton precinct.  It's also close to all major hospitals and universities.  The huge & beautiful Royal Park is nearby, Errol St cafes & public transport options.  You can also easily order food in =)
properties.space: This is a 2br apartment in a big complex that was renovated 10yrs ago. Every room in this house is spacious and well-lit. I keep the place clean and you have access to all household appliances, cooking in the kitchen if you like and you can use my washing machine.  You get your own mini bar fridge to use and some shelf space if you bring food home.  When you're staying here, make yourself at home - look after the place and it will look after you =) You'll be sharing the apartment with me - I'm friendly, open and love to travel!  Sometimes I work from home and when I can, I'm happy to show you around or answer any questions you have about your trip to Melbourne / Victoria.

When you're staying here, make yourself at home - look after the place and it will look after you =) You'll be sharing the apartment with me - I'm
properties.neighborhood_overview: This is the most central and gorgeous location in Melbourne! It's as if you're in the CBD but with leafy streets and heaps of park lands and much quieter.  I love everything about this area, especially the coffee on Errol St!  The place is super close to the Melbourne Zoo, Docklands, Flinders St (Southbank - Crown Casino, Aquarium), Port Melbourne beach, major universities, Victoria Market, Melbourne Central, Federation Square, Eureka and so much more! Just ask me what you're looking for and I'd be happy to point you in the right direction or recommend a place to eat.
properties.notes: I'm open and flexible ... if you have any special requests just ask and we'll see what we can negotiate =)
properties.transit: Trains:  Melbourne Central or North Melbourne Station Trams: #57 or #59 from Elizabeth St (close to Flinders Station / Melbourne Central) OR   #55 from Williams St Buses: there are several bus routes that pass nearby and go to various locations - you can locate these via (URL HIDDEN) Bike lanes everywhere. Overall, this is a well linked spot. I'm open to negotiating lending you bike - a suitable arrangement can be discussed if the need comes up.
properties.access: You will have access to wifi and full household facilities - there's a spare small fridge just for you, your own cupboard space in the kitchen and bedroom, full bathroom needs (sharing with me if you don't have your own stuff), linen and all bedding provided.  It's a simple but very nice building - there's a cute balcony where you can hang washing or chill out.  There are two entry points into the apartment - security door downstairs (from the street walk to the last set of apartments on your right and find unit 20 on the buzzer).  The front door is also locked - you will have keys to both (one set only).
properties.interaction: I keep maps and info about Melbourne and places to go/see.  I have 2 spare MYKI cards that allow you to use the PT in Victoria and I can show you how to top that up for your trip.  Please know that I do not monitor the money available on the myki cards and it's up to guests to recharge these.  Sometimes the cards might have 1or2 owing on it and you will have to cover that, but it's cheaper than buying a new card for 12.   I have a car space in case you need it.  I also have a car and bike that you can negotiate with me to rent out.  I'd be happy to show you around especially on weekends and after work.  I'm open to cooking together and sharing meals - it all depends on your schedule/interests and my workload.  I have many books you can read and movies you can watch on your laptop.
properties.house_rules: I'm not a smoker and smoking is strictly on balcony only or outside the building.  I like to keep the place clean & tidy.  Open communication and flexibility are wonderful traits. You will be given a set of keys to come & go as you please.  If you lose or damage these keys you will be charged 250AUD for their replacement.
properties.host_about: Fun, social and love to laugh.  Love a great coffee and sharing stories.  Well travelled, multilingual and love to be outdoors.  Working for myself which means I'm flexible with time and sometimes work from home.
properties.street: North Melbourne, North Melbourne, VIC 3051, Australia

properties.space: Modern Unit on the 8th floor of this stunning and up-market complex with many exclusive features. Balcony offers views over Chapel Street, and Melbourne city skyline. For more information, visit our f@ceb00k page by searching for 'Stay South Yarra'.

properties.neighborhood_overview: The Unit is located just 30m from the famous Chapel Street shopping area, offering boutique fashion stores. The Jam Factory entertainment complex (cinema etc) is also on your doorstep. There are many bars, cafes, restaurants offering a wide range of culinary choice and budget. For more information, visit the Chapel St Precinct website by googling 'Chapel Street South Yarra'.
properties.notes: Kitchen includes all necessary amenities so you can cook at your leisure (nearby supermarkets and the Prahran Markets for local/fresh produce), or you can enjoy the many restaurants, bars and cafes in the immediate neighbourhood. There is also a licensed restaurant on the ground floor, and many local restaurants will also offer a delivery.
properties.transit: Route 78 Trams on Chapel Street will take you to Balaclava (south) and Richmond (north). Short walk to Toorak Rd (Route 8) and Commercial & Malvern Rds (Route 72) all of which will take you into Melbourne City. 10 minute walk to South Yarra train station (one stop to Richmond and the MCG Stadium, or two stops to the city centre). If you hire a car, there is a secure basement car park space. Taxis are readily available on Chapel Street. Car Hire available nearby on Punt Road. To be honest, if you are visiting for the first time, you'll hardly want to step out further than Chapel Street ! But if you do, public transport on trams and trains are close by and frequent. You'll need a MYKI ! Ask us for information to obtain one. For Train and Tram info, visit the PTV (Passenger Transport Victoria) Website.

properties.interaction: Owners are available for any assistance and information to make your stay even more relaxing and enjoyable. We want you to enjoy your stay, and most of all, come back again !
properties.house_rules: No smoking within the unit (smoke detectors and sprinklers are installed). We are proud of our unit and would respectfully ask that you keep it clean and tidy - just like your own ! Finally, please respect our neighbours, especially in the evenings. Regrettably, no pets please . And definitely no party's .   Can we also request you turn off Aircon/ Heating  lights when you go out for the day / or when vacating the premises . We like to keep the costs down that we charge you , so to do that we ask you to be respectful of this and save on power were you can .  Thankyou so much ,enjoy your stay and the view from the balcony . Thank you for your cooperation  Regards  Tracey

properties.host_about:
Hi there. 
I am a Graphic Designer mostly working from home. I have lived in Ivanhoe over ten years. Originally I am from Korea. 

I am very independent, easy going and enjoy life. I love dancing(Salsa), art, yoga, traveling(like yourself obviously) and meeting people from all cultures. 

I have travelled to Singapore, Japan, China, Thailand, Indonesia, Laos, Sri Lanka, Philippines, Malaysia, Brunei,  Myanmar, Nepal, England, Scotland, Austria, France, Germany, Czech republic, Dubai and New Zealand etc.

I'm happy to share travel stories, give guests local advice and generally chat. I am very sociable but also respectful of people's personal space.

This place is close to the Austin, Mercy and Repat hospitals. If anyone needs to stay near these I am happy to assist.

Hope to see you some day real soon!

properties.name: Beautiful views & own bathroom
properties.summary: A private bedroom and separate bathroom in a modern apartment in one of Melbourne's most desired locations. The CBD is a 10 minute train ride away and we are close to Fitzroys's best streets to dine & shop. The serenity of the Yarra River is just a stones throw away.
properties.space: This private bedroom has a queen size bed. There is a door from the bedroom to the shared balcony that has views of Victoria Park & the city skyline.   You will also have a private bathroom (this doubles as our powder room for guests so if we have friends over they may use it). This bathroom is not an ensuite, it's about 1 meter away from the bedroom, across the corridor/hallway.

properties.neighborhood_overview: We LOVE our neighborhood!! It is close enough to the CBD so you can enjoy going out and exploring the city, but is in a hidden pocket right by the Yarra River which is so close to nature. There is so much to do and explore, from barbecues & fitness training at Victoria Park (across the road), to the Yarra bike trail, Dight Falls, the boat house, the Abbotsford Convent, Collingwood children's farm.... The shops, bars and cafes are an eclectic mix with a laid back, hipster buzz.
properties.notes: We prefer check in either between 12.30pm and 1.30pm or after 5pm. We are generally flexible with this so please message if you'd like to organise a different check in time. **For those intending to check in after 9pm, please specify check-in time BEFORE booking to see if we can accomodate your request**
properties.transit: Victoria Park train station is just on the other side of the oval. It's a short 8 minute train ride to the CBD. There are also numerous bus routes from nearby Johnston and Hoddle streets. There is a walking/bike track along the river (right behind the apartment building) and it's a 20 minute bike ride to the city.
properties.access: You will have a private bedroom and separate bathroom.  The bedroom has a door that goes directly to the shared balcony with views of Victoria Park and the CBD skyline. You're welcome to use the kitchen (dishwasher, fridge & cooktop) as long as you clean up afterwards. We don't have a microwave.
properties.interaction: We work odd hours so may or may not be home during the day. If we're around, we are happy share a meal and/or head out to one of the numerous wonderful cafes and bars for a drink. **Must love dogs**  The dogs - they're quite large (see pics). They love people, and love cuddles and scratches. They are well trained and don't lick or jump. They're very quiet and sleep a lot, but because they have such strong tails, when they wag them they can be a little loud if they hit a wall while wagging! They ARE allowed on the furniture in the living room but not on the guest room bed.  They usually spend most of the day sleeping on the sofa but they make room for the humans with a gentle nudge.
properties.house_rules: Please be respectful of our space and our pets.  No smoking inside please! You can smoke on the balcony, but please make sure you close all the doors first so that the smoke doesn't get in to the house (all of the residents are non-smokers). We're pretty easy going in general.
properties.host_about: My husband Aman and I are in our early 30s and enjoy sport, art, yoga and socializing.

properties.name: Amazing, sunny Fitzroy Apartment!
properties.summary: We want to welcome you to our lovely apartment in the heart of Smith St, a popular spot in the Fitzroy/Collingwood area of Melbourne. The room available has a big queen bed with a private bathroom and good sized terrace.
properties.space: The bedroom features a double bed. The bathroom is also spacious and would be private for you. (We have our own en-suite in our bedroom) The apartment itself has a large terrace with BBQ and outdoor furniture.  We have WIFI also.
properties.description: We want to welcome you to our lovely apartment in the heart of Smith St, a popular spot in the Fitzroy/Collingwood area of Melbourne. The room available has a big queen bed with a private bathroom and good sized terrace. The bedroom features a double bed. The bathroom is also spacious and would be private for you. (We have our own en-suite in our bedroom) The apartment itself has a large terrace with BBQ and outdoor furniture.  We have WIFI also. The apartment is in a new build block right above a large convenient supermarket, with roof gardens and communal BBQ areas which you are free to roam and use as you wish. We have moved from the UK to Melbourne so are more than happy to welcome guests and give any tips on the area should you wish. We are relaxed and are out a lot but also spend time at home and cook dinner etc and are happy to share a drink with you! Sometimes we are away and may not be at the apartment when you are staying, and if that's the case, our mate will be staying here
properties.neighborhood_overview: Our place is slap bang on the border of Collingwood and Fitzroy. Smith St is great for food, drinks and shopping and it's the quieter sister to the bustling parallel Brunswick Street. It's a short tram ride away from the CBD.
properties.transit: There is a tram stop right outside the apartment block that goes directly into the CBD, and many other tram stops near by that can take you down to the coast (St Kilda). Uber is popular over here so if you have an account it will work over here too. There are good car rental places in the CBD that we can recommend, otherwise there are the usual companies at the airport. We have a parking space in the basement so your hire car can live there happily! And we have lots of advice about how to avoid parking tickets when out and about in Melbourne!

properties.neighborhood_overview: St Kilda, Bayside Neighbourhood. a cruisy 15 minute drive to the famous Acland St shops and Luna Park, Blessington Gardens and the St Kilda Sea Baths. In the immediate vicinty of Oakleigh, a cosmopolitan shopping mall with lots of Greek food cafes, bakclavas, lasagnes and long black coffees, you'll find a handy supermarket open til 11pm, and all your everyday needs, such as fresh bakeries, trendy cafes, plenty of varied restaurant cuisines, and a train station, 20 mins to city.  We are a 10 minute drive to Brighton Beach, and the Brighton Bathing Boxes.  A very peaceful block, with quiet neighbours, if an unwinding Bayside respite is what you're seeking whilst visiting Melbourne, you have found the perfect place. :)
properties.notes: There is free ample street parking, it's on a really quiet street, very peaceful and only a 5 min walk from a local sports oval if you like morning walks. At the end of the street is a supermarket open till 10pm and other shops such as funky cafes with great melbourne quality lattes, bakerys, bottle shops, post office, banks, lots of restaurants and one of those super handy 2 stores! A 10 min drive to Brighton Beach, which is very unwinding to walk along.
properties.transit: 1km from  train station, drive to the Brighton Beach Boxes (a well-known beach in Bayside often seen in  postcards)  20 mins to Flinders st City by train 15 mins to St Kilda Plenty of parks nearby

properties.house_rules: Keep the space beautiful and tranquil! Pretty easy to do, simply this means cleaning dishes as you go and being mindful this is a space for all to enjoy the serenity. Relax, be yourself...of course music and tv are welcome, just at civilised levels. Make yourself comfortable! There is spare spaces in the kitchen and fridge for food storage. Everything is accessible to all, you can come in any time of the day or night, coffee and tea lovers a bonus :-)
properties.host_about:
Art and Dance Therapist, self entrepreneur, residing in  Australia. I love new cultures, nature, creativity and adventures. I enjoy socialising and meeting new people and sharing some stories and laughs. I love creating a beautiful and nurturing home atmosphere, and doing things such as cooking delicious meals, pottering about in the garden, going on beach walks, catching up with friends, having quiet time at home and making and creating art. I also love cats!  
My favourite holiday destination so far is Byron Bay and Bali. I love the hot weather, and all things tropical. And the people in both places are very friendly and open minded and fun. 
I like British comedy, Australian drama series on abc, and documentaries by people such as Louis Theroux. 

5 things I can't live without are: a cat, my friends, my expressive dance classes, music, nature and colour!

My style of hosting is to be friendly and warm, yet respect the space and people and allow ease and comfort to prevail. 

The beauty of Airbnb, is that it seems to bend the truth on the line 'there's no place like home'. It is wonderful that there is this system set up, whereby we can travel anywhere and experience other places, like home, but different, and be warmly welcomed, and do the things we do at home. I like that we can belong anywhere we go, with like-minded people, it opens doors which before never would have been explored.

Within the Freshwater Place Plaza it has a supermarket plus liquor, chemist, doctor’s clinic, ATM’s, restaurants and fast food cafes A little about…. ‘SOUTHBANK’ stretches along the Yarra River from Princes Bridge/St Kilda Rd to Queensbridge Square [apartment location], continuing on past the Crown Casino through to the Melbourne Exhibition Centre at the other end of the Crown Complex. properties.notes: Bookings made via AirBNB are subject to the standard booking terms and conditions displayed on the Platinum Apartments website.  Payment of your deposit constitutes acceptance of our terms and conditions. Please contact us if you would like a copy of these terms prior to booking.  For security reasons, a copy of your Australian Driver’s License or International Passport is required prior to check-in along with confirmed names for all guests staying at the property along with a signed Booking Agreement before access details can be provided.  This is not negotiable!  Please don't book with us if you are not comfortable providing this information.
properties.transit: The apartment centrally located to all of Melbourne's best attractions including the stunning Southbank Promenade, Crown Casino, Arts Centre, Eureka Tower, Melbourne Sea Life Aquarium and all the restaurants, shopping and entertainment that the CBD has to offer. With a location so central most people prefer to explore on foot, and as a bonus trams are now free in the CBD which makes getting around even easier. There is a tram stop outside Freshwater Place about 30-40m about away on Queensbridge Street or catch a train at nearby Flinders St Train Station only 100m over the foot bridge…transport if needed, is so close.  If you are venturing further out, Myki cards can be purchase at the 24 hour convenience store in the Freshwater Place Arcade [6 each]. The apartment is also easily accessible by the Melbourne Airport Skybus shuttle. There are instructions in the apartment about how to arrange a shuttle back to the airport. We do use a preferred chauffeur service - no kickback just good s
properties.access: All Platinum Apartments guests receive a bottle of wine plus a gourmet welcome hamper including tea, coffee, sugar, milk, tasty treats and some basic essentials to get you through the first night or two. We supply luxury toiletries and towels and our beds are made up with top quality linen ensuring a comfortable stay.
properties.interaction: One of Platinum Apartments friendly staff meet you on arrival to give you the security fob, key to the apartment and we will show you how to access the building and all facilities.  We have a home/office within Freshwater Place and are always available to help if and when needed by our guests. FREE APP: Download the Freshwater Place App - it has lots of helpful information about the Building, local area, shopping, transport, facilities, local services, emergency services and procedures...plus lots more
properties.house_rules: Our guests enjoy a truly relaxing and enjoyable stay. In return we ask you display common manners and courtesy for other people.  For us to be able to provide a high standard for our guests, while respecting the rights of the residents who live in the apartment building, we require our guests to comply with certain regulations.  We appreciate that most people do the right thing, however the occasional bad experience has forced us to impose the following conditions.   TERMS & CONDITIONS. A quick explanation – you are renting a self-contained, self-catering short term apartment, you are NOT booking a fully serviced hotel/apartment, so there are requirements that guests/tenants are responsible for that would not apply at a hotel - such as emptying the rubbish bins, and making sure the apartment is left in a tidy manner upon departure. Staff will arrive upon your departure to thoroughly clean and inspect the apartment.  Please treat the property with the same respect as you would your own
properties.host_about:
Hello my name is Helen. Platinum Apartments has been brought to LIFE through the unique collaboration of my husband Heath and I. Our DREAM is to provide apartment style accommodation to the HIGHEST calibre. We have been guided by an uncompromising DESIRE to bring together INTIMATE luxury apartment accommodation that is furnished and serviced to the highest level. 

Beautifully located on the southern BANKS of the YARRA RIVER in Melbourne, PLATINUM APARTMENTS sets the BENCHMARK for LUXURY self-contained apartment accommodation in AUSTRALIA. 

LAVISHLY appointed and offering an IMPECCABLE standard of customer service and attention to detail. Platinum Apartments is a vacation rental that truly UNDERSTANDS the meaning of OPULENCE.

We want our guests to feel WELCOME from the moment they walk through the door.  Our MOTTO is, Enter as strangers, leave as FRIENDS, and for many of our guests, this is exactly what happens. 

Our team strives hard to bring unrivalled PERSONAL touches and QUALITY, ensuring Platinum Apartments is not just an apartment but a HOME AWAY from HOME and an experience you will LOVE. 

All of Platinum Apartments Melbourne luxuriously apartments have SPECTACULAR VIEWS to the city or Port Phillip Bay and feature a TRULY UNIQUE level of comfort and finish. Our inventory also includes PENTHOUSE apartments that overlook the beautiful skyline of Melbourne.

When you are staying in Platinum Apartments you are right in the HEART of Melbourne, close to all the attractions to make your holiday a MEMORABLE one. 

You will find ACTIVITIES and ATTRACTIONS for you and your significant other as well as to suit your entire FAMILY. There will also be many restaurants that will TEMPT your taste buds. So what are YOU waiting for, reserve online today and enjoy a luxurious short stay holiday in beautiful MELBOURNE, Australia.

Our expert STAFF are also HERE to HELP you plan or answer any questions you may have. We are available and on call 24 hours a day for any issues that may arise while you are here. For further information please do not hesitate to CALL us. 

All PHOTOS are TRUE, the apartment booked is the apartment you stay in. The location is the best right in the HEART of the CBD and situated right next door to Melbourne's Crown Casino on SOUTHBANK Promenade.

properties.name: Bright garden studio in Yarraville!
properties.summary: Welcome to my garden studio in Yarraville Village! Self-contained with basic, small kitchenette, fully insulated, super comfy bed, aircon, your own entrance through the side gate, and a friendly labrador to welcome you home.
properties.space: Hi! Welcome to my garden studio in the delightful Yarraville Village - a mere stone's throw from great cafes and shops, the Sun Cinema and bookshop, and the seasonal pop up park. I am super close to the train, so getting in and out of the city is really convenient - about a 15 minute ride, but there is also parking close by if you have a car. The studio is new, and I am still working on making the garden nice again, so you will likely see me pottering about the place when I get the chance.  You have your own separate entrance via the side driveway, and a small kitchenette with convection microwave, portable electric hotplate, and grill. There is no television, as too many people bring their own devices these days anyway, and internet here is pretty great. If you are desperate though, I should be able to set you up with a temporary streaming TV.  I have fully insulated the new studio with double glazing, so you shouldn't need the airconditioner too much, but it's there for you on those

properties.access: You will have access to the studio and the garden. You will also be able to access the washing machine upon request.
properties.interaction: I live in the house, which is separate to the studio, and I tend to give you your privacy as much as possible, though I have some great tips on where to go/what to see/how to get there. I will be here to welcome you and answer any questions, but I usually leave you to yourselves to enjoy my beautiful city.
properties.house_rules: Guests should be generally respectful, and I won't tolerate any racist or sexist language or attitudes in my home. The great thing about Airbnb is meeting all different people from various backgrounds, and I hope that you share these views. Guests should not be scared of dogs or be abusive to any animals. This will not be tolerated on any level. Violence or abuse of any being for that matter, will also result in the immediate involvement of the police. Guests must not smoke inside ever, and please try to refrain from smoking near windows/doors. I have also made a concerted effort to reduce the my home's footprint on the environment. Please be environmentally conscious and turn off all heating/cooling, lights and fans when not in the studio and refrain from having the airconditioner on while the doors/windows are open.  Water is also a precious and fading resource here in Melbourne, so keeping your showers shorter is appreciated.
properties.host_about:
Hey there!!

I am Lana from Melbourne, Victoria, Australia. I only JUST realised that Airbnb had prefilled this profile for me with the following: I love reading, listening to music and watching my favorite shows on TV. Not necessarily true - I do indeed love reading, but watching TV is very very rare, even though I do have one.

A little about the REAL me: I am a puppeteer and performer, currently working part time at the State Library. I have Auslan and some old French skills I haven't used in a while, so if you are Deaf or French, we could communicate in either English or one of those languages! I am fairly social, but a complete workaholic, so you may find me always working in my studio, writing or other stuff.

I do love meeting new people and travellers, so am excited about meeting you and making you feel welcome - in between the workaholic business that is!

xLana

properties.name: The Court -  Big Family Terrace near Beach & CBD
properties.summary: This modern 3 floor,  3 bedroom former Squash Court was recently fully refurbished. It’s now a huge, classy and luxurious home away from home with secure on site car parking, large garden and 2 delightful outdoor terraces. Ideally situated close to shopping, nightlife, transport, Albert Park with its beautiful lake, gardens and playgrounds and of course the famous St Kilda beach. Perfect for your next family holiday. An ideal base for business and conference travellers. 我期待着欢迎你到我美丽,豪华的房子附近的海滩。
properties.space: A security entrance admits you to the peaceful front garden. If you have a car you’ll be parking it in the secure on-site carport. Follow the path through the trees and step inside.  A double height void lined with north-facing double glazed windows floods the modern fully equipped kitchen and dining room with light. Two sets of double doors open into a shaded tree-lined courtyard ready for al fresco dining under the pagola. The comfortable lounge room is equipped with Bose Surround Sound and playstation. A fully equipped separate laundry completes the ground floor. Up the timber and iron staircase are 2 spacious bedrooms, one with Queen sized bed and full walk in robe, the other with two king singles and large built in cupboards. A generous bathroom has a full sized bath as well as shower. On the third floor you’re up in the tree tops looking out over St Kilda. Your bedroom is a private retreat with queen sized bed, balcony, en-suite and robes. A further private rear courtyard for rel

properties.neighborhood_overview: You’re situated in Melbourne’s most vibrant, energetic and diverse neighbourhood. Best of all, everything that you need is only a few steps away.  It’s a few steps to your local "Woolies" supermarket. Adjacent is St Kilda station. Jump on the light rail here and be whisked away to South Melbourne Market, Crown Casino the CBD and beyond to Carlton, Fitzroy and Brunswick. Or continue around the corner to enjoy a Melbourne coffee. Dine at any of the myriad of cafes and restaurants ranging from neighbourhood haunts to international class fine dining. Party into the early hours at a local nightspot or enjoy a quiet nightcap in a cosy local bar. Catch some theatre or live music. Stroll along St Kilda Beach to the famous Pier and beyond to Luna Park and Acland Street or jog around beautiful Albert Park Lake. It’s all close by.
properties.notes: During your stay please enjoy with our compliments: - Coffee machine and pods - A big range of teas - black and herbal - Some basics - and a few treats - to get you started - Free unlimited internet - Our library of books, games and DVDs - A welcoming bottle of something good.
properties.transit: The Skybus Airport Shuttle stops around the corner. It’s an ideal way to transfer to and from the airport. Alternately a taxi will cost around AU75. Once here getting around will be easy. A MYKI card will be available for your use for the duration of your stay. MYKI is Melbourne’s public transport smart card system. The same card can be used to pay for all public transport in Melbourne – trains, trams and buses. Just charge the card with credit  at any 7-11 and off you go.   The 96 tram (light rail) is a fast and direct route to the CBD and beyond. Take the 16 tram along Fitzroy Street to Balaclava, Caulfield, Malvern, Hawthorn and Kew. There’s a fabulous website called JourneyPlanner which will plan your public transport route to any destination in Melbourne. Melbourne’s Bike Share scheme has blue bicycle stands from which bikes can be hired scattered throughout Melbourne. The closest one is around the corner on West St Kilda Beach, or on Fitzroy Street outside the Bowls Club. Rates

Our homes are in inner city Melbourne. South Yarra/St Kilda Rd Precinct/East Melbourne. Brillant access to CBD but slightly removed for peace and quiet at night. They are certainly mere minutes from Melbourne's CBD and all major inner Melbourne attractions that make Melbourne "Marvellous".

properties.neighborhood_overview: All around, a quirky, unique, classic yet renovated 2 level Victorian Terrace/Shop Front Home (converted dwelling on CBD side of South Yarra, 200m from the wonderful Fawkner Park. If you're looking for extra living space at a budget price then this place is for you! It's stylish but not luxury From here you can walk or short train/tram ride to some of Melbourne's finest spots, the Yarra River, the Botanical Gardens, Fed Square,the city, Southbank and more. Dine on street, people watch, enjoy fashion, glamour and style all day, every day, all year round. Shopping’s the name of the game in South Yarra, where Chapel Street reigns supreme. The fashion strip contains all manner of high-end designer boutiques, chain-stores, hipster hang-outs, cinemas and gift shops. There’s also a seemingly unlimited array of cafes and restaurants to help revive weary shoppers by day, and bars and clubs to keep the buzz going at night. Naturally then, South Yarra attracts the young, hip and fashion conscious

UNIQUE SHORT STAYS, SOUTH YARRA

Hi There!

I'm a corporate events professional based in East Melbourne/South Yarra in Melbourne. Friendly, easy going & accommodating. I am passionate about events, travel, food, wine, meeting new people & new experiences! 

Our homes are in inner city Melbourne. South Yarra/St Kilda Rd Precinct/East Melbourne. Brillant access to CBD but slightly removed for peace and quiet at night. They are certainly mere minutes from Melbourne's CBD and all major inner Melbourne attractions that make Melbourne "Marvellous".

We aim to provide the most cost effective and best value designer/boutique accommodation in inner Melbourne.  

They are ideal for leisure travellers who are looking for a unique place to call home whilst in Melbourne,or for corporate professionals working short-term in CBD/inner city. Perhaps you're coming to our fair city for one of our many special events....?

If you are interested in one of the properties i have listed but the dates are unavailable, please check my other listings under my profile or please email me through airbnb messaging system, as l will likely have another apartment/home available that will suit your needs.  I am here to provide suggestions where you see fit

Any questions please don't hesitate to call out, look forward to chatting with you about your finer requirements. 

Myself and our events network are here to assist you. More than happy to provide sights/restaurant/event/cafe or transport tips to ensure a memorable, extraordinary, safe  and convenient trip!

I have airbnb on my iphone, so i normally reply rapidly.

Feel free to contact me anytime.

Cheers Alex, Unique Short Stays

Filled with beautifully restored Australian antiques, this cosy space comfortably accommodates two with room for extras on the fold out couch.  The unit is self-contained, so you have your own bathroom, kitchen, and a very private balcony. The pantry is stocked with a few basics, including jams and spreads, cereal, fruit, bread, and milk. As a guest you have also access to the shared garden which is perfect for an afternoon of relaxation. You have the place to yourself while I'm in the main house, should you need anything. This quiet and secluded neighbourhood really does have it all! You have the Clifton Hill shopping village on your backdoor step with shops to meet your every need (check out the guidebook for just a few of the highly recomme
properties.neighborhood_overview: This quiet and secluded neighbourhood really does have it all! You have the Clifton Hill shopping village on your backdoor step with shops to meet your every need (check out the guidebook for just a few of the highly recommended places to frequent), and it's just a short stroll to the renowned Edinburgh Gardens, the child friendly Darling Gardens, and Merri Creek trail.
properties.transit: There is on street parking, and ample access to trams, trains, buses, and cycle paths. With just a 15 minute train ride to the CBD, 5 minutes to Smith, Gertrude, and Brunswick streets, and the iconic 86 tram line, the city is literally moments away. Downloading PTV and Tram Tracker apps before arriving is highly recommended. Taxis generally cost 50 - 60 from the airport. Alternately, you can catch the Skybus to Southern Cross station and then take your pick of either the train or the 86 tram to get here. You'll need a Myki to get around the city and these are available to purchase from the Airport, news agents, and major stations.  Message me to find out if pick up from the airport is a possibility (15 fee per person).
properties.access: The unit is self-contained, so you have your own bathroom, kitchen, and a very private balcony. The pantry is stocked with a few basics, including jams and spreads, cereal, fruit, bread, and milk. As a guest you have also access to the shared garden which is perfect for an afternoon of relaxation.
properties.interaction: You have the place to yourself while I'm in the main house, should you need anything.
properties.house_rules: Make yourself at home in my home! Pets are allowed but there is strictly no smoking inside the house (outside is fine and makes for the perfect opportunity to smell the flowers or star gaze while getting some nicotine in. I'll provide a jar for butts).
properties.host_about:
I moved here from New Zealand around 6 years ago and now there's no looking back. I love visual arts, learning languages, and increasing my repertoire of unusual and outmoded skills. I am also an expert on Melbourne's public transport system and am happy to offer any advice where I can. When I travel, I like to take my time to get an authentic feel for the place I am in and the people I am with. 

I look forward to sharing my nest in one of the best suburbs in one of the greatest cities in the world.

properties.neighborhood_overview: Carlton is officially known as Melbourne's "little Italy", a unique mix of bustling restaurants, tree-lined streets, beautiful terrace houses, gorgeous produce stores, gift shops & wine bars. We're truly in the hub of it all, and the perfect spot to start a tour of the city your tastebuds won't soon forget. Sample some of the world's best coffee at Seven Seeds or Market Lane, maybe breakfast or lunch a bit further afield at Small Victories or Auction Rooms. Purchase beautiful produce from the Queen Victoria Markets or the perfect bottle of wine from Rathdowne Cellars, and have a browse in the world-famous Readings book shop. Walk to Fitzroy's hub-of-chic Brunswick, Gertrude or Smith streets, all filled with artisan shops and fabulous places to eat & drink. If it's the weekend you might like to check out the Rose St Artist Market, or see an independent film at cinema Nova and stop for amazing gelato at Pida Pippo. Finish your day with the locals at one of our favourite wine bars Town Mo
properties.notes: A small deposit is required to cover the cost of replacing the electronic house key if lost.
properties.transit: Trams are ubiquitous in Melbourne, and we've got several just outside the station doors. We have reloadable transport cards available for you to use so you don't have to organise your own, and most popular areas/attractions are only a short walk away! Also, bike paths ensure a smooth ride throughout the city and inner suburbs, either on your own wheels of the public bikes around town.
properties.access: There is secure access to both the building and apartment, and you'll have your own private room with a Queen-sized bed to relax in. Otherwise, you'll be sharing the apartment with my girlfriend and I.
properties.interaction: I work full time, so the place is yours on weekdays, but I'm usually home at night for dinner and a chat, or out and about most weekends.  Of course you can always ask for recommendations or advice on some of our favourite spots if you're looking for a coffee in the morning, etc.

properties.host_about:
I am 33 years old & originally from England. I work in the bar/restaurant/hotel industry. Designing, setting them up & running them. I've spent the last 14 years living in 14 countries, mainly Asia & mainly with work. Living in hotels, once for nearly a year. I moved back to Melbourne 3.1/2 years ago after living here 12years ago (because it felt more like home than anywhere I've been). I know Melbourne very well & even give locals advice on where to go. Especially the restaurant, bar, cafe/coffee scene from my work in the industry.

I am very active, so if not at work, in the gym/pool, yoga, climbing, etc.

Eat healthily when i can to balance out when i like to indulge, read a lot, like movies & nice drinks (Everything from 1 of my 100+ Teas to fine Tequila)

I'm very easy going & tend to interact with people based on how they interact with me. So if you want your own space to do your own thing, you'll barely notice me. If you want someone to help make the most of your stay in Melbourne, i'm all yours...

We are happy to share the books, DVD's and magazines in the apartment and book swapping is more than acceptable but please remember that the guests that will follow you may also enjoy the movies on offer. If anything is broken or needs replacing please let us know.  These things happen and we can only get it fixed if you keep us informed. And, of course please remember this is a no-smoking venue.
properties.host_about:
Hi,
An English girl abroad I first visited Australia in 2008.  My then 4 year old daughter and I toured the East coast in a camper van and completely fell in love with this gloriously laid-back country. Melbourne became our home over 6 years ago and  I have to say, I love this place.
I love the beach, I love the creativity you find within every nook and cranny of this city, I love the coffee, the cheap eats and cafes, the fancy restaurants and global cuisines. I love the markets, the lost afternoons at the park with the kids, I love the stunning views offered by a walk around the famous Albert Park lake, the glorious summer days and the rugged up winters but most of all I love sharing it, enjoying Melbourne with family, friends, sharing her secrets with visitors.
As your host I am more than happy to offer as much help and advice as I can to help you get the best from your time here in St Kilda and Melbourne.  I hope that our studio provides everything you may need during your stay and I trust that you will call if there is anything further we can do.

properties.neighborhood_overview: Location is everything! Prahran is a busy little hub which is situated approx 4kms or 3 train stops from the city.  It has an abundance of trendy bars, cafes and restaurants and if you're after a spot of shopping, there are plenty of boutique and high street shops along Chapel Street.   There's no need to catch a cab as there is so much on offer right at your door step - all within walking distance.  There are even shops downstairs! • Boutique shopping on Chapel & Greville Street • Prahran Markets - full of gourmet food. • Cafes, bars & restaurants (see below) • Prahran Train station (5 min walk) • Trams along Chapel Street & Commercial Road • Jam Factory & Como cinemas (10-15 min walk) • Prahran outdoor pool (5 min walk) • Supermarkets next door • Gyms offering casual visits (Cato St - opp balcony) Prahran and Windsor has seen an abundance of new and very cool restaurants popping up around Chapel and High Street (1 block down). Some of the local faves which are a 5 mins walk: - Dukes

properties.host_about:
Hi All,

Originally from the UK I'm lucky enough to have the pleasure of calling Melbourne my home and owning a 2 bed apartment.  I have travelled a bit and lived in shared houses a fair bit in the past. I would be happy to give advise on melbourne if you need any.

I work in a regular office job (8-5ish mon-fri), play hockey so spend plenty of time training and playing.  I also try to get to some of the many restuarants/cafes.

I tend to be out a fair bit or you'll find my cooking or maybe watching something on Netflix.  I try and keep the place tidy.  

I have travelled a bit and have experienced massive shared dormitories to top notch hotels (through work!) to camping. Hopefully you agree I can offer a safe, homely place to stay with all the necessities you need (including plenty of tea as I work for a tea company!!) and am happy to share my tips.

properties.neighborhood_overview: St Kilda is home to many of Melbourne's famous visitor attractions including Luna Park, the Esplanade Hotel, Acland Street and Fitzroy Street. It is home to St Kilda Beach, Melbourne's most famous beach, several renowned theatres and several of Melbourne's big events and festivals.
properties.notes: Location wise, you could not be in a better position with the vibrant heart of St Kilda literally at your door step. The apartment, however, is set on the first level of the block so when you are done eating or drinking at one of the many restaurants or bars you can retreat to your lofty oasis away from the noise and bustle of this famous area. The famous Albert Park Lake, Fitzroy St and St Kilda Junction are all around the corner for easy access into the city. Don't forget the beach, that too is only a 10 minutes walk along with Luna Park and many other great attractions. Getting to and from the city is as easy as jumping on one of the many trams along Fitzroy St or from St Kilda junction (which is a minutes walk away) and you'll be in the city directly in 15-25 minutes time.
properties.transit: Public transport couldn't be easier with the trams of St Kilda leading you to a myriad of top Melbourne locations. There are few tram stops around. The closest is 50m and the one that goes to City is 100m. Very close.  It is hard to say how long it will take to get to city by tram as I drive a car, but Myki website says it is 24 min ride. There's is a train station about 500m away and my sister goes to city every day and it takes her 10-15 min by train. You do need a Myki card and it cost 10 to get the card and the trips are 3.90 for 2hrs or 7.80 for the full day.  Shoot me a mail with any questions about getting around and I will be sure to help.
properties.access: You can enjoy the privacy of the entire apartment and it has an off street parking/undercover carpark in case you rent a car.
properties.interaction: The apartment has everything you can possibly need - fully size European kitchen with all you need for cooking home dinners, it has high speed (15-19Mbps) unlimited WiFi, split system cooling and heating and so on, but in case you need something else, I live 5 min away and can always help you with anything. Just email me or sms me.

properties.name: Comfortable Clean Room in Richmond Great Location
properties.summary: Private lockable room in original 1920's heritage house. Located in inner city suburb Richmond, close to public transport, CBD, sports and entertainment precinct and many cafes and restaurants. 2 minute walk to tram stop. Please ensure you read the complete listing prior to booking.
properties.space: We are located in a quiet street off Bridge Road. We are a family of 3 (and 2 dogs) and we live in a very friendly neighbourhood. The room is located at the back of our house with its own entrance. There is a comfortable queen bed and a small desk setup for your laptop and to recharge all your technologies. You also have your have your own kitchenette set up for cooking. This includes your own bar fridge, a microwave oven and electric stovetop, kettle, toaster, Nespresso and coffee plunger. There is also an area outside of your room which where we have set up a washing up area which is for your use (to be shared with other guest room). Your room is comfortable and clean and is best suited to travellers wanting to make the most of their time in Melbourne and spend it living with some locals.

properties.neighborhood_overview: Richmond is around 4km from Melbourne CBD. We have created a little guidebook for your room which has all our best recommendations plus a free map you can take to help you get around. Bridge Rd is at your doorstep and is regarded as Melbourne's best food and shopping strips. You will also find natural bushland nearby at the Yarra River and there are many parks and gardens nearby. There are many gyms, yoga studios and recreation centres around. Richmond is home to all the major sporting grounds (MCG (AFL, Cricket), Melbourne Tennis Centre (Australian Open), Rod Laver Area / Hisense Area (Major concert venue) and more..
properties.notes: MUST LOVE DOGS! We are currently training our 2 small old dogs to be more friendly to visitors. They may bark upon your arrival however they won't bite, and are generally really chilled. We currently have another guest room set up at the back of the property. Like the majority of original heritage homes, the toilet is located at the back of the property.
properties.transit: 2 minute walk to the nearest tram stop which will take you directly into the city. 7 minute walk to the nearest train station (Burnley Train Station).  30 minute walk to Melbourne city centre. 20 minute walk to the MCG. We are more than happy to assist you with any transportation. Bikes available for use (upon request). Taxi's are always around Bridge Rd or we can call one for you - 13CABS
properties.access: WIFI Internet Kitchenette - Bar fridge, Microwave oven and Stove top, Kettle, Toaster, Coffee Plunger, Nespresso etc. TV & DVD Player Large selection of DVD's Study desk and chair Heater / Fan (depending on weather) Washing machine available MYKI travel cards available (upon request). Credit must be added. You will not have access to the front of the house as this is where we live.
properties.interaction: We share the bathroom and toilet so you will generally see us around most days. We're happy to help you with any info you need to get around. We have used Airbnb during our travels and look forward to meeting new people.
properties.house_rules: No smoking inside - Smoking in backyard is ok. Please be mindful of noise when arriving and departing & ensure front gates are closed (so dogs don't escape). Please clean up after yourself. Please ensure you have read the listing completely. Toilet is located at the back of property.
properties.host_about:
Hi there!

We love to travel, the great outdoors and enjoying life to the fullest.

Some of our hobbies include (but not limited to): Hiking, Fishing, Cycling, Art, Photography, Surfing, Camping, Gardening, Graphic Design, Food and Road Trips.

We love animals and have two 9 year old dogs - a Pug and a Poodle. They are permanent residents of our house and we are currently training them to be kind to new visitors. They are chillers.

We also have a ridiculously adorable 1.5 year old baby girl who will (most likely) greet you with the biggest smile you will ever see.

We have travelled through Canada, USA, Mexico, Cuba, Guatemala and Indonesia and although we still have the travelling bug, we are enjoying this new phase of life - relaxing, raising babies and vegetables and creating our own community in our little urban farm.

Come stay with us!

properties.host_about:
Art and Dance Therapist, self entrepreneur, residing in  Australia. I love new cultures, nature, creativity and adventures. I enjoy socialising and meeting new people and sharing some stories and laughs. I love creating a beautiful and nurturing home atmosphere, and doing things such as cooking delicious meals, pottering about in the garden, going on beach walks, catching up with friends, having quiet time at home and making and creating art. I also love cats!  
My favourite holiday destination so far is Byron Bay and Bali. I love the hot weather, and all things tropical. And the people in both places are very friendly and open minded and fun. 
I like British comedy, Australian drama series on abc, and documentaries by people such as Louis Theroux. 

5 things I can't live without are: a cat, my friends, my expressive dance classes, music, nature and colour!

My style of hosting is to be friendly and warm, yet respect the space and people and allow ease and comfort to prevail. 

The beauty of Airbnb, is that it seems to bend the truth on the line 'there's no place like home'. It is wonderful that there is this system set up, whereby we can travel anywhere and experience other places, like home, but different, and be warmly welcomed, and do the things we do at home. I like that we can belong anywhere we go, with like-minded people, it opens doors which before never would have been explored.

properties.neighborhood_overview: South Yarra is one of the hottest and hippest destinations in Melbourne. Located 10 mins from the CBD, you have everything you need right at your doorstep. A hot spot for fashionistas and those who love their fine food, the area boasts fantastic local and international designers, great cafes and restaurants. Downstairs - in the building you have  Adriano Zumbo's flagship Melbourne store (the famous dessert chef from Sydney), and Two Birds One Stone (the sister cafe to Three Bags Full, one of the most iconic cafes in Fitzroy), and a hotspot for brunches and awesome breakfasts. The apartment is also near to several major attractions  - 15 mins walk (8 mins tram) to St Kilda Rd sights including the Shrine of Remembrance - 20 mins walk (10 mins tram) to the Royal Botanical Gardens - 10 mins by tram to the Melbourne Grand Prix - 15-20 mins by tram to St Kilda Beach/Fitzroy St - 15 mins walk (3 mins train ridge) to the MCG/Rod Laver Arena

properties.transit: Melbourne is Australia's capital of culture and sport. Victoria's state capital really does hold  something for everyone, whether you're interested in catching a game at the MCG, sipping a chai latte  in one of Melbourne's hidden laneways, or sunning yourself in the beautiful parks and gardens.  Melbourne is home to large sporting events like the Australian Grand Prix, the Australian Open tennis  championship and cricket's Boxing Day test match. It's also the birthplace of AFL.  With so much going for this amazing city, it's no coincidence that The Economist named Melbourne as  the world's most liveable city three times in recent years.

properties.neighborhood_overview: Coburg is conveniently located just a tram or train ride away from the city. Sydney Rd is full of lots of amazing Turkish and Lebanese cafés up the Coburg end and many great restaurants and bars further down in Brunswick. The house is located in the grounds of the old Pentridge Prison, many parts of which are available to wander around, including a new cafe, "Jury" which has great coffee! Just around the corner is the beautiful Coburg Lake Reserve with cycling paths, play equipment and BBQ facilities. I will provide details of the best things in the area to check out!
properties.notes: I have a medium hair cat named Moses and a Tonkinese cat called Leo who are both friendly and low maintenance. They have a cat flap so come and go as they please, you would just have to feed them once a day.

properties.house_rules: Come to St Kilda and enjoy yourself! In doing so please be respectful of our space. We are happy to share the books, DVD's and magazines in the apartment and book swapping is more than acceptable but please remember that the guests that will follow you may also enjoy the movies on offer. If anything is broken or needs replacing please let us know. These things happen and we can only get it fixed if you keep us informed. And, of course please remember this is a no-smoking venue.
properties.host_about:
Hi,
An English girl abroad I first visited Australia in 2008.  My then 4 year old daughter and I toured the East coast in a camper van and completely fell in love with this gloriously laid-back country. Melbourne became our home over 6 years ago and  I have to say, I love this place.
I love the beach, I love the creativity you find within every nook and cranny of this city, I love the coffee, the cheap eats and cafes, the fancy restaurants and global cuisines. I love the markets, the lost afternoons at the park with the kids, I love the stunning views offered by a walk around the famous Albert Park lake, the glorious summer days and the rugged up winters but most of all I love sharing it, enjoying Melbourne with family, friends, sharing her secrets with visitors.
As your host I am more than happy to offer as much help and advice as I can to help you get the best from your time here in St Kilda and Melbourne.  I hope that our studio provides everything you may need during your stay and I trust that you will call if there is anything further we can do.

properties.neighborhood_overview: Centrally located in the heart of Melbourne’s Art precinct, minutes walk to the NGV, ACCA, Federation Square, Flinders Street station, Eureka Towers, Botanic Gardens. Sturt Street is reasonably quiet: with minimal foot and road traffic. There is great access to the essentials: a supermarket with bottle shop is a 3 minute walk just across the road, and plenty of dining options with restaurants/ home delivery/ takeaway food options within 10 minutes at Southbank.
properties.transit: Getting around is easy, with Flinders Street Station 10 minutes walk away with all trains feeding into Melbourne’s suburbs north, east, south and west from this central hub, St Kilda Rd trams 5 mins walk, or the Number 1 tram right outside the door.  Walking to Southbank promenade, or Melbourne’s Cbd are 5-10 minutes away, and bike hire is available close by. This central location makes exploring Melbourne easy.
properties.access: Rates include up to 2 people, 2 night minimum stay. Pool, spa, tennis court, gym. 2 courtyards, with BBQ facilities and outdoor dining table. Secure parking available for an additional fee.  A large screen TV, and a selection of movies. Kitchen fully equipped for cooking, dishwasher, fridge/freezer, electric oven and stove top, stove-top coffee brewer, microwave, kettle, toaster. European laundry with washing machine dryer combination (excellent for loads up to 4kg with a fast 1 hour wash and dry cycle to 100% dry). 1 bedroom with a queen size bed, ample clothing storage (hanging and drawers), alarm clock. There is also a single daybed in the lounge area that can accommodate one person. 1 bathroom, with shower, bath and separate toilet (the bathroom is accessed via the bedroom). Ground floor access in a secure block. Fresh towels and linen are provided and included in the price. Additional fees Secure parking: 10 per night (please book this with us prior to your stay). Additional gues
properties.interaction: We are always available by phone, and happy to chat anytime to help make your stay enjoyable. In addition a detailed welcome book is available in the apartment with all the essential information; from how to operate the washing machine - to where the closest supermarket is.
properties.house_rules: The apartment is set in a quiet block, where the neighbours are all respectful of noise levels: parties and loud music are not allowed. The body corporate is keen to keep the relaxing nature of the block: as such fines are imposed on guests who don't respect the rules. So whilst it is definitely not a party place: it is a relaxing place to get away, relax and enjoy exploring Melbourne.
properties.host_about:
We are an Australian couple living in Central Victoria near the goldfields town of Castlemaine. Al is a musician and manages a local cafe, and Jessie is a visual artist and designer. Our home is just over an hour from Melbourne and we can always be contacted via phone, or be on hand when needed.

We love living in the country amongst a bush setting, and equally enjoy a Melbourne fix: seeing live music, exploring the great restaurants, cafes and bars, going to exhibitions and events, and generally enjoying the melting pot that is Melbourne.

Our haven in the arts precinct is such an easy and relaxing way to enjoy Melbourne, and we love visiting it occasionally - we hope you do too. We really enjoy travelling in general, and have set it up with all the essentials we find we look for to make it a homely stay. If you have any questions please don't hesitate to get in touch.

The bare Tasmanian Oak floorboards throughout and freshly painted walls exude a sense of holiday calm. All complimented by a unique eclectic décor reflecting the owner's creative bent and love of Danish furniture.  The one accessible bedroom has a comfortable Queen Size bed (for couple guests) or a single mattress (for single guests).
