properties.neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in one of Melbourne's most sort after suburbs.  It is characterised by wide streets, heritage buildings, terraced houses, open air cafes, parks and significant stands of mature exotic trees.  And, of course, once a year, it is the home of the Australian Grand Prix that courses around the picturesque banks of Albert Park Lake. Melbourne's iconic trams rumble up Victoria Avenue immediately outside the apartment and the neighbourhood comes alive during the summer with the many Melbourne residents wishing to take advantage of the sun, sand and beach only 100 metres distant.  The foreshore is the place for joggers, walkers, skaters, cyclists and for those who just want a leisurely (website hidden) Kilda is in one direction and Port Melbourne in the other.  (Bike hire is within 100 metres of the apartment).   For the inquisitive that are also energetic, Melbourne city is a walk to be enjoyed from the apartment (one hour).  Restaurants are many and guests will be spoi
properties.notes: No
properties.transit: Public transport has never been so convenient - the Number 1 tram stops (terminates) immediately outside the apartment block and with a ten minute tram ride guests can be in the centre of the city.  The tram will conveniently drop passengers outside the arts centre precinct or at Melbourne's most famous landmark Flinders Street Train Station.  From here all of Melbourne and its suburbs are available by train.  As mentioned previously, public bike hire is 100 metres away and vehicles can be parked on the street.
properties.access: Guests have access to all amenities expected of any home.   There is a second bedroom that the home owner will occupy.   A parking permit will be given to guests for easy on street parking immediately outside the apartment block (12 apartments).
properties.interaction: Day or night, all guests will be welcomed upon arrival. All questions answered and recommendations made.  The owner (Andrew) will be in residence and/or can be contacted at any time by mobile phone.  The full privacy of guests is assured.  If requested, Andrew is happy to show guests around and share unique aspects of Melbourne.  All will be made to feel welcome and interaction will be friendly and at the guests discretion.

There is great pleasure in sharing.

properties.host_about:
Hi, 
I am Jessica. My partner Christopher and I love to explore the mornington peninsula especially the wineries! We also love to travel - we have been to Malaysia, Thailand, Indonesia, France, Italy, Turkey and Spain. We did a 6 week trip to Italy in 2013 and we are hoping to go to America for a few months in 2016.
We are excited to have our house available for guests as its my favourite place to be and I hope other people can enjoy it as much as we do!

You’ll love its outlook into a the dappled light of an elm, calm ambience and the leafy neighbourhood. It's great for couples and solo adventurers.  We're a 10 minute bus ride to Coogee Beach and a 25 minute bus ride to the city. Buses come every five to ten minutes from one street down.  It's quiet, super convenient, affordable and lovely. Did I mention there's a bus too and from the airport? I have a large room with huge cupboards and an ensuite with a shower and complimentary products. There's a comfy double bed with West Elm Belgian flax linen sheets on it. Towels are clean and hanging outside the bathroom. You are free to use the rest of the apartment as you would your home :) There's a free shelf in the fridge for you with coffee and milk on it. The laundry with washing machine and dryer is just out the back door and there's an eco laundry liquid if you'd like to do a load or two. I'
properties.neighborhood_overview: Randwick is lovely, the shops are a 5 minute walk away. Plenty of good coffee shops. I'm partial to Duck, Duck, Goose and 21 grams. There's a Saturday farmers market for fresh produce and Sonoma bread just down at the local primary school from 9:30-2. Centennial park is a 10-15 minute stroll down the hill.
properties.notes: I go to the beach every morning by hopping on the 373 for 5 minutes. I recommend it highly as the world's best start to the day.
properties.transit: The (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) and 400 all run from about 100m away. The 400 takes you to Bondi Junction and the 373 and 377 take you down Oxford street, through the CBD to Circular Quay. The 376 and 372 take you to Central Station. And, the 400 goes to the airport in the opposite direction to the junction! The 373 also takes you to Coogee in the opposite direction to the city.
properties.access: You are free to use the rest of the apartment as you would your home :) There's a free shelf in the fridge for you with coffee and milk on it. The laundry with washing machine and dryer is just out the back door and there's an eco laundry liquid if you'd like to do a load or two.
properties.interaction: I'm out of town, but my two lovey housemates will be in and out and can help out with anything you need. They're in and out so you'll have plenty of space. I'm just down in Melbourne and will be on phone and email if you have any questions at all!
properties.house_rules: We'd like to keep this nice and calm for everyone, so we'd like to ask that you don't bring any other guests over. Also, although we're in a deco house with thick brick walls we've had some problems with very loud snoring and if you are a very loud snorer we'd suggest that this may not be the place for you.
properties.host_about: A 31 year old journalist who works for Australian Geographic.

properties.neighborhood_overview: Best coffee locally is Pocket Cafe, tucked away down a lane in a little group of nondescript shops in Melrose St at the bottom of the hill.  Great chai and coffee, super friendly staff and cheap, yummy eats.  In this group of shops there is a small supermarket, a post office, pharmacy, bakery, fish and chip shop, laundromat and an Asian grocer.  In Errol St North Melbourne, you'll find  The Auction Rooms Cafe, which is well known for sensational food and coffee. Counter across the road also does great snacks and coffee, but stand up only, no seating. There are also a number of other cafes and restaurants around. Other great food around includes The Laksa King (Malaysian) and The Abysinnian (Ethiopian) restaurants in Flemington (no. 57 tram). Both get pretty busy on the weekends.  As for pubs, well I like the The Crimean and the recently renovated North Melbourne Hotel on Victoria St has a wonderful menu and has been getting great reviews.  Town Hall Hotel in Errol St North Melbourne, i
properties.notes: Whilst my apartment is carpeted, and the walls are thick, there are two young babies downstairs so a little care and consideration around noise would be much appreciated. My neighbours will love you for it as will I.
properties.transit: Public transport is super close - 3 trams - No. 55 going past the top end of the Victoria Market and best for access to Southern Cross Railway Station, Skybus to the airport. In the other direction it goes through Royal Park, to the Melbourne Zoo and onwards to West Coburg. No. 57 goes through the heart of North Melbourne, past Victoria Market and into Elizabeth Street central city. In the other direction it goes out to Maribynong and is probably the closest tram to take you to HighPoint Shopping Centre No. 59 takes you past Royal Children's Hospital, Royal Women's Hospital, Royal Melbourne Hospital and is the best tram to get to Melbourne University and RMIT University from my place. It then continues on past the Victoria Market and into Elizabeth St in the central city. In the other direction it heads out to Essendon. Trains - Flemington Bridge and Kensington Railway stations are the two closest. Both will take you into town. It is  and probably about a 15 min walk to each station.
properties.access: My apartment is in the back block, access to the foyer door is down the path at the side of the letterboxes to the second stairwell. I'll meet you with a key.  . If you have a car, there is an undercover car space available free of charge. Car space number is outlined in the house manual.  Car parking on the street is 2 hours Monday - Saturday. All day ok on Sundays.
properties.interaction: I'll meet you when you arrive and answer any questions, but if for some reason I'm not able to, please get in touch and I'll get back to you asap.
properties.house_rules: - Enjoy your stay - Some basics are provided coffee/tea/sugar/salt/pepper/oil/herbs etc - Shoes can be left just inside the front door, as they are not worn indoors.  - Compost bin is provided and recycling appreciated - When leaving, please wash your dishes and empty rubbish into bins outside - Children under 12 are welcome, but must be supervised as there is a small balcony and apartment is high up and no child proof locks on cupboards.  - Sometimes things accidentally get broken, anything you break must be paid for or replaced. Please let me know if something breaks. - Only warm water and a soft cloth/paper towel to be used on the cooktop, fridge and oven when cleaning. - Quiet time after 10pm.
properties.host_about:
I'm a down to earth yogi who runs her own yoga retreat business. I like to travel, preferably with a bit of yoga thrown in, Some of it for work and some for pleasure, although I try to make work pleasurable. 
A backpacker for many years, I now prefer a little more comfort, exercise, meditation and 3 meals a day instead of 1 meal and copious beer - how times change with age!

I live without TV, and find life far more interesting without it. There's music, books and Melbourne has so many things to see and do, that I don't miss it. I live in a simple, relaxed environment, with quiet neighbours.

I want guests to enjoy their time visiting Melbourne, and know that they have a quiet, clean space to come home to and rest.

My travels have taken me to Europe, Scandinavia, Myanmar, Thailand, Vietnam, Singapore, India, India, India, India, India and USA. (There's a special place reserved in my heart for the chaos and madness of India in case you didn't guess). 

Life motto: Jump and the net will appear - don't know who said this, but I think it's a good one and it works most times. This is my first venture as a host so I have no reviews as yet - I'm jumping!
properties.street: North Melbourne, North Melbourne, VIC 3051, Australia

properties.name: Luxury private room in St Kilda
properties.summary: Spacious, luxurious, tastefully furnished, comfortable apartment in a beautiful Victorian Mansion (1880) opposite St Kilda Beach and Pier.  High ceilings, beautiful period features alongside contemporary decor, all modern amenities, hydronic heating and all a minute's walk to cafes, bars, shops and tram stops into the City.
properties.space: Large, quiet, private room in a Victorian Mansion divided into 4 apartments. Period features combined with contemporary decor, offer all you need for a great stay in the heart of St Kilda West. Wooden floorboards and rugs throughout on the ground floor, carpeted landing and bedroom upstairs. There is an extremely comfortable queensize bed (new mattress), luxurious cotton linen (Sheridan) and towels are provided. Bedside tables and lamps from "Space Interiors", a chair, oak side board, TV/DVD and cupboard space. There is a large, contemporary, hotel style bathroom adjacent to the bedroom with a walk in shower, large shower head, bidet, toilet, sink, full-length mirror and an illuminated shaving mirror.

properties.neighborhood_overview: St Kilda is by far the best place to stay in Melbourne as we are across the road from the beach, (kite surfing, sailing, swimming), with walking and cycling tracks, Luna Park, The Palais Music venue and St Kilda Festival.  We are 3 mins walk to Albert Park (Grand Prix, MSAC swimming complex, Albert Park Lake, walking tracks, cafés and restaurants). St Kilda boasts some of Melbourne's best restaurants, bars and coffee on the door step and we have 3 trams nearby going into the City (15 mins away). Melbourne is the cultural capital of Australia and has so much on offer for all interests and ages. Sporting events abound with The Australian Open Tennis Championships, The Test Cricket at the MCG, The Grand Prix, Tough Mudder and Strong Man Contests! and Triathlons galore.  St Kilda boasts big skies, light and lots to do, or simply relax, hang out and do nothing from this wonderful oasis of calm and luxury.
properties.notes: The apartment is available in its entirety while I am away and is at a higher rate that reflects sole use of the apartment without me being there. I am trying to find a way of listing this on Airbnb as a duel option, but I haven't found a way yet.
properties.transit: The 96, 12, 16 and 3a trams are all 2 minute's walk away and it takes approximately 15mins to get into the City.
properties.access: Access to a private, adjacent bathroom with large walk in shower, toilet, bidet, sink and a full length mirror. Toiletries provided.  Contemporary kitchen with marble bench top, Miele oven, steam oven, gas hobs and microwave with everything you need to cook up a storm if you so wish. All appliances are provided. The dining area has a table and chairs, a coffee machine, a grinder and an arm chair. The Sitting room area has a large three seater sofa, an arm chair and coffee table. There is TV, Netflix, Appletv and catch up channels. Two, floor to ceiling french doors open out onto a private wooden deck with an outdoor table and chairs, a gas heater and many plants. The area is awash with morning sun and provides a tranquil setting for sunny breakfasts and lunch.
properties.interaction: I love hosting, however I respect people's privacy and cherish my own.  I am a helpful source of local knowledge and provide a comprehensive, informative guide to the area with all the information guests might need for an enjoyable stay in this apartment, in the local area and in greater Melbourne. I will welcome guests and help out with information and can provide lots of tips of where to eat and with other local knowledge. I also provide maps, brochures, recommended restaurants for all tastes and budgets and local attractions of which there are many.  Please declare if your arrival is early (before 9am) or late.  It will make pre approval faster. I will always try to accommodate, but I cannot always meet and greet in unsocial hours. Please let me know your estimated arrival time and form of transport when enquiring or booking and I will try to accommodate you as best I can.
properties.house_rules: No drugs, loud music or smoking on the property. We live in a beautiful Victorian (1880) house with wonderful neighbours, contemporary artwork and furniture. We ask guests to take care and respect our apartment and the heritage building we share with our friends, our neighbours. Please treat the place as if it were your own special home. There is no servicing of rooms, so guests are asked to clear up after themselves and to leave the place as found.  People who are not declared as part of the original airbnb booking request will not be given access to our home. If you have booked as a single, an extra guest cannot be brought into the house without prior (ie not on the doorstep) arrangement. Airbnb has a transparent policy with verification and reviews for those who are booking. It is therefore unfair to then expect hosts to allow access to strangers. There is a very well equipped kitchen if you wish to cook meals at home.  Please declare if your arrival is early (before 9am) or late (a
properties.host_about:
I live in Melbourne and I have worked in the arts pretty much all my life, moving to Melbourne from London where I produced theatre and ran festivals.  I have worked as a freelance Arts producer, consultant special events producer and I have been involved in the making of two TV dramas in the UK and two documentary films in Australia. I set up and managed an accommodation business for a few years as a way to remain at home to look after my mother who has dementia and Alzheimer's disease before she finally went into aged care. I am now working (part-time) in a really interesting role, which I love and in my free time I am reading, attending arts events, spending time in nature, hiking, swimming and seeing friends. 

My home in St Kilda is a large Victorian Mansion (1880), split into four large apartments. 

The house in Balnarring is a very special haven for large groups, families and friends. It has a tree house, which I proudly helped to source materials for and build with my son alongside a dear friend, Bene, a master carpenter, craftsman, boat builder from Belgium. 

I enjoy family & friends, good food, great stories, films, transformative art, theatre and music and I love hiking, gardening & most things in the great outdoors. I have always loved to travel and have done so all my working and playing life. My son is overseas at Uni & hence his large, QS ensuite bedroom is available a lot of the time. I also travel overseas and with my job and so the entire apartment is also available on occasions. 

I enjoy camping - "doing it basic" and in the past I have equally enjoyed five star luxury, but less so now as I'm a bit fed up with the over emphasis on having to have the very best of everything at the expense of the environment and a living wage!  I now prefer to use Airbnb as its a great way to stay in some amazing places, meet locals and to gain their insight into their towns, cities & villages. I have used Airbnb in Sydney, Hobart, Brisbane, London, Los Angeles, California & Vancouver when visiting friends and family, not just to divert funds to other things but because I like chilling out in a homely environment, visiting local markets & cooking with great ingredients rather than eating out all the time. I love staying in beautiful individual Airbnb houses with everything one might need while on holiday. I am generally interested in a culture of exchange and sharing. I hate waste. I have been able to develop so many ideas and projects with the skills, expertise & open attitude of those Helpxers & Woofers who have worked with me running both businesses over the years, plus I regularly host and participate in Clothes & Skills Swaps. All of these schemes have enriched my life and brought me into contact with some amazing people from all over the world. I have not only learned new skills, but I have also gained incredible insights into other cultures and experiences of those I have met in Australia and overseas.

properties.neighborhood_overview: Convenient, our place allows us to enjoy the best of what Melbourne has to offer. Restaurants and convenience stores are right at the bottom of the building. The Wooden Elk is a modern Australian cuisine restaurant (Pizza, Tapas etc). There is a delicious Thai restaurant and a a great Italian across the street. The vibrant South Melbourne market which is full of fresh vegies and fruit is few minutes away, so are all the big retails such as Aldi, Woolworth and Coles.  The largest sports centre in Melbourne - MSAC- is literally five minutes away while the Botanical Gardens and the TAN track are even closer - hence why we call it convenient. Southbank and Crown Casino Complex are two tram stops away.
properties.notes: Parking - We have a car stacker. It takes one minute to put up and bring down the car. There is a huge TV on the 15th floor and you can access it any time except after mid-night.
properties.transit: We are a minute away from the Domain Interchange from where around 10 trams depart to and from the City to almost every suburb in Melbourne. We are also a 15 minutes walking distance from the City while tram number 55 is right outside of the house.  If you fancy driving, there are rental cars in the building as well as other popular renters such as Flexi, go get etc in the neighbourhood.

properties.interaction: We are contactable on the phone, Viber and  What's App as well as emails. Feel free to get in touch whether it is about the apartment, where to eat or find hidden Melbourne secrets ! We are more than happy to help.

We are also close to the Coburg Lake Reserve with walking and bike paths. My house is in the Pentridge Village - Pentridge used to be a prison and there are parts of it that you can wander around and explore. There are also new shops and cafés starting to pop up nearby.
properties.notes: I have a medium hair cat called Moses and a tonkinese called Leo. They are friendly and low maintenance but do shed a bit of hair so if you're allergic, then this probably isn't the best option for you, sorry!
properties.transit: It is less than a 10 minute walk to either the 19 or 1 trams which will take you straight into the city. If you prefer the train it is about a 15 minute walk to the Coburg train station which is on the Upfield line. It is a 20 minute train ride into the centre of Melbourne.
properties.access: You will have a private bedroom and share the rest of the house with me and my cats! I am in and out of the house during the day and often busy during the evening as well so you will probably have the space to yourself quite often.
properties.interaction: When I'm around I would love to have a chat and possibly share a drink or a meal but I understand that when you're travelling sometimes you just need a break and will make sure you have the space to do that!
properties.house_rules: My only rule is that you take any perishable food with you when you leave. If you can't take it with you please throw it out because otherwise it just goes bad in the fridge!
properties.host_about:
My name is Kristy, I am 30 and working as a music therapist and music teacher. 
I love music and sing in a few choirs. I was lucky enough to sing on stage with the Rolling Stones last year!!
I am always planning my next overseas adventure - my most recent big trip was in 2012 on the Trans-Siberian Railway through China, Mongolia and Russia which was fantastic.

properties.name: City/Beach Convenience Long Stay
properties.summary: This charming, clean and comfortable period apartment in a unique and quiet pocket of Melbourne with restaurants, beaches and a ten minute tram ride to the city centre . A welcoming and relaxing home providing two bedrooms for the long stay occupant.  A short walk to the Australian Grand Prix.
properties.space: A well lit, welcoming, first floor art deco apartment with two bedrooms for two or for three.  It retains some of its period features and has a view out over the city skyline out one window and into lush, green foliage through yet another.  A short walk to the beach will give you a view to the bay and the passing ships.   The bare Tasmanian Oak floorboards throughout and freshly painted walls exude a sense of holiday calm. All complimented by a unique eclectic décor reflecting the owner's creative bent and love of Danish furniture.  One bedroom has a comfortable Queen Size bed (for couple guests) and the other a single mattress for friends or family.   The kitchen can cater for those who do not wish to make the short walk to nearby restaurants (a convenient, hideaway table can cater for candlelit dinners). A clean white bathroom with shower and deep bath, also has a combined washing machine/dryer for guests use. Conveniently located with sand, water, supermarket, restaurants and public

properties.neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in one of Melbourne's most sort after suburbs.  It is characterised by wide streets, heritage buildings, terraced houses, open air cafes, parks and significant stands of mature exotic trees.  And, of course, once a year, it is the home of the Australian Grand Prix that courses around the picturesque banks of Albert Park Lake. Melbourne's iconic trams rumble up Victoria Avenue immediately outside the apartment and the neighbourhood comes alive during the summer with the many Melbourne residents wishing to take advantage of the sun, sand and beach only 100 metres distant.  The foreshore is the place for joggers, walkers, skaters, cyclists and for those who just want a leisurely promenade.  Saint Kilda is in one direction and Port Melbourne in the other.  (Bike hire is within 100 metres of the apartment).   For the inquisitive that are also energetic, Melbourne city is a walk to be enjoyed from the apartment (one hour).  Restaurants are many and guests will be spo
properties.transit: Public transport has never been so convenient - the Number 1 tram stops (terminates) immediately outside the apartment block and with a ten minute tram ride guests can be in the centre of the city.  The tram will conveniently drop passengers outside the arts centre precinct or at Melbourne's most famous landmark Flinders Street Train Station.  From here all of Melbourne and its suburbs are available by train.  As mentioned previously, public bike hire is 100 metres away and vehicles can be parked on the street.
properties.access: Guests have access to all amenities expected of any home.   A parking permit will be given to guests for easy on-street parking immediately outside the apartment block (12 apartments).
properties.interaction: Day or night, all guests will be welcomed upon arrival. All questions answered and recommendations made.  The owner will be overseas at this time and available by email.  Guests will also be given contact phone numbers of reliable nearby help if required. The full privacy of guests is assured.  All will be made to feel welcome and interaction will be friendly and at the guests discretion.
properties.house_rules: This listing has all the convenience of someone's home because it is their home; guests are expected to treat it as such.  All care and responsibility should be taken, with due consideration given to keeping the premises clean, tidy and secure.  Rubbish is to be removed to rear courtyard bins and any plant pots watered regularly (for long term stays).  Guests are encouraged to be mindful of neighbours and keep noise to a minimum.
properties.host_about:
A lover of ideas and aesthetics.  Keen to be a small influence for large, positive change. 
There is great pleasure in sharing.

properties.space: Our apartment in Southbank is on the doorstep of all the best that Melbourne has to offer. The Australian Open Tennis, the MCG, the CBD/downtown area, the Yarra River, Port Melbourne beach and more.  Our apartment comes with free on-street parking, a tramstop at the back door for the No. 1 tram which will take you straight to the city, Air Con, free high speed WIFI and Apple TV with lots of free movies. It is in one of the first complexes in the area with a huge communal garden with beautiful established trees and seating areas.  Our apartment is on the ground floor with easy access from the carpark straight into the apartment. Perfect after a busy day of shopping.  The apartment is spacious and has two good sized bedrooms, each with a queen sized bed and built in wardrobes. There is a comfortable sofa bed (which converts to a double bed) in the living area which makes the apartment ideal for a group of six.  The bathroom has a bath and shower, separate toilet and european laundry.  Th

The apartment is spacious and has two good sized bedrooms, each with a queen sized bed
properties.neighborhood_overview: Southbank is on the edge of the Melbourne CBD or downtown area. It is a green wedge between the city and the beach, full of magnificent parks and gardens, excellent and safe public transport that can take you all over Melbourne. The Royal Botanic Gardens is a 5 mins walk away. The tram is at our back door. There is a supermarket and pharmacy 150m from our back door. There are dozens of cafes and restaurants within 10 minutes walk. The DFO shopping centre of Melbourne is 10 mins by tram. The National Gallery, Museum, Queen Victoria Market, MCG and Australian Open Tennis Centre are all with 10 mins of the apartment. There is no better location in Melbourne. You won't need a car and will be able to see all that Melbourne has to offer on foot or by tram.
properties.transit: The tram is literally steps away at our back door and will take you directly into the city.  Southern Cross Railway station is 10 mins away and can take you around Victoria by train.
properties.access: You have private and exclusive access to the apartment during your stay. It has two bedrooms, bathroom, laundry, kitchen, living room with TV and Apple TV, WIFI, private courtyard, huge communal garden and free parking.
properties.interaction: We live in a seaside town an hour from Melbourne. Our daughter Gail Is available by phone and email if you have any questions during your stay.
properties.house_rules: No parties or loud social gatherings.  No smoking in the apartment, courtyard or communal garden.
properties.host_about: Hi, my name is Gail and I've lived in Melbourne all my life. I love my city and love sharing it with guests.

Endota Spa is also literally around the corner for massages, facials, etc, There's also Barre classes (Aleenta Barre) in the same building if you feel like a work out!
properties.transit: Our apt is in the free tram zone so hop on a tram and explore. There is a tram stop outside the building. A couple of other parking options are nearby in Flinders Street and Flinders Lane as well.

properties.neighborhood_overview: Situated minutes from beautiful Elwood beach, bustling Ormond Read shops and the nightlife of St Kilda this apartment is perfect for a couple or friends wanting to experience the chic Elwood lifestyle. The bus stop is just a two minute walk and train station only 12 minutes away which is then a 15 minute commute to the CBD.
properties.transit: There are buses that operate in Elwood and go to a range of locations including one line down Broadway where the apartment is located.  The airport shuttle bus also goes down Glen Huntley Road in Elwood which is a 4 minute walk from the apartment to the stop. The Ripponlea train station is 1.3km away with direct link in to the city (15 min journey).  There is no on-site parking however there is free parking out on Broadway and the surrounding streets. Parking is generally not a problem.

properties.house_rules: Please treat this space as you would treat your own. No pets allowed, no smoking inside (on the balcony is fine) & no parties. Please be respectful of the neighbours.
properties.host_about:
Hi Guys! Thanks for looking at my apartment :)
A bit about me... I work as a Marketing Specialist in retail & I am lucky enough to love my job! 
I also LOVE to travel and explore new cities and towns and have been lucky enough to live in London for 4 years. My all-time favourite travel destination is a little closer to home… Bali. I try and get over there at least once a year. I feel relaxed as soon as I get off the place. 
As a host I hope to make your stay as comfortable as possible and am happy to recommend a few favourite bars & restaurants in the area. All you need to do is ask :)

properties.space: Thanks for clicking through. Below you'll see pics of my charming 2-bedroom townhouse right in the middle of Northcote (just 3.5km from Fitzroy and about 6km from the CBD).  Super spacious for one person and comfortable for two, the room on offer is perfect for the refined bohemian traveller.  Complete with herbs and succulents, the airy courtyard out back provides extra space and a nice place to chill out in the sunshine.

properties.neighborhood_overview: Northcote is famous for its multicultural and creative slant and is considered the eclectic sweetheart of Melbourne's inner north.  The place is literally *70 steps from a venue with live jazz, *100 steps from an authentic Vietnamese restaurant and about *150 steps from Melbourne's best boutique bars. *Steps may vary depending on height, length of limbs and glasses of wine drunk.
properties.notes: Please note: I am 'switched on' all day so have made a conscious decision not to have an internet connection in my home. In saying that, WI-FI IS AVAILABLE in the lounge room (from the street connection called Darebin wi-fi). The connection is perfectly fine for (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) chats and is limited to 4.5 hours a day.

properties.interaction: I am quite a social person and do go out a bit, but am always happy to help out from wherever I may be.  To put it nicely, I'll be around enough that we can share our experiences of the last few days, but not too much that you'll be wondering if I actually have a job.
properties.house_rules: Smoking is fine, as long as it's done outside.  The gas cooker / oven can only be used when I'm home. Other than that, mi casa su casa.

For leisure activities, enjoy Columbia Park, Lum Reserve and Jells Park - a 127 hectare green oasis with nine kilometres of cycle paths and walking tracks surrounding a picturesque lake. The Glen Waverley Golf Course and the Monash Aquatic and Recreation Centre are also close by. Enjoy the ease of shopping locally with Wheelers Hill shopping centre located right next door. There’s fresh produce, specialty shops, supermarket, cafés, restaurants and other services, all a stone’s throw away.  For more extensive shopping and entertainment options, The Glen, Brandon Park and Chadstone shopping complexes are less than five minutes away.

properties.name: Private Room in Hollywood Apartment
properties.summary: Welcome to your Hollywood home! My newly-renovated apartment is secure and comfortable, only a short distance from all the top attractions, and boasts a clear view of the Hollywood sign. Shoot me an enquiry about availability to book. I look forward to hosting you!
properties.space: The apartment is a lovely slice of modern Hollywood. It's a bright, creative and energizing space, and it's such a novelty to be able to stretch out on the couch and gaze straight out at the desert hills and the iconic Hollywood sign.
properties.description: Welcome to your Hollywood home! My newly-renovated apartment is secure and comfortable, only a short distance from all the top attractions, and boasts a clear view of the Hollywood sign. Shoot me an enquiry about availability to book. I look forward to hosting you! The apartment is a lovely slice of modern Hollywood. Wifi Apple TV with Netflix Air-conditioned apartment  Ceiling fans in bedrooms Dimmable lights Brand new kitchen appliances Spring water fountain Hairdryer Mirrored closet and dresser drawers Nearby laundry As an Australian, I know what it's like to be new to LA - both as a visitor who's just popped by to see the sights, or as a new resident who needs a base camp during those busy first few weeks of orientation. I'm warm, approachable, and available to assist you as best as I can. This is such
properties.neighborhood_overview: This is such a great spot to reside in. Hollywood definitely comes with its light and its shade, but my street is quiet and mostly populated by families. The Kodak Theater, Hollywood Walk Of Fame, Madame Tussaud's, the Hollywood Wax Museum, Paramount Pictures, and Grauman's and the Chinese Theater are all within walking distance. There's a CVS pharmacy a block away, and Trader Joe's and Pavillions are a short walk away for groceries (or else there are dozens of cafes and restaurants in the neighborhood if you, like me, prefer someone else to do the cooking). The freeways are easily accessible. It's so close to the action, but being a couple of blocks away from Hollywood Blvd provides a great escape when you need to turn down the volume.
properties.transit: There are bus lines all around and a Metro Station a short walk away, at Hollywood and Vine. If you prefer being driven around, it's all about Uber: it's so cheap and easy, and almost always ends up costing far less than the total cost of renting a car. Otherwise, there's permit-free street parking available if you do wish to hire a vehicle.
properties.access: Wifi Apple TV with Netflix Air-conditioned apartment  Ceiling fans in bedrooms Dimmable lights Brand new kitchen appliances Spring water fountain Hairdryer Mirrored closet and dresser drawers Nearby laundry
properties.interaction: As an Australian, I know what it's like to be new to LA - both as a visitor who's just popped by to see the sights, or as a new resident who needs a base camp during those busy first few weeks of orientation. I'm warm, approachable, and available to assist you as best as I can.
properties.house_rules: We shall enjoy each other's company whilst ultimately valuing each other's privacy and being mutually respectful. You, your things, and your private space are safe around me! Please, no parties (that's what bars are for).
properties.host_about: Hello, future guests! I'm Kaitlyn, a 31 year-old Australian who's loving life in LA. I've lived here for a year now, and have previously lived in New York, Sydney and Melbourne. I'm an actor who loves (among many other things) dogs, brilliant television, red wine, contemporary art, long walks, theatre, tacos, the LA Dodgers, the colour yellow, and meeting new people. I've only ever had wonderful experiences as an Airbnb guest, so I'm thrilled to have a home to offer to you as a host/roomie/new friend.

You will have a code to access this which I will forward once the booking has been secured and a key safe to access the keys to the main building and the apartment. I am located in the building so should there be any problems during your stay I will be available to help resolve the issue. I'm available if you req
properties.neighborhood_overview: Only a stones throw from the high end shopping precinct of Collins Street, walking distance to the theatres in Spring, Exhibition and Collins Streets.  The location is ideal for experiencing Melbourne's finest bars and restaurants.   As there are so many within the area I have left a list of my personal favourites in the apartment for your information, feel free to take a copy!
properties.notes: The apartment is located on the 3rd floor and unfortunately there is no lift as it is a National Trust-Registered Building with only 8 apartments.  I guess you could look at it as good exercise! There are facilities to cook with in the apartment which if you decide to use I recommend using the exhaust fan as the building's fire alarm is linked directly to the fire brigade so if the alarm is triggered it can be a costly exercise. I'm a fan of conserving energy so while I provide air conditioning to the property if they are left on after you vacate the apartment there will be an additional charge. The apartment is set up for 4 people but should you require it there is a double sofa bed in the lounge room which accommodates another 2 people. The flat is in walking distance to most places in and around the city and the public transport links are great but if you are driving and need parking there is a 24 hour carpark directly across the street. There is Wifi and Netflix connected for you t
properties.transit: On Bourke Street there are two trams the 96 which will take you to Nicholson Street heading north or St.Kilda beach via the city in the opposite direction and the 86 which will take you to Smith Street, Fitzroy and the City/Docklands in the opposite direction.   Both of these trams will take you to and from Spencer Street station which is where the Skybus arrives and departs for the airport every 10 to 15 minutes. Parliament train station is 50m away at the corner of Bourke and Spring Streets. One block away is Collins Street where you can get the 48 tram to Brunswick Street Taking a tram within the city grid is free, make sure you are aware of where the free tram zone ends as travelling outside this zone without a valid ticket could result in a fine which isn't my idea of a great souvenir!  For public transport in Melbourne we have a smartcard ticketing system called myki. You can use myki to travel on trains, trams and buses. Always remember to touch on and off your myki each time yo

You will have a code to access this which I will forward once the booking has been secured and a key safe to access the keys to the main building and the apartment.

properties.host_about: My husband,Tony and I have 4 grown children, all of whom currently live overseas with their partners, which ensures we are avid and frequent travellers. We have stayed in some of the best and some of the 'not so great' accommodation around the world, so we understand the importance of the quality expected when travelling. Although I was born in New Zealand and have made Melbourne my home for the last 34 years, I consider myself a global citizen travelling constantly to the UK, Europe and USA to visit family.  Tony and I are easy-going, well-travelled, passionate about our home and garden, enjoy a glass of wine or two and love to cook! And we love living in Melbourne.Melbourne is one of those rare cities that combines true charm with big city cultural attractions. It is a magnificent city and as one of the most liveable cities in the world you will be hard pressed to find a more exciting, well thought out place to visit.

The basics are also supplied- washing powder, milk, tea, instant coffee, sugar, butter, cereal, soap, towels, toilet paper and shampoo! Free wi-fi also.

properties.neighborhood_overview: Narre Warren is strategically situated in between the Melbourne City and the tourist attractions in the southeast such as Mornington Peninsula, Philip Island, Yarra Valley, and lots more. Many of our guests make our home their short stay while traveling to the southeast, or their base while visiting Melbourne. The neighbourhood is quiet and peaceful with joggers and families walking their dogs almost every evening. There is a park just opposite the house, so you can relax and take a walk whenever you like around the neighbourhood.
properties.notes: The popular Mornington Peninsula is only 40 minutes drive away, and has a long history of being a favourite holiday destination in Melbourne. The Dandenong Ranges and Belgrave (Puffing Billy steam engine) are 30 minutes to the north and there are several beautiful beaches within 30 minutes drive to the south. The famous Phillip Island is just an hour away, where there are fantastic tourist attractions - the little penguins, the koala conservation park, the seals at the Nobbies and other attractions.
properties.transit: There is a bus stop 5 minutes walk away and also the Narre Warren Train Station less than 10 minutes drive away. Nearby is the Fountain Gate Shopping Centre, one of the largest shopping centre in Australia which is less than 10 minutes drive away. For emergency supplies, there is a milk bar just around the neighbourhood.
properties.access: You have access to your personal room (Room 2), wardrobe, your own bathroom and toilet (if the other room is not occupied), the main living room and the adjacent shaded garden, the kitchen and the laundry room. The other rooms, and the second living room are private areas. Please request for access in advance.
properties.interaction: We will show and explain to you everything about the house, as well as how and where to go, but other than that we will be in our bedroom or second living room for our personal time. Other than that, I'm reachable on the phone almost 24/7, so don't hesitate to call, text, or send me a message on Airbnb's messaging system.

properties.host_about:
My wife and I are from Malaysia. 

Back in 2013, we went for a backpacking trip to the Middle East and Europe for three months. We visited 17 countries and 27 cities throughout that period, and that was when we learnt about Airbnb. Our hosts were great to us, and now, we want to return the favour to welcome guests from all around the world at our home.

properties.house_rules: Our house is alive with all sorts of plants and animals busy growing and working away. The bees furiously making honey, the fish growing and providing nutrient for the plants, the worms processing fish wastes, the plants de-nitrifying the water for the fish, the chickens processing kitchens scraps into eggs, the spiders catching bugs and compost and all sorts of microbes and subsoil biota providing for the plants. We have all sorts of people stay and are pretty flexible. Here are some of the usual practices 1. We take our shoes of at the door. We do this cause if feels nice, reduces the work cleaning floors and means we are not traipsing compost throughout the house. We have several crocs at the doors for us and guests. We usually just have a thickish pair of socks for the house in winter. 2. We don't kill all our household spiders. They do a job keeping the insects down in the house, especially when processing honey and they are fascinating to watch. 3. We turn appliances off at the p
properties.host_about: We are having a ball with Airbnb, meeting lovely people from all over the world and sharing lots of stories of life and adventures.  Our home is a somewhat rambling old austerity era home that we have 'ecofied' with PV panels, water tanks, straw walls, earthern render, water recycling, compost toilet, chooks, aquaponics, extensive food garden with over 100 edibles, combustion heater and more.  The rooms vary, a couple with straw walls with an earthern render, loft queen size bed, desk and a queen size corner sofa bed (that we designed, built and upholstered ourselves).  Oh and its 900m from a zone one train, close to bikeways including one direct from the airport.

properties.neighborhood_overview: The Neighbourhoods (St Kilda and Elwood at your door) ST KILDA:  Prepare to play in St Kilda, where you can kick up your heels by the seashore, along with live music or on the whirligigs at Luna Park. Melbourne's favourite beachside suburb  Join locals who walk, cycle and skate under the palms on the foreshore or sail, windsurf or kitesurf on the bay.  Keep an eye out for little St Kilda Breakwater and visit the Sunday St Kilda Esplanade Arts and Craft Market. Return to the neighbourhood's genteel resort days with a dip in the heated seawater spas and pools at the historic St Kilda Sea Baths.  Enjoy fine dining at Donovan's and Circa, Asian flavours at Uncle and tasty Mexican at Radio Mexico. Catch live music at the Palais Theatre, the Esplanade Hotel and the Prince Bandroom, and get a thrill on a ride at the iconic Luna Park.  Fitzroy, Acland and Carlisle street days  Choose the street to suit the mood. Fitzroy and Acland streets have cool cafes, restaurants and bars, fashion boutique

properties.host_about:
UNIQUE SHORT STAYS, SOUTH YARRA

Hi There!

I'm a corporate events professional based in East Melbourne/South Yarra in Melbourne. Friendly, easy going & accommodating. I am passionate about events, travel, food, wine, meeting new people & new experiences! 

Our homes are in inner city Melbourne. South Yarra/St Kilda Rd Precinct/East Melbourne. Brillant access to CBD but slightly removed for peace and quiet at night. They are certainly mere minutes from Melbourne's CBD and all major inner Melbourne attractions that make Melbourne "Marvellous".

We aim to provide the most cost effective and best value designer/boutique accommodation in inner Melbourne.  

They are ideal for leisure travellers who are looking for a unique place to call home whilst in Melbourne,or for corporate professionals working short-term in CBD/inner city. Perhaps you're coming to our fair city for one of our many special events....?

If you are interested in one of the properties i have listed but the dates are unavailable, please check my other listings under my profile or please email me through airbnb messaging system, as l will likely have another apartment/home available that will suit your needs.  I am here to provide suggestions where you see fit

Any questions please don't hesitate to call out, look forward to chatting with you about your finer requirements. 

Myself and our events network are here to assist you. More than happy to provide sights/restaurant/event/cafe or transport tips to ensure a memorable, extraordinary, safe  and convenient trip!

I have airbnb on my iphone, so i normally reply rapidly.

Feel free to contact me anytime.

Cheers Alex, Unique Short Stays

properties.name: Tranquil Fitzroy Forest House
properties.summary: We are in the heart of Fitzroy's vibrant city life, yet nestled in a lush and peacefully little forest area. Wake up to the sound of birds tweeting, stroll out onto your balcony and enjoy the morning air. Yet, you're a 2 mins stroll to Brunswick St!
properties.space: Downstairs, floor to ceiling windows in lounge & dining areas provides lots of light and a fantastic outlook onto our little forest garden, which is shared by other residents in our private city oasis. Upstairs, the master bedroom and the 3rd bedroom also have floor to ceiling windows with doors leading onto a balcony looking out over the forest areas. Relax on our comfy sofa on balcony enjoying the afternoon sun. The little forest area is home to many birds, a resident cat and from time to time possums. We usually rent out just one of our spare bedrooms, so for reviews from previous guests please check out our other listing.

properties.neighborhood_overview: Fitzroy is a vibrant neighborhood packed with creative people, delicious cafes & restaurant, funky bars and lots of interesting street art - check out some of my photos for a taste of the area.
properties.transit: We're 2 mins walk to 2 different tram routes that head into the city - take your pick! You might like to walk instead & that's a leisurely 20 mins stroll through beautiful Carlton Gardens. The nearest train line is Parliament which is 20 mins walk.
properties.access: All rooms in the house, both upstairs & downstairs. The patio, balcony, private garden and communal gardens. Only the garage will be locked and not available for guest use. Parking on our driveway is available for 1 car.
properties.interaction: We'll be contactable by mobile to help you with any questions you may have about the facilities in our home, or more generally about what to do, where to go & how to get there in & around Melbourne. If possible, we will be at our home for your check in & out - but if not, keys area will be in a secure safe and a detailed house guide provided.
properties.host_about:
I moved to Melbourne 4 years ago with a plan to stay for a 1 year adventure!  Here I am still loving every moment of life in the world's most liveable city.  I share our home in Fitzroy with my gorgeous Aussie man I met here a few years ago.  We love nature, so the tranquility of our home in a little forest, right in the heart of Fitzroy, is heaven for us!  We're a 2 mins stroll to Brunswick St, 10 mins to Smith St & Lygon St and 20 mins walk through beautiful Carlton Gardens to the top end of the city.  For us, this is the best spot in the Melbourne!

Whether you're here for pleasure, business or visiting friends & family, we welcome you into our home for single night or longer.  We both work much of the week but are usually home in the evenings and will be happy to chat to you about anything & everything.  If you're visiting for pleasure we have a collection of guide books & tourist brochures always on hand & will be happy to recommend our favourite bars & restaurants.

properties.neighborhood_overview: Albert Park is a beautiful village-like area, with a highly convenient location within a short distance of the CBD, St Kilda, Port Melbourne, the beach and Albert Park Lake and Sporting Precincts.  Enjoy the range of fantastic cafes and restaurants nearby, sporting facilities of MSAC and Lakeside Stadium, South Melbourne Market and the range of public transport options to get you exploring further.
properties.notes: Hallway entrance light can be found on your right as you enter through the main entrance. In the bathroom, run the hot water tap of the bath in addition to the shower tap, whilst showering for hot water. The bedroom light switch is behind the door. The laundry facilities are hidden behind the door in the hallway.
properties.transit: Our apartment is located within easy walking distance to three different tram lines, as well as a taxi-tank, Melbourne bike share and short-term car-share/rental spots. properties.name: Victorian Family Home - Close to Melbourne CBD
properties.summary: Exemplary family Victorian Home This superb C.1890 Victorian boasts modern spaces private courtyard,5 bedrooms, delightful living area, updated kitchen, alfresco deck & courtyard. Evocative period originality such as high ceilings, multiple open fireplaces and Baltic Pine floors partners the modern day comfort of two period style bathrooms, atrium &  laundry. Once home to former Governor of Victoria John Landy this unique property is a must see.
properties.space: This remarkable Heritage Terrace from 1836 is sure to impress The location is brilliant - on the North Western fringe of the CBD; a quiet street with park; easy access to Airport; tram to Flinders st one minute walk away, cafes, comedy and restaurants of Errol St... Near enough to the city for convenience but far enough away to be relaxed and friendly. Only minutes away walking to the Royal Children's Hospital. This beautiful period home boasts character and yet feels modern and warm. Perfect for families, group getaways and even just a romantic time away with your loved one. If you love reading you will feel like your in library we literally have books up to the ceiling, we hope you can spend your days sitting in one of our beautiful rooms with a great bio, mystery or novel.

Easy drive or tram to Flemington; drive or tram to Moonee Valley; tram and train to Caulfield. And so easy to get to the MCG; Tennis Centre & AAMI Park!!! 3 minute tram ride or waking distance to Royal womens hospital, royal children's hospital The zoo is minutes away North Melbourne has a charming village feel to its broad, gently hilly streets of Victorian terraces and old cottages. You can go for a swim at the North Melbourne Recreation Centre, see some comedy at the Comic’s Lounge, see a band at the tiny Town Hall Hotel, pick up local handcrafts at the Thread Den market. Errol Street is where the main cafe and grocery action happens, but roam a little further afield and you’ll find gorgeous places like Beatrix, a tiny wonderland bakery.

A short walk to the Casino, Exhibition Centre, Southbank restaurants and theatres and South Melbourne Market. It has its own underground parking space. You even have full use of a heated indoor pool, a gymnasium and tennis court.

It has a good-sized separate queen bedroom with double robe, a separate bathroom with shower/bath and laundry facility. A full kitchen and comfortable lounge/dining area. There is a medium- sized undercover balcony with seating for 2 overlooking the pool and tennis court. There is small gymnasium and a BBQ area, all on level 3 for guests to use. properties.neighborhood_overview: This apartment has modern furniture, 2 tvs and all conveniences for comfortable living. Just bring your clothes and food. All linen and bedding is provided. One tram stop (or a 10 minute walk north) takes you to Southbank Promenade with riverside restaurants, bars, the Crown Casino, movie theatres and the river ferries. Or a ten minute walk south takes you to South Melbourne restaurants and the South Melbourne Market.
properties.notes: Maximum clearance height for vehicles in undercover park is 2.00 metres. You will need a mobile phone usable in Australia so you can contact our cleaner to let you into the building when you first arrive.
properties.transit: Right in front of the building there is a major tram stop that can take you direct to Melbourne CBD, the beaches and the markets. Each is only a few tram stops away.The trams can also takes you to Southern Cross or Flinders Street railway stations (the two major terminals in Melbourne for all suburban or rural destinations). They also are only 4 or 5 tram stops  (1 - 2 kms) away. The Restaurant Tram leaves right outside our door. We include an undercover car park for those who have a vehicle. There is a an economical hire car company right next door.
properties.access: When walking out of carpark, use grey fob to open access the door to the main building.  When driving in or out of the carpark use the black remote. Point it towards the top right hand corner of the door and press once. Repeat if it doesn't work first time. It can take 5 seconds to react.

properties.name: Arty Loft Style Studio Chippendale
properties.summary: My Place is a live / work creative space in a mixed art & design warehouse building in Chippendale ... A super arty, central & delicious neighbourhood ..! Its an open plan , rustic space with beautiful light & a great location for experiencing Sydney.
properties.space: The space is a large studio apartment with a loft bed area in a beautifully light filled, high ceilinged space in an old heritage building that houses professional design businesses like photographers, architects , fashion designers,artists and filmmakers... Which is basically the same as the neighbourhood of chippendale in general, One of Sydney's most creatively bourgeoning suburbs... Super creative , fun , delicious, central  and convenient !  Close to Bus, trains, ( central station is 10 min easy walk) walk to the city / chinatown, cabs always driving past the door... Bus stop 50m from door, Redfern Station 5 mins walk..Perfect spot for travelling & seeing Sydney! The apartment is used often also as a photo studio, so the furniture is minimal , but comfortable, and flexible to move around. The warehouse as a whole and the apartment is well overdue for a facelift, as it is in a very original unrenovated state... It is definitely "rustic chic" and I love it , it has such good vibes a
properties.description: My Place is a live / work creative space in a mixed art & design warehouse building in Chippendale ... A super arty, central & delicious neighbourhood ..! Its an open plan , rustic space with beautiful light & a great location for experiencing Sydney. The space is a large studio apartment with a loft bed area in a beautifully light filled, high ceilinged space in an old heritage building that houses professional design businesses like photographers, architects , fashion designers,artists and filmmakers... Which is basically the same as the neighbourhood of chippendale in general, One of Sydney's most creatively bourgeoning suburbs... Super creative , fun , delicious, central  and convenient ! Bus stop 50m from door, Redfern Station 5 mins walk..Perfect spot for travelling & seeing Sydney! The apartment is used often also as a photo studio, so the furniture is
properties.neighborhood_overview: What's NOT to love about my neighbourhood... ;)?? Its a real up and coming art & cultural hub of Sydney, still in its gowing stages but thats what keeps it interesting, its like a new gallery / bar / cafe opens every week! a lot to explore just stepping out the door... There are many great cafes & bakeries within a 3 or so minute walk from the apartment, too many to choose from ( i can recommend my favourite), a lot of independent galleries ..White rabbit gallery is a must and its just a couple of blocks away... short walks to central park / broadway that has a lot of restaurants & supermarkets ... Chippendale & Redfern  have some great small bars ( i can give you a list of the good ones to go to also)... Eveleigh markets @ Carriageworks (also an amazing multi arts space) is amazing for a saturday morning wander & brekky thats  close by, i go there every saturday morning. Even though there is plenty to keep you occupied locally, the real benefit is how easy and convenient it is to get
properties.notes: For its central location its mostly a nice quiet , calm space where, traffic noise isn't often noticeable and its pretty much calm and relaxing, most of the time ;)... however it must be noted that sound travels in this old creaky building , and for example if a photoshoot is going on downstairs, you can hear it and things like that. while its not bad, its not a little totally quiet bubble, so it might not be ideal if you are super noise sensitive :) at night however, mostly  it is generally really relaxed and quiet .. The weekends can be a little noisier in the neighbourhood, and sound does travel to the apartment, and so once again if you are noise sensitive when sleeping or in general, the serenity cant be guaranteed ;) and the space might not be idea for you... me, i love the vibrant living and knowing im surrounded by things going on and kind of like the buzz, when its there ;) but, some people might not fancy it.   > PLEASE take great care when walking up the stairs with your bag
properties.transit: VERY convenient for Transport. Bus stop is about 25m from the front door. Cabs can be flagged from the front door pretty easily. 5 mins walk to Redfern ( that connects to every station in sydney, except airport line) 10 min walk to Central train, which goes everywhere... Super easy! Friendly Bike shop across the road that you can hire bikes and cycle around the city - they make great coffee too and Dutch breakfasts. Also, very easy walk to the City , Chinatown, Surry Hills, Glebe , new Kensington Street , & close to Newtown ( all less then 2kms) . Its about a 15-20 minute drive to the Airport and a cab will cost about 20-25... not bad! Street parking is available although there are time limits in place, so you take your chances with parking... Paid parking at Sydney Uni Carparks available.
properties.access: Kitchen for the guests to use ( please note , the actual OVEN doesn't work presently ( BUT - there is a new bench top hotplate (perfect for scrambling eggs etc, and there is a new microwave-oven) .  There is ample tea & coffee, and all utensils / cooking and dining ware you could need. So help yourself to the use of the kitchen and the perishable food items, and of course the herbal teas / coffee etc... there is a  New TV  with DVD player & you can play music with a bluetooth speaker system. Lots of space to keep luggage. heater & fan in studio... (please note, no central heating or air conditioning) the space is well temperature  balanced though, so I find these are good enough in the space. :)
properties.interaction: I work freelance and so my job has taken me somewhere, probably Melbourne ( however i am available all times on phone/ email)  and my good friend lives very close, so she can be there in case or urgency) Guests will have all the space, independence and privacy they desire.   - Please note there are big loft windows that look out onto the alley that I'm used to , and so it is quite open, but there are blinds that cover these if you like some privacy :) ... I find it feels very private, and the bedroom area has its own curtains if you want to still leave the blinds up, which i like doing to keep the feeling of the open space...
properties.house_rules: One Very important requirement... During the day 7 days a week, my building is a place of work & home for some really lovely people who are doing amazing work. the walls alas are not very soundproof, and so sound can travel.. pretty easily. This apartment is NOT suitable to people intending on turning it into party studio... by all means have a great time and relax in the space, but As i have lovely neighbours who's eardrums, workspace & sleep need to be respected, i ask that you please  dont have it as a party space and keep noise down after around 11 or so ... play music, relax,have a couple of friends over  and enjoy yourselves for sure, but its not cool to blast the music super loud and party on till the break of dawn... It is a creative space but also a professional one first and foremost, and this is something that is SUPER important and please only apply if you respect this ... :) Its a really fun and easy going building to be in with lots of lovely interesting people, and so if
properties.host_about:
I am a freelance photographer that lives in Sydney, that works all over Australia, and that loves to explore the world..

I have lived in share houses  & travelled staying on friends couches, for many years, and also of course used Air B'n'b many (URL HIDDEN) I am completely respectful of other peoples environments / belongings / lives... 

As a host : I open up my home to people i hope enjoy the city and the space as much as i do , and are respectful...and in return i will be as helpful and sharing as possible, so you can have an amazing experience of the beautiful and amazing city that is sydney! I am happy to pass on as much knowledge about the local tips on the best places to go / see / eat / drink / be merry... If its independence &  some freedom without interference in your own private oasis you are searching for , then you can have that for sure! as its work that takes me away from my space, i wont be present . but happy to always be on the end of a phone /txt / email to answer your questions you might need, or have a chat about sydney!
guest:
I am a reliable person, who loves the idea of exploring new places and meeting new people... I think its great being able to find things in common and share experiences of the places we live and travel, and personal recommendations of the locals way to be in a city...but also very independent and wont be a burden on anywhere or anyone where I am staying... I plan to get out there and explore!



5 things i cant live without - well, that is certainly not enough to cover anything...
but I can say coffee...
good food, good friends new & old, respectful and sharing people...
art, music, design, travel, family, friends, travel, chocolate mousse, love, beer, cheese, film, landscapes.... 5 not enough see the list just goes on...

I love the concept of air bnb - getting a bit closer to the  local life, in an unknown place... so I welcome any suggestions of things to go / see! And happy to provide mine in return... :)

thanks... enjoy..

properties.name: Inner-city stylish Brunswick apt
properties.summary: Character-filled Brunswick apartment with one bedroom, huge balcony with garden, separate bathroom, tuned piano and books aplenty. A perfect base for your culture-filled trip. Inner-city Melbourne at its best.
properties.space: Large top-floor, secure apartment in heart of Brunswick in inner-city Melbourne with extraordinary west-facing balcony (4m x 4m) for you to enjoy morning coffee or yoga and beautiful evening sunsets.   So many places are sparse and sterile, this is the opposite. Styled with tasteful artwork and design features; a curated selection of books; a recently-tuned piano; and located right in the thick of the city's inner north, this abode will literally feel like your home away from home.  The apartment is an unusually large space for a one bedroom pad. It is light-filled with floor to ceiling windows; wooden floors; a little office nook where you can set up your laptop and catch up on emails; separate dining table; lounge area and fully-equipped kitchen.   The bedroom has a (seriously good!) queen size bed and loads of storage space and there is a separate bathroom with shower (toiletries supplied). properties.neighborhood_overview: Things to do in St Kilda : ( all approx 10 minutes or less walk away) *Visit  St Kilda Sea Baths' sea water pool, and  day spa & restaurants. *Heaps of great restaurants, bars and cafes at your door step *Walk through Albert Park home o the Grand Prix, directly opposite. *Walk to famous Acland street for the cakes, or the Sunday morning markets by Luna Park *Visit Penguins on the St Kilda pier as well as day fishing charters if you feel like going on a day trip. * Have a beer at "The Espie" famous live band venue near Luna Park.
properties.notes: Secure under cover parking & wi-fi included. Please advise if parking is required
properties.transit: Getting Around: #96 tram 80m away takes you to the Crown casino, Melbourne Exhibition Centre, Southern Cross (website hidden) Kilda Junction is 5 minutes away where you can get trams to pretty much anywhere in Melbourne including CBD - Flinders Street and Swanson street. *Public transport options are excellent and many guests who hire a car when just coming to Melbourne end up only using the car to get to and from the airport ! Worth considering before spending  renting a hire car
properties.access: Full use of apartment - gourmet kitchen, dishwasher, washing machine, just like your home
properties.interaction: I like to meet and greet on arrival and show you how everything works etc. and welcome you to my apartment. So many Airbnb listings are now run by business, with email instructions, key drop and 4 cups a kettle and saucepan - you might as well be staying in  a motel chain - My apartment and service is the real airbnb experience of staying in a fully equipped home and offers so much more than the company run listings on airbnb.. I live in the apartment opposite and have actually become friends with some of my past guests or gone for a beer with them when staying others I meet on arrival and let them be but I'm always available should you need anything  I live in the same building so very close by if you need anything
properties.house_rules: Treat my home like it was your own and enjoy yourself  Leave the apartment clean and tidy on departure Respect my neighbours  regarding noise late at night etc. If parking is required you must request this in advance as it needs to  pre booked to ensure availablity Please  book for the correct number of people  Lost keys or fobs will incur a 150.00 charge If you smoke then please only on the balcony and keep door shut.
properties.host_about:
I'm an easy going, friendly professional mid 40's man - I grew up in Melbourne then lived overseas and in Sydney until moving back to Melbourne 4 years ago.

Airbnb has been a really positive experience welcoming great guests from all over the place. 

I work in Fire Safety now but spent years in upmarket hospitality and working around Europe on luxury private yachts so I know how to make things nice and I have a thing for original 60's retro furniture etc.. 

You will be staying in my home as opposed to a generic serviced or "business like" accommodation. 
 I  have some nice and unique things &  I hope to attract good clients who will love them as well. 
I also have a one bedroom apartment in the same block & level which I recently purchased so i am very close by if you need anything.

properties.name: Close to the Action in Richmond!
properties.summary: Our comfortable house has an unbeatable location for all your Melbourne sightseeing! Right in the heart of the action and with a comfy queen bed to relax into at the end of the day. Enjoy easy access to trams, and walking distance to Melbourne Park.
properties.space: With gorgeous wooden floors throughout and great living areas to relax in, this spot is ideal for all the major Melbourne sightseeing and events.   Melbourne Park, home to AAMI Station, Hisense Arena, Rod Laver Arena and the MCG, is a convenient 5-10min walk from home. This is the perfect spot to make your base for anyone visiting for the multitude of sporting, music and cultural events held in the city.  If you're after shopping, our nearest tram will take you straight to Chapel Street for amazing Melbourne shopping and the city is just a 10 minute tram away. It really does have everything you'll need! We are also a convenient 5 minutes from Richmond Station, a major train station to take you into the city or all the Eastern suburbs.  The bedroom is comfortable and can fit up to 2 people, and has a queen bed with storage to unpack your bags. There is a second bathroom on the same level for your exclusive use while you are staying. Clean towels, sheets and basic amenities are available

properties.neighborhood_overview: We have loved Richmond since we first moved here 6 and a half years ago and will probably never leave! It has so much to offer in terms of great food, wine, coffee, bars, sport and culture.  The sports hub of Melbourne is a 5-10min walk from our door. This is the perfect spot if you've come for any of the major sporting events through the year. Live music takes centre stage in the same area, as well as the Corner Hotel renowned for it's gigs.  Shopping is a block away on Swan Street, Chapel Street not far and if the city is more your scene, 10 minutes on the tram will get you there.  Richmond is completed with tree-lined streets of Victorian houses and great little nooks and crannies to go for a walk to.
properties.notes: If you're allergic to or don't like cats, this may not be suitable for you, as our 2 moggies are extremely friendly and rule the roost! If you do like cats though, you'll have one nearby as often as you want them.
properties.transit: We are within walking distance of the 78 and 70 Tram, and a 5minute walk from Richmond station.
properties.access: Guests will have access to the kitchen/living area and the courtyard. Please make yourself at home and we'll show you where all the breakfast and day-to-day utensils are.
properties.interaction: We will be home during your stay, I work from home a few days a week and Marty is in hospitality so he works odd days. We are very relaxed and you are more than welcome to join us in the lounge if you feel like it. We are also more than happy to provide directions, tips, cafe or restaurant recommendations and anything else you may need, but are flexible to your needs. If you'd prefer to be left to your own devices we will completely accommodate that!
properties.house_rules: Although we don't have a lot of rules we do ask you to be quiet and respectful of the space. Marty works very early hours, so if you're coming in late, please keep the sound down! We also ask that you don't invite guests over. Please keep the shared spaces clean and tidy, and if you are making a meal, please clean and tidy up afterwards.
properties.host_about:
My name is Helen and I'm originally from South Africa. I met my husband while living in New Zealand and we moved to Melbourne 6 years ago. I am self-employed and he is a chef. We love everything that Melbourne has to offer, great food and wine, a cultural hub and live sporting and music gigs all the time. 
We love to travel too and explore new places and meet new people.

properties.neighborhood_overview: What's South Yarra like? Who wouldn't love staying in the center of Melbourne's best shopping, best restaurants, best night life and entertainment. From here you can walk to some of Melbourne's finest spots, the Yarra River, the Botanical Gardens, Fed Square,the city, Southbank and more. Dine on street, people watch, enjoy fashion, glamour and style all day, every day, all year round. Shopping's the name of the game in South Yarra, where Chapel Street reigns supreme. The fashion strip contains all manner of high-end designer boutiques, chain-stores, hipster hang-outs, cinemas and gift shops. There's also a seemingly unlimited array of cafes and restaurants to help revive weary shoppers by day, and bars and clubs to keep the buzz going at night. Naturally then, South Yarra attracts the young, hip and fashion conscious, at least on its main strip and the streets immediately surrounding. The residents are a mix of young professionals, families and empty nesters – all attracted to this sal

Rates are negotiable for long stays and last minute bookings

properties.host_about:
UNIQUE SHORT STAYS, SOUTH YARRA

Hi There!

I'm a corporate events professional based in East Melbourne/South Yarra in Melbourne. Friendly, easy going & accommodating. I am passionate about events, travel, food, wine, meeting new people & new experiences! 

Our homes are in inner city Melbourne. South Yarra/St Kilda Rd Precinct/East Melbourne. Brillant access to CBD but slightly removed for peace and quiet at night. They are certainly mere minutes from Melbourne's CBD and all major inner Melbourne attractions that make Melbourne "Marvellous".

We aim to provide the most cost effective and best value designer/boutique accommodation in inner Melbourne.  

They are ideal for leisure travellers who are looking for a unique place to call home whilst in Melbourne,or for corporate professionals working short-term in CBD/inner city. Perhaps you're coming to our fair city for one of our many special events....?

If you are interested in one of the properties i have listed but the dates are unavailable, please check my other listings under my profile or please email me through airbnb messaging system, as l will likely have another apartment/home available that will suit your needs.  I am here to provide suggestions where you see fit

Any questions please don't hesitate to call out, look forward to chatting with you about your finer requirements. 

Myself and our events network are here to assist you. More than happy to provide sights/restaurant/event/cafe or transport tips to ensure a memorable, extraordinary, safe  and convenient trip!

I have airbnb on my iphone, so i normally reply rapidly.

Feel free to contact me anytime.

Cheers Alex, Unique Short Stays
