properties.neighborhood_overview: Although this is city living, the neighbourhood is spacious. Our block has a large range of multicultural residents - business professionals, families, students. Recommend - Frances Cafe (Ground Floor of Building), GJ's Grill in adjacent laneway, Vic Market Wednesday night market, 'Aroma' Thai massage around the corner, unique 'Cat Cafe' on the corner, Victoria St eateries, William St cafes,  Melbourne Central shopping mall (including cinemas and bowling alley),
properties.notes: The studio is also close to a 'Goget' car share facility. There is a cafe downstairs. City Baths are a block away. Nearby Elizabeth St is excellent for cheap eateries. Victoria Market - just across the road - is legendary.
properties.transit: Close to buses, No 55 tram (William St), 59, 19, 55 and 57 trams (Elizabeth St, Flagstaff and Melbourne Central Stations.  There are cheap (blue) bikes available all over CBD Melbourne Bike Share (mel(URL HIDDEN) Nearest docking place is Flagstaff Gardens/Peel St (turn left out of studio). Taxi rank at Queen Vic Market, Peel St side (turn left out of studio then right along Peel). Free tram travel within CBD which includes the No. 55 stop on cnr Franklin/Peel. For other areas such as Carlton/Fitzroy/MCG/Tennis Centre you need a MYKI card - 6 then top up with ‘Myki Money’ - or ‘Myki Pass’ for a weekly or monthly. Purchase at any 7-11 store (nearest on Elisabeth or William), or Flagstaff Station on William). If travelling outside free zone but in inner suburbs you touch on; touching off is optional You do need a MYKI for all train and bus travel and you touch on AND off. Hold the Myki on the pad until it beeps or shows ‘touch on/off successful’ Train tip – Flagstaff and Melbourne Centra
properties.access: When you rent here you have access to the whole space, including the wi-fi. We will meet you to deliver and pick up the key.
properties.interaction: If you need any help or advice, just give us a call. We know Melbourne well so you can really feel at home. Also, David speaks fluent French, German and Italian and some Spanish.
properties.house_rules: We prefer checkin after 7 am and checkout before 5 pm, and cannot accommodate arrivals/departures between midnight and 6 am (we live a long way away from the studio).  Guests at least eighteen years old, please. Smoke and pet-free zone.  Please leave the studio as you found it. Report any breakages immediately. Above all, please do not leave the key in the letter box. Please respect after-hours noise rules as this is a residential block.
properties.host_about:
I am married to Belinda Saltmarsh-Kram. We have two boys, aged 20 and 17, two puppies and a cat. I have two children and two grandchildren from a previous marriage, these lovely people live in Sydney. 

My background is in classical music, so I do all I can to spread the love of a huge repertoire of great music to those whose main listening may be in contemporary music. I can recommend the violin concertos of J.S. Bach, the operas of Mozart and Puccini, the piano music of Chopin and many other treasures.

As I have lived is a number of countries, I enjoy meeting people from all sorts of cultural background and also belong to a number of international organisations which build friendship around the world.

properties.summary: On the Beach is a small apartment block of 11 apartments. With beautiful features such as a bay window to the beach.  The location is perfect, tram at the back of the street block, Port Phillip Bay opposite the front door and gorgeous walks.
properties.space: Apartment on the beach front in Melbourne. This is a block of 11 apartments, it is quiet and beautifully located.  It is located between Port Phillip Bay and Albert Park Lake, which is about half way across the western side of the Albert Park Reserve (a state park), hence the name "Middle" Park. Middle Park, along with neighbouring Albert Park contains some of the best preserved terrace house and Victorian architecture in Melbourne and is part of a strict heritage-conservation area.  This is a gorgeous apartment in Middle Park.  The apartment has one bedroom with a queen size bed.  The apartment is in a beautiful location on Beaconsfield Parade, with a wonderful beach outside the front door.  There is a tram stop around the corner which will take you to the City or the opposite way to St. Kilda.  You can walk along the Esplanade to Port Melbourne or St. Kilda.  The South Melbourne Market is only a short tram ride away and there is the local village (Armstrong Street) with good coffee s

properties.name: Modern, Bright 2BR Apartment in Hawthorn East
properties.summary: This light and sunny recently renovated 2 bedroom apartment located in the tree lined streets of Hawthorn East will comfortably accommodate 4 people and is the perfect location for the Australian Open Tennis and other events in Melbourne.   It has wifi, air-conditioning, gas stoves, laundry facilities, all linen supplied and is only a short walking distance to public transport. With no surrounding apartments it's very quiet, has wonderful open views and its own separate entrance and car space.
properties.space: There is a Queen Size bed in the Master bedroom and the second bedroom. Both rooms have WIR and cupboards for storing clothing and other items during your stay. You can use condiments in the kitchen if you wish to cook at home and basic cooking equipment is provided i.e. kettle, toaster, Nespresso machine. There is a short flight of stairs up to the apartment and a car space is provided.

properties.neighborhood_overview: Hawthorn is an established area that has the very best that Melbourne can offer. Located less than half an hour from the beach, the CBD and several golf courses, a variety of activities are within easy reach. Locally, there are a number of cafes and shops within walking distance. Try Porgie and Mr Jones, Olio & Payne, Our Kitchenette, The Counter, Axil Coffee Roasters, Crabapple Kitchen and Oscar Mike for starters and then simply work your way down, there are plenty of options!
properties.transit: The apartment is 20-30 minutes on public transport to the city. With a 30 minute tram ride to the Rod Laver Arena it is a wonderful location for tennis lovers who want the best of both worlds, a relaxing place to stay and a short commute to the hustle and bustle of the city. The no. 37 tram is less than a 5 minute walk from the apartment. The Auburn Railway Station (Alamein, Belgrave and Lilydale Line) is a 15 minute walk.
properties.access: Full apartment with all amenities provided and a  welcome hamper including wine, tea, cereal, bread, milk and some tasty treats upon arrival.
properties.interaction: If you need any assistance during your stay I am only a phone call away.
properties.host_about: Hi, I'm Alexis and I currently live in Melbourne with my husband Steve and son Charlie. We love exploring what Melbourne has to offer and love going for brunch every chance we can get! We love to meet new people so with our apartment in Hawthorn East it's an opportunity for us to give people a warm inviting place to stay and a friendly service as well. We hope you enjoy!

properties.name: Beautiful huge room St Kilda West
properties.summary: Large room with sitting area looking onto front garden, new queen bed and brand new ensuite in heritage-listed Victorian home. Very quiet street. Easy walking distance to Albert Park, St Kilda Beach and 2 city tram lines. A perfect base to explore the best of Melbourne! Please note: we no longer have a dog. Must update that photo!
properties.space: Equipped with brand new queen bed, your beautiful, private room is approximately 10 metres long with a lovely ambiance and lounge area. You have the exclusive use of a new, stylish ensuite accessed directly from your room. There is also a small fridge and tea/coffee making facilities in your room. In addition, there is a general lounge area and a secluded leafy rear garden. The house is secure and in a no through road, making our area very quiet.  We look forward to welcoming you.

properties.neighborhood_overview: It's a comfortable walk to : Melbourne's iconic St Kilda Beach precinct, Fitzroy Street , Picturesque Albert Park, Middle Park village, Biking around this area of Melbourne is a Mecca..laden with cycling routes and bike paths. City access via bike is 20 minutes or two tram lines are within 5 minutes walk from the house. City centre is 15 minutes on the tram. Bike paths along the beach will take you to Brighton to the south and Port Melbourne to the north.  Bike hire is nearby if our bikes aren't available. The immediate local area boasts many cafes and shops, mini supermarket, and hotels/bars.
properties.notes: Please note we only take a maximum of 2 guests in the room
properties.transit: 2 tram lines, (96 & 12) to the city and beyond, are both 5 minutes walk from the house. Cycling is super easy and safe, with dedicated bike paths or bike lanes on the roads. Major interest precincts lie with a 3 kilometre radius and the city 5 kms away.
properties.access: Street parking is unlimited. Internet. Tons of cafes to fine dining, in walking distance
properties.interaction: One of us will be home to welcome you.   We'll have many cafe and local shop recommendations, places to see or visit, both in Melbourne or the countryside, if you'd like them. You'll be able to enjoy the privacy of a beautiful room with quality amenities for you,  in a lovely home close to everything. Karen speaks some French and Italian. We have also created a folder using our insider knowledge about local attractions, cafes, restaurants for you.
properties.house_rules: We're a non smoking household. Normal check in is from 2.00pm Normal check out is by 11.00am Please note: Check in on Saturday you can drop bags between 11am - 12.30pm then check in after 5.30pm. ( I have a regular commitment on Saturday afternoons).
properties.host_about:
We are very lucky to live in such a great spot - close to the city, but a walk to the beach and the park. 

We cycle alot because it's so easy to get around on the bike paths and through the park. It's great to go for a run around the Lake - or stroll around with friends. There are so many shows, concerts and events in Melbourne, there's always something to do!

We've stayed in some great AirBnb houses, we look forward to welcoming you to ours.

properties.host_about:
I'm a 39 year old Early Childhood Educator with a lust for travel! I love exploring and feeling my way through new experiences in lively places! Discovering people, food and different cultures makes up a huge part of my leisure time! I love chatting to people, finding out about them and their experiences and sharing mine. But no matter where I go, I love coming back home to this pocket of the world - it's my favourite!
I've lived in Melbourne for most of my life, and have travelled extensively. 
I love a central, convenient and clean place to stay when abroad and this is what I have to offer. It's a two bedroom apartment with lively restaurants and cafes nearby as well as parks, gardens and the beautiful Port Phillip bay, to showcase true Bayside living in the world's most liveable city, glorious Melbourne!  
Look forward to meeting you!

We are a house of women who are health focused (a few gluten free people) , fun, creative, musically inspired, socially conscious & supportive.

I am a part time university lecturer & run a social enterprise developing wellness for schools and community. I am pretty passionate about my work. I am also a health coach. My background is diverse - a health professional, educator and creative media. 
I have lived in several other countries, but now, after some earlier confusion, am convinced that despite the tyranny of distance, we are indeed the worlds most livable city! :)

properties.name: "Crimea River"  Burnley/Richmond : Close to City
properties.summary: Imagine arriving in Melbourne parking the car in your own private garage,  opening the front door to be greeted by a beautiful 2 bedroom house full of stunning art with your own Bluetooth speaker to fill the space with music. Make a coffee and sit down on a couch or armchair if you prefer and absorb yourself in your favourite Netflix shows. Next morning have breakfast at Serotonin before entering the freeway to escape to The Yarra Valley or catch a train to the city or walk along the Yarra River
properties.space: We've filled the house with beautiful original art and art prints from our Art Gallery, Tusk Gallery plus we've gone to great lengths to make the space  a comfortable haven where you can cook your own meals or eat takeaway on the back deck while listening to music through a bluetooth speaker or simply watch your favourite shows on Netflix. If you need to work you'll have broadband internet access and we've got 2 bedrooms one with a king and the second with a queen so you can share the house with another couple or your kids. We also have a blow up single bed (with an electric pump) available for an extra person.

If you need to work you'll have broadband internet access and we've got 2 bedrooms one with a king and the second with a queen so you can share the house wit
properties.neighborhood_overview: Burnley is like an oasis next to a bustling city, a fast freeway and superb public transport. You could play a game of cricket on the street and not get run over or trot down to the beautiful Gardens in the next street or go for a leisurely run along the Yarra River. Serotonin Cafe is a must visit. It's all about healthy fresh food and smiling faces.
properties.notes: Situated in Burnley/Richmond minutes from walking tracks along the Yarra, 200 metres from the entry to the Monash Freeway or 250 metres from Burnley Railway Station, skip across the railway line and catch a tram. A short walk to the MCG and The Tennis Centre. A stones throw from Serotonin and Friends, 2 fabulous cafes that both have fabulous coffee and food. It's also a short walk to Melbourne's famous Victoria St Vietnamese Food Precinct.
properties.transit: Once again....you have your own private garage accessed from the bluestone lane behind the house. You'll be literally 200 metres from the entry to the Monash Freeway turn left and it will take you to Melbourne's beautiful Eastern Suburbs, The Yarra Valley or The Mornington Peninsula or if you turn tight you'll be in the City and beyond, Flemington, The Showgrounds, and over the Westgate Bridge to Geelong. Less than 5 minutes on foot to Burnley Railway Station or the trams in Swan St, Richmond
properties.access: You have access to the whole house. It's all yours, 2 bedrooms, a bathroom with a large shower, a large living area with internet and a 55 inch TV plus a well appointed kitchen. A very large back deck with outdoor furniture and your own private garage.
properties.interaction: We own 3 art galleries close by and you can ring us for any info you need about our house or Melbourne in general. Apart from this you'll have the house to yourselves and as much privacy as you want.
properties.house_rules: Treat our home as you would treat your own. Invite guests but no big parties. We'd rather that you didn't bring your pets with you. And please do not smoke inside (this is a 100% rule). If you must smoke you can go out to the back deck (but close the doors and don't leave ash or butts lying around).
properties.host_about: Hi. My name is Gary Collier and my wife is Georgina Berry. We own 3 art galleries in Melbourne. We live about 45 kms out of Melbourne at the base of The Dandenong Ranges. My loves are art, design, music, cooking. Georgie is a trained architect. We also love travelling but that's on hold at the moment while our 16 year old son finishes off High School. Our last big trip was to Scandinavia. I tend to be a big fan of Asia while Georgie is more inclined to Europe. We are doing our best to set up our house in Burnley so that you feel really comfortable and at home when you visit Melbourne.

properties.name: Huge room in 1890s artists mansion
properties.summary: Absolutely huge light filled room in St Kilda mansion. The bedroom is the former studio of the artist Kenneth Rowell. This beautiful mansion was built in the 1890s & it is one of the only buildings in Melbourne built in the American Romanesque style.
properties.space: The Goddess mansion c1890 A St Kilda icon since it first took its place in c1890, this rare and illustrious American Romanesque residence's significant period integrity is matched by the unique scope its spaces provide for a fabulous future. Grand exterior aesthetics introduce impressive period-rich interiors including luxuriously large lounge with huge open fireplace and beautiful arched window. Huge living and dining domain. A well-appointed kitchen with walk-in pantry is equipped with quality appliances including ILVE oven, Bosch dishwasher and its original wood fired stove. Upstairs, 5 bedrooms plus study, most with fireplaces are accompanied by a sun-drenched living room with balcony access. Features soaring ceilings and very unique architecture. The huge lounge room features a massive disco ball, dj booth and indoor cinema.  Was originally owned by the artist Kenneth Rowell... Note* The photos provided are of the previous tenants’ furniture.

properties.house_rules: 1) The unit is to be left in a clean condition, just as you found it. 2) Rubbish is to be placed in the bins downstairs in the basement. 3) All perishables are to be removed from the fridge. 4) Dishes are to be washed (in the dishwasher) and put away.  Glasses/cups are to be placed back in overhead cupboard with brim of cup/glass facing  up. 5) Benches and tables to be wiped and removed of any food crumbs. 6) We have allowed 2 hours for our cleaner to clean the unit.  If it requires more cleaning, you will be charged at 35 per hour and excess cleaning fee will be claimed from security deposit. 7)  If there is any damage to the property (interior or exterior) we will request for money to be held back from the security deposit and in the case where security deposit is not sufficient we will need to seek compensation. 8) Maximum number of guests to stay at the property overnight is 6.  Noise levels are to be kept reasonable.

properties.name: Two level apartment in heart of CBD
properties.summary: Historic art deco apartment split over two levels generous levels. Spacious one bedroom apartment split over two levels, boasts plenty of natural light with floor to ceiling windows overlooking Melbourne CBD.
properties.space: An historic apartment located in the prestigious Dovers building. Positioned on the top floor residence, offers a bright light position with twin balconies opening over Drewery alley one of Melbournes famous laneways. This former five storey Tobacconist warehouse and factory was constructed in the Edwardian era and is enriched with Chicagoesque style and has traditional Melbourne cobbled stone laneway appeal. This spacious enhanced by the high concrete ceilings with distinctive mushroom pillars that have been standing for 107 years.

properties.name: BRILLIANT 2 BR home St Kilda East
properties.summary: The perfect 2 bedroom ground floor home for those wanting quiet, bright and green surroundings. Close to public transport, close walk to Carlisle St shopping strip and St Kilda Beach. Nice neighbourly community feel. Suitable for one or two adults plus child.
properties.space: The perfect 2 bedroom ground floor home for those wanting quiet, bright and green surroundings. Close to public transport (tram & bus stop less than 1 minute, train 10 mins), close walk to Carlisle Street shopping strip.  Nice neighbourly community feel. This genuinely excellent ground floor apartment sits at the rear of a lovely double storey 1940's block. The building sweeps around a large central courtyard and communal laundry with sunny lawns and established trees, giving fabulous outlooks from the impressive picture windows, as well as a sense of privacy and quiet from the world beyond. Once you step in the front door you'll be surprised at how spacious this two bedroom beauty feels. Timber floor boards and a built-in dining nook maximize storage and light. The kitchen includes gas stove and fridge.  Both bedrooms feature built-in robes and large windows, the master bedroom is seriously roomy, and includes a chest of drawers, a double bed and a single bed.   Take a shower or a bat

properties.neighborhood_overview: St Kilda East is right next to the fabulous St Kilda, either a short stroll or a tram will get you there in no time. With its famous beach, Luna park and plenty of cafes and restaurants this area is the place to be in Melbourne! Public transport is aplenty, so no need to get stuck in traffic, or looking for parking spots. Stroll down the road and have brunch, lunch or dinner, with plenty of tasty places to choose from. The St Kilda Botanial Gardens are closeby, should you wish to sit in the park and read a good book - or have a bbq. With Carlisle st, Acland st and Chapel st all very close, there is no lack of entertainment. Or head down to St Kilda at dusk to see the penguins for free.
properties.notes: People staying at this place will need to agree to the below and the house rules: - minimum length of stay is 30 days - suitable for one or two adults plus child - no offstreet parking available, however there is always space in the street
properties.transit: With trams to the City and Beach, as well as buses to Prahran Market and GlenHuntly Rd stopping literally 1 minute from the front entrance, and just a short walk to Balaclava, you couldn’t find a more convenient location!  Tram to the beach takes about 5 minutes. Car rental companies are down the road should you wish to head out of town for a bit.

properties.interaction: We live next door, so happy to give you some hints on things to do, see etc, or to just have a cuppa together and a chat. If you like your space, thats fine too.

properties.neighborhood_overview: I've chosen to live in the same street for over 20 years....I love it!!  Everything is at your fingertips....markets, city, cafes, cinemas, galleries, high end restaurants, fabulous shopping, laneways to explore, amazing coffee, cheap-eats, the beach, endless activities...sailing, golf, kite-surfing, world-class pools....eclectic St Kilda, Upmarket Albert (URL HIDDEN) all easily accessible from your guest house!
properties.transit: Trams, trains, hire cars, hire bikes & buses....between 1min to 10mins away.

properties.interaction: Upon arrival & departure. Otherwise it's up to you! Chat over a glass of vino upstairs or just do-your-thang within the privacy of your space!
properties.house_rules: - Only booked guests allowed - Advise of any issues before departure
properties.host_about:
Whew!  Just returned home from a 2 minute stroll to the South Melbourne Market....couldn't choose from the incredible array of amazing cuisine, incredible stalls, music and friendly community spirit that we are famous for! 

I had comrades tonight including my daughter who shares my love for South Melbourne and our cool 4 bedroom, 3 level townhouse with stunning city views.  The good news is that your space is on the ground level which provides ease of access.  You will have a lovely bedroom overlooking a petite garden area with a private bathroom ensuite which is yours to enjoy. The private room is fully air-conditioned with a slim line TV and tea/coffee making facilities.   This space would suit an executive, couple or a single.

I've lived in this area for over 20 years and love the proximity to Albert Park Village, Gas Works Park, MSAC, the vibrancy of St Kilda, Luna Park, Sunday Market, beaches, Melbourne bikes, 24/7 Gym, Community Bus, 3 tram routes (1, 96, 112) which transports you to the best that inner Melbourne has to offer.   

Back to my evening....I'm about to venture onto the main balcony with a glass of vino and dinner....sauvignon  blanc is appealing tonight....light and crisp.  

That's a little bit about me, your host!  I would love to see you soon as a guest here in South Melbourne!
properties.street: South Melbourne, South Melbourne, VIC 3205, Australia

Enjoy leafy surrounds just minutes to the heart of South Yarra's shopping, parks and entertainment district.  My ground-floor apartment is perfect for singles or couples. It is clean, light and bright on a lovely leafy street, and has everything you need - comfortable bed, linens and towels, hairdryer, storage space, combined washer/dryer, microwave, tv/music system and free wi-fi. The apartment is all yours for the time you are staying, and you will have access to a secure parking spot. I use the apartment for a few days during the week, so I won't be there during your stay ... but if you need anything I'm only a phone call away.  The location can't be beat. Just steps to Toorak Road's shops and restaurants ... a short stroll to the famous Chapel Street shopping precinct and beautiful Fawkner Park ... 15 minutes' walk to Melbourne's renowned Royal Botanic Gardens ... Fun

properties.name: Tranquil Fitzroy Forest House
properties.summary: We are in the heart of Fitzroy's vibrant city life, yet nestled in a lush and peaceful little forest area.  Wake up to the sound of birds tweeting, stroll out onto your balcony and enjoy the morning air. Yet, you're a 2 mins stroll to Brunswick St!
properties.space: Downstairs, floor to ceiling windows in lounge & dining areas provides lots of light and a fantastic outlook onto our little forest garden, which is shared by other residents in our private city oasis. Upstairs, the master bedroom (our room & not usually available for use by guests) and the 3rd bedroom also have floor to ceiling windows with doors leading onto a balcony looking out over the forest areas.  Relax on our comfy sofa on balcony enjoying the afternoon sun. The 2nd bedroom has a floor to ceiling window & feature exposed brick wall.  Whilst we have 2 spare bedrooms, we only rent 1 room at a time via Air BnB, to ensure you always have private use of the bathroom. The little forest area is home to many birds, a resident cat and from time to time possums.

properties.notes: We have a pet rabbit, called Elvis. He's a friendly, fluffy lap eared rabbit.  He spends his time either in his hutch in the garden or hopping around our lounge. If you're not a fan of rabbits let us know & we'll ensure he stays in his hutch in his garden during your stay.
properties.transit: We're 2 mins walk to 2 different tram routes that head into the city - take your pick!  You might like to walk instead & that's a leisurely 20 mins stroll through beautiful Carlton Gardens.  The nearest train line is Parliament which is 20 mins walk.
properties.access: All downstairs rooms - lounge, dining, kitchen, powder room, patio, balcony, private garden and communal gardens.
properties.interaction: We work most days but we are around in the evenings and always on hand by mobile to help you with any questions you may have about the facilities in our home, or more generally about what to do, where to go & how to get there in & around Melbourne.
properties.house_rules: Our home is not suitable for very young children. Not suitable for pets unfortunately. No smoking. Weekday arrival after 5.30pm please.
properties.host_about:
I moved to Melbourne 4 years ago with a plan to stay for a 1 year adventure!  Here I am still loving every moment of life in the world's most liveable city.  I share our home in Fitzroy with my gorgeous Aussie man I met here a few years ago.  We love nature, so the tranquility of our home in a little forest, right in the heart of Fitzroy, is heaven for us!  We're a 2 mins stroll to Brunswick St, 10 mins to Smith St & Lygon St and 20 mins walk through beautiful Carlton Gardens to the top end of the city.  For us, this is the best spot in the Melbourne!

Whether you're here for pleasure, business or visiting friends & family, we welcome you into our home for single night or longer.  We both work much of the week but are usually home in the evenings and will be happy to chat to you about anything & everything.  If you're visiting for pleasure we have a collection of guide books & tourist brochures always on hand & will be happy to recommend our favourite bars & restaurants.

properties.name: A home away from home!
properties.summary: Our updated period home is the ideal retreat for families and travelling professionals for a stay in Melbourne. Located in a quiet street, only 12 mintues walk from trains/trams, 10 kms from the CBD & 12 kms from Tullamarine Airport. Free Wireless internet and Pets welcome!
properties.space: Our cute & cozy Edwardian home has been newly furnished and has ducted heating throughout. The 1st Bedroom has a queen size bed with spacious storage space & its own private ensuite and ceiling fan. No aircon in this room however has a portable evaporative cooler. 2nd Bedroom is set up with two single beds with storage space and air conditioning. The beds can also be configured into a king size bed for couples. 3rd Bedroom has bunkbeds and room has no air con however has a portable evaporative cooler and pedestal fan for the warmer months. Portacot & Highchair also available on request. The 2nd bathroom has a full size bath with shower & toilet.  Lounge area is air conditioned with 50 inch TV and DVD player with a selection of DVD movies to view at your convenience.  A comfortable 3 seater couch and 2 seater couch. A round dining table with 4 chairs. There are extra chairs in Bedroom 1 and Bedroom 3. Fully equipped kitchen with a 900 mm stove/oven. There is a toaster, microwave, kettle

properties.neighborhood_overview: This property is located in one of Melbourne's Blue chip suburbs. It is a beautiful quiet and safe neighbourhood. Close to both the airport and city (property is located aprox mid point between the two). Great shops, cafes, restaurants all walking distance. Show grounds and horse race tracks are easy to get to. Plenty of parks to explore. The Melbourne Zoo and hospitals are also very easy to get to from the property. There is so much to see and do in Melbourne and this property is a great place to stay whilst exploring this fabulous city.
properties.notes: We do have chickens in the backyard but no roosters so don't worry there will be no noisy wake up calls. Guests are also welcome to help themselves to fresh eggs. The girls names are Beyonce & Lady Gaga. Feel free to throw them any food scraps you may have. If you have a dog with a keen taste for chicken then just lets us know and we will have the ladies removed. We also upkeep the garden which is usually done on either a Friday or a Sunday depending on the weather. Don't stress we won't do it too early and we will give you a warning the day before. Recycle (yellow ) and landfill (red) Bins to be taken out every Wednesday morning for the weekly truck collection.
properties.transit: •12 min drive to/from airport via Tullamarine freeway (no traffic). However please allow 30mins during peak hours.  •Essendon railway station is the closest railway station for trips to Melbourne’s CBD.  To get to the station you can take a 15 min walk directly there or a 4 min walk to local bus stop where Bus route # 475 takes you to Essendon Railway Station. Use PTV (Public Transport Victoria) Journey Planner website (URL HIDDEN) for bus timetables and easy to follow directions  •Tram Route 59 provides an alternate mode of transport to Melbourne CBD, this is a 15 min walk to tram stop 42 (Grice st/Mt Alexander Rd) from where the tram takes approx 40mins` to CBD. This mode takes longer than the train.
properties.access: You have full use of the house and backyard including outdoor setting and playground equipment but we do use the back yard shed for storage of bodies...haha just kidding...but seriously don't go in there.
properties.interaction: I will attempt to greet you personally at check in however earlier check in is available as well upon request.  We also live just up the road so if there are any issues just let us know!
properties.house_rules: Our home is located in a quiet suburban street so while we are happy for you to entertain please respect our neighbours and refrain from noisy parties and playing loud music. We hope that you enjoy your stay and we ask is that you leave the property how you found it. We take great pride in ensuring that the property is clean and comfortable, so please be respectful of our belongings. Supplied vacuum, broom, mops and  cleaning products are located in laundry cupboard under sink for when you finish your stay and for any spill ages that may occur.  Keys are to be placed back in the lock box on departure. You must check out by 10am (unless arranged with the host for an alternate departure time). All food and rubbish must be removed from the property and placed in the outside bins. Bins to be taken out into the street on Wednesday mornings for rubbish collection. Lights, heating, cooling and appliances must be all switched off whenever leaving the house and upon check out. Air conditioning
properties.host_about: I live in Melbourne with my husband and 3 children. We love to travel and enjoy good food in our lovely city as well as spending quality time with family and friends. If you need eating out suggestions please feel free to ask or look up my guide book for good local eats.

properties.summary: Our apartment is in a very trendy area North of the city - Collingwood close to Melbourne Museum, Le Bon Ton, Union Club Hotel, MCG, Fitzroy Gardens, Gertrude St, Brunswick St, Johnston St.  . You’ll love my place because of the location, the many bars, pubs, delicious cafes and restaurants. If you're coming to Melbourne/Collingwood to get a piece of the action and dine in the foodie scene then you've come to the right place!. My place is good for couples and solo adventurers.

properties.host_about:
Hello, 

We are Emma and Mick, we've been living in our home for 1 year and we absolutely love it and we want to share it with other travelers. Having caught the travel bug a few years ago we have both spent time living in London and Whistler and traveling around Europe, Canada and USA we are now settled back in our home town. 

We work full time and spend our weekends exploring Melbourne and the rest of the country! We'd love to share some of the things we've discovered and can offer you a nice place to rest in between your own adventure. 

We look forward to meeting you!

properties.access: We don't share your space with others when you are there.  This whole huge house is your and yours alone, whether you sleep 2 or 12. There is off-street parking for your car in the carport. Like all others, we do require a security bond. After your have booked with AirBnB, you need to contact us via email and pay the security bond of 250. This is returned to you after your stay. After the security bond is paid you will be sent details on where to find the key-safe and how to open it to get your keys.
properties.interaction: We are here to help! We will not intrude on your stay, but are only ever a phone call away if you need us!
properties.house_rules: Our rules are no different to any others... There is a welcome Booklet on the Kitchen bench with lots of handy information in it which you will need to read. The tariff is based on the number of guests quoted at the time of enquiry. This can be altered at any time prior to the stay and the tariff altered, however if more guests stay than are declared on the booking, the security deposit will be forfeited and the nightly charge for the extra undeclared guests will be at the rate of 50 per guest per night for the total nights on the booking. Please make sure the number of guests booked and quoted for is correct prior to check-in so we can properly plan cleaning and laundry etc etc.

properties.neighborhood_overview: What's South Yarra like? Who wouldn't love staying in the center of Melbourne's best shopping, best restaurants, best night life and entertainment. From here you can walk to some of Melbourne's finest spots, the Yarra River, the Botanical Gardens, Fed Square,the city, Southbank and more. Dine on street, people watch, enjoy fashion, glamour and style all day, every day, all year round. Shopping’s the name of the game in South Yarra, where Chapel Street reigns supreme. The fashion strip contains all manner of high-end designer boutiques, chain-stores, hipster hang-outs, cinemas and gift shops. There’s also a seemingly unlimited array of cafes and restaurants to help revive weary shoppers by day, and bars and clubs to keep the buzz going at night. Naturally then, South Yarra attracts the young, hip and fashion conscious, at least on its main strip and the streets immediately surrounding. The residents are a mix of young professionals, families and empty nesters – all attracted to this sal
properties.transit: Super central location.  - Trams almost at front door. short ride to CBD and surrounds  - South Yarra railway station is around corner / next door (6mins to CBD)  - Yarra walking/riding trails close by, walk to CBD or AAMI Park/Melbourne Park/MCG/Hi Sense Area.
properties.access: everything
properties.host_about:
UNIQUE SHORT STAYS, SOUTH YARRA

Hi There!

I'm a corporate events professional based in East Melbourne/South Yarra in Melbourne. Friendly, easy going & accommodating. I am passionate about events, travel, food, wine, meeting new people & new experiences! 

Our homes are in inner city Melbourne. South Yarra/St Kilda Rd Precinct/East Melbourne. Brillant access to CBD but slightly removed for peace and quiet at night. They are certainly mere minutes from Melbourne's CBD and all major inner Melbourne attractions that make Melbourne "Marvellous".

We aim to provide the most cost effective and best value designer/boutique accommodation in inner Melbourne.  

They are ideal for leisure travellers who are looking for a unique place to call home whilst in Melbourne,or for corporate professionals working short-term in CBD/inner city. Perhaps you're coming to our fair city for one of our many special events....?

If you are interested in one of the properties i have listed but the dates are unavailable, please check my other listings under my profile or please email me through airbnb messaging system, as l will likely have another apartment/home available that will suit your needs.  I am here to provide suggestions where you see fit

Any questions please don't hesitate to call out, look forward to chatting with you about your finer requirements. 

Myself and our events network are here to assist you. More than happy to provide sights/restaurant/event/cafe or transport tips to ensure a memorable, extraordinary, safe  and convenient trip!

I have airbnb on my iphone, so i normally reply rapidly.

Feel free to contact me anytime.

Cheers Alex, Unique Short Stays

properties.name: Sunny Charming Private 2 BR Apt in Upper East Side
properties.summary: I would love to host you in my private 2 BR / 1 Bath apartment just east of Central Park! You will have complete privacy and your own separate entrance!  Located on a beautiful tree-lined block in a safe and quiet neighborhood. Close to all the major attractions. So many great restaurants and bars and subway is 2 blocks away. My place is perfect for singles, couples, families, large groups, business travelers and tourists! Feel free to book instantly!
properties.space: Hello! My apartment is east of Central Park, surrounded by a lot of nice restaurants and bars around the area. You are reserving a private 2BR (I live on the other side of the apartment but you will have the space all to yourself!) The apartment comes fully furnished and fully stocked with towels, fresh sheets, toiletries and water bottles. Note that there is no kitchen in the unit but we provide mini fridges for you to store food / drinks and microwaves to reheat it. There's a washer and dryer in the basement of the building. I also provide a Keurig so feel free to enjoy complimentary coffee!  The 2 private rooms are one of the nicer / newer apartments you'll find. You have plenty of space to keep your belongings, luggage, and souvenirs. The place is fully equipped with AC, heater and fast WiFi! The apartment was recently renovated and furnished with all new items!  Both the bedrooms have windows so there is always a ton of natural light and fresh air (if you want)  Stay and feel at h

properties.neighborhood_overview: What I love most about my neighborhood is that is safe and quiet but close to all the major attractions. There are so many delicious restaurants, cafes and cute boutiques all within walking distance.  This is your chance to experience life on the Upper East Side. The subways are within walking distance so you are minutes away from all major attractions.  Nearby Attractions:  -Gracie Mansion - Central Park - The Metropolitan Museum of Art  - The Guggenheim Museum - Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai - NYC Heath + Hospitals - Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis Reservoir - East River -Randall's Island Park A quick subway ride away - Times Square - 5th Avenue Shopping  - Broadway Theater District  - Empire State Building  - Hudson River -Bryant Park -Grand Central  and so much more!
properties.transit: A block from N and Q trains! 3 blocks from 4,5,6. Cross-town and downtown buses. It's a very convenient location.
properties.access: Two private bedrooms and private bathroom all to yourself. Separate entry from the owner, so you won't even see me unless of course you want me to show you around town :)
properties.interaction: Since I am on the other side of the apartment, I try my best to give my guests space. However, if there is anything that you need, I am available by phone/email/text!
properties.host_about: Hi! I'm a software engineer for Apple and a graduate of Columbia University. My parents immigrated to the states two decades ago and I have lived in 5 different states. I, now, proudly call New York City my home. Love to travel to different counties, meet interesting people and a big foodie. I have hosted a number of people from local New Yorkers to international globe travelers. Would love to share my lovely space with you!

properties.summary: Middle of design district just across the river from South Yarra is this newly completed, architect-designed home.   Walking distance to most major sporting stadiums, Chapel Street shopping precinct & Botanical Gardens. Occupy almost the whole floor!
properties.space: This newly completed designer house joins a 110 year-old terrace house (with 2 bedrooms downstairs) with a 2 storey modernist extension with internal courtyard and garden. The very spacious bedroom has a queen sized Sealy ensemble bed with modernist, mid century furniture pieces, wardrobe, high ceiling, desk, Eames leather office chair, George Nelson bubble lamp, ornate Victorian fireplace and a small teak sideboard. The open plan living and dining area is decorated with Danish designer mid century furniture including Poul Henningsen lamps, imported Danish chairs and lounge, teak sideboard, and George Nelson clock.

properties.name: Master Ensuite in Fabulous Fitzroy
properties.summary: We have a beautiful master bedroom, fully furnished with a queen bed and wardrobe, and private ensuite bathroom. The house is fully furnished with an open floor plan lounge and fully equipped kitchen. Perfect location in Fitzroy, trams just 100m away
properties.space: We have a modern, 2 bed and 2 bath townhouse located in the heart of Fitzroy. We are renting out the master bedroom, which is fully furnished (queen bed and matching furniture) and has it's own ensuite bathroom.  The door to the master bedroom is located just next to the front door, so guests will have a private space to relax. The second bedroom (ours) is located further down the hall. Upstairs is a beautiful open floor plan lounge with a dining area and fully equipped kitchen. One wall of the lounge is a giant sliding glass door which opens onto a balcony - our favorite feature of the house!

You will have access to your private bedroom and bathroom, as well as the kitchen, dining and lounge area upstairs. My partner and I are at work dur
properties.neighborhood_overview: Fitzroy is, in our opinion, the best neighborhood in Melbourne! You can walk to the CBD in 20 minutes and it's easy to get around by tram. We are just around the corner from Smith St, which is chock full of restaurants, bars, and shops. Two blocks away is Gertrude St, which also has plenty of cool places to eat and drink. Lastly Brunswick St is about a 7 minute walk away. Basically there are enough bars and restaurants within a 10 minute radius of our house to keep you busy for a year! Fitzroy has a very cool, relaxed vibe and we think you'll love it as much as we do. Other nearby highlights include the beautiful Fitzroy Gardens (less than a 10 minute walk) and the lovely Carlton Gardens (about a 15 minute walk).
properties.transit: The number 86 tram is just 100m away, on Smith St. This will take you into the city, down Bourke St, and all the way to Docklands.  You can also walk about 8 minutes to Victoria Parade for the 12 or 109. Also about 8 minutes away is number 11 on Brunswick St. The trams are a great way to get around Melbourne and we have 2 spare Myki cards for your use. If you happen to have a bike or rent one, biking is our favorite way to get around.
properties.access: You will have access to your private bedroom and bathroom, as well as the kitchen, dining and lounge area upstairs.
properties.interaction: My partner and I are at work during the day and are often home in the evenings but not always. We are more than happy to give directions and advice and have a friendly chat, but generally we do our own thing.
properties.house_rules: This is our home and we kindly ask that your treat it with respect. We are happy to have you cook, but please clean up after yourself.
properties.host_about:
Hi, I'm Barbara. I'm originally from Philadelphia but moved to Melbourne in January, 2015. I absolutely love it here! I love to travel and enjoy meeting new people. In my free time I like to run, bike, hike, eat tasty food, drink tasty wine, and of course spend time with friends and family.
I'm new to hosting on AirBnb but I'm looking forward to sharing my home with friendly people. Fitzroy is a wonderful place to live and I look forward to showing others just how great it is!

Cheers Alex, Unique Short Stays

properties.name: 2-bed Apt. near Botanic Gardens
properties.summary: Comfortable, well-located two-bedroom apartment with all the amenities in a quiet cul-de-sac. Minutes from Melbourne's Botanic Gardens and public transport (5 mins to Tram and few more to the train). Easy walk to great restaurants, bars and shopping.
properties.space: This 55 square metre 2-bedroom apartment is located on the 2nd floor of a quiet 6-apartment block accessed via staircases, on both sides of the building. The apartment has large windows and gets good natural light yet is very private. The building is a typical 60's era block (so not new.) but is comfortable and spacious. The kitchen is fully functional with gas cooktop and oven (which is old, but works fine, quirks of which will be explained on arrival) and small bathroom. There is a shared laundry at the bottom of the building (coin operated) accessibly only to the occupants of the building.  This is my home, which I rent while away on holiday and would hope would be your home for your stay. This is an old building and as such has a few quirks, yet is spacious and comfortable.

The apartment is in close proximity to great restaurants, bars and the Chapel Street shopping precinct.

properties.host_about:
I am an Architect and furniture/lighting designer based in Melbourne, Australia. I find myself travelling often for work or pleasure.... setting up a little nest in random locations. 

My work keeps me very busy during the day (and often night) and in my free time I keep myself busy in the kitchen or with a good book.

I love meeting new people and being able to exchange a little life experience with total strangers (who hopefully become friends). Which brings me to Airbnb and its ability to push me outside my blinkered bubble.... :-)

I'm a little obsessed with Melbourne's food scene...... more than happy to be a guide (time permitting) or at least introduce my favourite haunts around town...

properties.neighborhood_overview: Pyrmont has the luxury of being located extremely close to the city, but is quiet and clean. Jackson's Landing is the exclusive area of the suburb and features high rise apartments with full views of the city, with very little street parking available. The Star casino is 2 mins away and popular Darling Harbour is about 10 mins away by walk. Also the apartment is nearby the Sydney Fish Markets, Wentworth Park and Central.
properties.notes: FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS ABOUT THE PLACE: Q: Is it near the Lightrail? A: The apartment is about 4 minutes away (walking) from the Lightrail and easy to get to - it's just around the corner.  Q: Do you have an elevator? A: Yes! No need to walk up 7 sets of stairs! But you can only access the elevator with a swipekey or when you buzz somebody up. There is also fire escape stairs to evacuate in case of an emergency.  Q: Is the neighborhood safe? A: Extraordinarily. Jacksons Landing is commonly referred to as a retirement village because it is safe, peaceful, quiet and people-friendly. Q: Do I need to bring towels, a hair dryer, or linens? A: Nope! We provide all these things! However if you would like to iron, please bring your own. Q: What does "Flexible" check-in/-out time mean?  A: I will try to accommodate your check-in or check-out, no matter what time it is. Note that early check ins are not always possible if I have a guest leaving that morning, as I need to allow them to check
properties.transit: There is lots of public transport available. Including buses and the light rail. There is also frequent taxi services nearby and a car would be useful to move around with (there is a car spot available for a hired car). Everyone in the suburb also uses Uber so there's that option too.
properties.access: All spaces in the apartment and communal spaces within the building are accessible by guests. There is also a tennis court. As noted, there is security in the building so both sets of keys will also have a swipe access key to all communal areas and the lifts.  (Loss of keys will be charged to the Guests at our discretion. There will be a replacement minimum cost 200.00. Guests must not break in or attempt to break into premises.)
properties.interaction: During your stay you will be left alone to enjoy your deluxe stay in Pyrmont and Darling Harbour. We are contactable via telephone for any queries you may have.
properties.house_rules: These rules are merely a formality, to protect us and yourself in the wild world of Airbnb. We are very relaxed guests and are not a strict as these rules makes us seem. These rules are simply an assurance and for our insurance. ------------ We have prepared your room to a high standard. We ask in turn that you show consideration by being neat and tidy, placing wrapped garbage in the bins provided. The other communal spaces in the house are available to all of us and we are not strict on this, only the room you hire. Non-Smoking Policy - Guests acknowledge that smoking inside of the property is not permitted and agree to ensure they and/or their Guests smoke outside only. We request that Guests do everything possible to prevent cigarette smoke from drifting inside the premises and to please safely dispose of their cigarette butts in a tidy manner. Animals are not allowed in or about the premises. Any cleaning or pest treatment costs incurred as a result of an animal being brought or ke
properties.host_about:
Hi we are Eden and Whitney and we run this Airbnb together. Eden works at a hospital and Whitney is a marketing coordinator and fashion designer. We are a couple from Sydney who love to relax, enjoy travelling and are always on the go, either for work or holidaying. We are fortunately to live in one of the best and safest suburbs in inner Sydney and love hosting guests as well as have guests host us while we go place to place. Whitney has recently launched her own fashion line and we love meeting new people to learn from.

As hosts, we like to give our guests space and freedom. With our own hectic schedules, we are happy to accommodate guests required times and are happy to have guests around at any time. We are always available to contact and love offering advice and suggestions on nearby places. We are also always keen for a drink or a snack with our guests and love connecting with new people.

When travelling, we are looking for the personal touch and love being immersed in cultures. We are often travelling to avoid the daily grind at home and love trying new things. Having been to 30 countries combined, our whole lives are travelling and we love speaking to people about their homes.

Our Airbnb experience is about giving guests the best and cleanest room, while also relaxing and giving them the space they want. We are not neat freaks and hold parties now and then, which we invite our guests to interact with. We believe that your room must be cleaned to the highest standard and that you must be completely fulfilled while staying with us. But we do hate Airbnbers who think it is like booking a hotel - don't book with is if this is what you're after!

We are late sleepers and are addicted to keeping up with pop culture, with TV watching always high on our list of things to do. We eat dinner late and are always amending to our busy timetables. We love being busy and have many aspirations that we aim to achieve. 

Our favourite travel destinations are: New York City, San Francisco, Paris, London, Indonesia and Melbourne. 

Or favourite books are: Catcher in the Rye, The Bell Jar, Harry Potter, The Great Gatsby and The Girl With The Dragon Tattoo.

Our favourite TV shows: Game of Thrones, Girls, Keeping Up With The Kardashians, House of Cards, Orange Is The New Black, American Horror Story, Sex and the City and Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt.

Our next trip: Russia, Finland, Sweden, Norway, Denmark, The Netherlands and the UK!

properties.neighborhood_overview: Lennox Head is one of the most beautiful small coastal surfing towns on the north coast of NSW. it's 20 minutes by car north to Byron Bay, 20 minutes north west to Bangalow and only 15 minutes to the Ballina Byron airport which has scheduled flights to Sydney and Melbourne with Virgin, Jetstar and Rex. There are numerous beaches within a short drive from Lennox stretching from Byron down through Broken Head, Lennox and south to East Ballina. The apartment is less than a minute's walk from 7 mile beach which at the southern end has one of new south wales most famous surfing breaks, the Point. The surrounding areas of the town along the coast are undeveloped and beautifully landscaped. The walk south on the beach takes you up onto a beautiful grassed headland with incredible views and this stunning walk continues onto two other spectacular beaches, Boulders and Skenners Head. Just 5 minutes walk the other direction from the centre of town is a large tea tree lake which sits only 50 metre
properties.notes: Lennox Head has numerous cafes, restaurants, a bakery, fruit and vegetable store, an IGA supermarket, newsagent, post office and petrol station. Everything you need is a short walking distance away.
properties.transit: Lennox Head is a 15 minute drive from Ballina Byron Airport. The airport has 4 of the major car rental companies. You can also take a taxi from the airport into Lennox. At the apartment, Seven Mile Beach, shops, cafes and restaurants are all right next to you. Public bus routes to Byron Bay, Suffolk Park and Ballina pass by your door. The closest bus stop is a 3 minute walk south along Ballina Street from the apartment.  Most people travel by car in the area but there are taxi companies who will collect and deliver you back to Lennox from Ballina and Byron.

The building has a history dated back to the 1880. Facing a garden, the property does not suffer of any traffic or noise from the street. The art-deco/Edwardian style apartment is complemented with a fresh and functional designed interior. Take a 10 minutes tram ride to the city centre or a 15-20 minutes bus ride to the Australian Open Tennis. We provide the Myki cards for travelling, you just need to top them up Are you driving? You will be provided with a Visitor Parking Permit (this will allow you to park for free in the street with no time limit, that's gold in St.Kilda). Please let me know if you need it at the time of booking. Unusual gigantic size as it used to be in the old days The apartment is about 60 square meter (630 sqft), with a huge majestic bedroom, view to the garden. If you take your own portable cot kids are always for free, does not matter how many days If you need your kid to use the sofa bed, please add him/her as a person. properties.transit: As Real Estates love to say “Location, location, location”. Are you visiting the city or here for business? Will you be attending the F1 or the Australian Tennis Open? properties.name: Light filled Fitzroy studio with leafy vantage
properties.summary: This is a light filled studio apartment located in the heart of Melbourne's creative community, Fitzroy. Opposite the Carlton Gardens, trams stop directly outside and the CBD, Gertrude Street and Collingwood are within walking distance. Fitzroy is a cultural hub, boasting countless restaurants, cafes, bars, street art filled laneways, live music venues and art galleries.  Designed by Best Overend in 1936 in the style of Streamline Moderne, this studio is one of Melbourne's architectural gems.
properties.space: Featuring polished wooden floors and a subdued palette, the apartment has a balcony overlooking a green garden oasis. Cleverly designed spaces enable dual functions from work to play. Whether you’re a creative professional in town working on a project, or here to chill out on holiday, Cairo is perfectly located. Designed by Best Overend in 1936 in the style of Streamline Moderne, the Cairo complex is evocative of a cruise ship with its curvilinear railing and portal window features.  In its original form the rooms were conceived as a series of bachelor pads or ‘minimum flats’. Since then the building’s function has been reimagined and its tenants include makers and thinkers such as students, artists, architects and curators.

properties.transit: Fitzroy and Collingwood are a few minutes walk away.  To travel into the CBD jump on the 96 Tram from outside the building. The nearest train station is Parliament, located on the corner of Bourke and Spring streets. Free 2 hour parking is available on the street; a free Parking Permit (for personal use only) is available on request. The permit is valid for Nicholson street and within two surrounding streets in 1P or greater, or in permit zones. Please ensure the permit is returned after your stay. Myki cards for trains and trams can be purchased and topped up at 7-11 Stores, Myki machines at major tram stops, train stations and a large range of convenience stores and news agents. Cards can't be topped up on trams or trains. The closest Myki recharge location is in Brunswick St: walk down Hanover St, turn left into Brunswick St and walk 75 metres to the Tattslotto on the left. Fines may apply if you travel without topping up your Myki card.
properties.access: Kitchen Cairo includes a fully equipped kitchen with a small bar fridge / ice freezer, gas oven, hotplate, kettle and toaster. Pots, pans, plates and utensils are also available. Gas operated oven turns on at power point on wall. The grill can be activated by pushing button on far left on oven control panel. Ensure to turn off. Bathroom The sizeable Art Deco bathroom includes a bath and shower Supplies Tea, coffee, milk, soy, olive oil, salt and pepper are provided for your convenience. For additional supplies a Foodworks supermarket and alcohol store can be found 5 minutes walk away on Brunswick street almost parallel to Cairo. properties.neighborhood_overview: North Melbourne has lots of bars, pubs, restaurants, cafes and a fantastic cake shop called Beatrix.  It's very close to the city (you could walk or take the tram) but it's quiet enough in this neighbourhood that you won't be kept awake at night.
properties.transit: Fantastic transportation options! Jump on the tram across the road to the city which goes via the Queen Victoria market. Stops along the way at the Emporium shopping centre, Bourke st Mall, Block Arcade for afternoon tea, the Royal arcade and the final stop is Flinders st station. From there it's just a quick walk to ACMI, NGV, Southbank, Royal Botanic Gardens and MIFF events. Or you could take the bus to Carlton for a movie at Cinema Nova (half price on Mondays), an Italian dinner and a stroll down Lygon st with a gelato. The hospitals are all within walking distance.

properties.host_about: A self confessed classical music tragic, I live for music, art and cats! In life, I love the journey rather than the destination. As a musician I have travelled Australia extensively and know the country pretty well. When I travel it's to experience, taste, laugh, listen, live and work rather than look at stuff. As a host, my house is yours and I want to know why you have arrived in this beautiful city to help you make the most of your time here. I am passionate about caring for the environment and have solar panels for energy needs and chooks to minimize any household food wastage. I love food but like to leave the car at home when possible so live near the tram that takes you to the amazing Victoria market.

properties.space: My sweet little house is located in the trendy area of Yarraville, a relaxed inner city suburb with a village-like atmosphere, home to many young professionals and families.  The house itself is a 2 Bedroom Edwardian, with a great kitchen, spacious lounge, front cottage garden and cute back yard with deck, comfy lounge, and an aquaponics style vegie grow bed: you will be able to see the fish and how they help the plants grow even faster! The main living space has a comfy couch, air-conditioning and large TV with Netflix for those nights when you want some down time, but really, you're in Melbourne, so you will likely prefer to be out experiencing our incredible nightlife and arts events. The bedroom is simply furnished with built in robes, queen size bed, small desk, armchair and ceiling fan. You would be sharing the house with me and my older labrador Tyson. A lovely dog which you are welcome to spend time with, though if you are allergic to dogs, perhaps my home may not be the best p
properties.description: Hi! My spare room is up for airbnb grabs. Super close to train, gorgeous Yarraville village, shops - great position. My sweet little house is located in the trendy area of Yarraville, a relaxed inner city suburb with a village-like atmosphere, home to many young professionals and families.  The house itself is a 2 Bedroom Edwardian, with a great kitchen, spacious lounge, front cottage garden and cute back yard with deck, comfy lounge, and an aquaponics style vegie grow bed: you will be able to see the fish and how they help the plants grow even faster! The main living space has a comfy couch, air-conditioning and large TV with Netflix for those nights when you want some down time, but really, you're in Melbourne, so you will likely prefer to be out experiencing our incredible nightlife and arts events. The bedroom is simply furnished with built in robes, queen size bed, small desk, armchair and ceiling fan. You would be sharing the house with me and my older labrador Tyson. A lovely do
properties.notes: I have a self contained bungalow out the back, which does not have any laundry facilities, so the guests in the bungalow may come in the house to use the washing machine occasionally.
properties.access: You will have access to all areas except for the other private bedrooms, the studio out the back and the attic. :)
properties.interaction: As much or as little as you like.
properties.house_rules: Considerate and respectful thanks. You are welcome to borrow books or videos while in the house, but please do not take them out of the house. Broken/destroyed items will need to be compensated for. Please avoid overuse of electricity, water or gas. The price is low based on REASONABLE use of utilities, and bills are currently soaring in Australia, so please be aware of leaving things on overnight, or while you are not in the house. Switching things off at the power point earns you extra points!
properties.host_about:
Hey there!!

I am Lana from Melbourne, Victoria, Australia. I only JUST realised that Airbnb had prefilled this profile for me with the following: I love reading, listening to music and watching my favorite shows on TV. Not necessarily true - I do indeed love reading, but watching TV is very very rare, even though I do have one.

A little about the REAL me: I am a puppeteer and performer, currently working part time at the State Library. I have Auslan and some old French skills I haven't used in a while, so if you are Deaf or French, we could communicate in either English or one of those languages! I am fairly social, but a complete workaholic, so you may find me always working in my studio, writing or other stuff.

I do love meeting new people and travellers, so am excited about meeting you and making you feel welcome - in between the workaholic business that is!

xLana

properties.name: Victorian charm just off Chapel St
properties.summary: Moments from bustling Chapel St, this charming two bedroom Victorian cottage sleeps 4 guests. Ideally located with the Windsor train station a 5 min walk away, being only 4 stops from Melbourne's CBD and 3 from the MCG, AAMI Stadium and tennis centre.
properties.space: We are sure you will love your stay at our home and we have provided some details below for you: The accommodation provides a single level including: - 2 good sized bedrooms, both with queen sized beds and heating  - Separate living and dining area with heater  - Fully equipped kitchen - Rear courtyard with table and chairs, ideal for outdoor dining. - Upon request, a parking permit can be provided for free and unlimited street parking to the front of the property. Amenities include: - Heating - TV - Wireless internet - Washing machine - Fully equipped kitchen - Dishwasher  All towels and linen will be provided for you during your stay.

properties.neighborhood_overview: Windsor is filled with amazing shops and cafes/restaurants and this property is within moments form the heart of it all. The location is the perfect location to explore and experience living in Melbourne!
properties.notes: We request you treat our home as your home, and leave it as you found it.
properties.transit: Located in central Windsor, the property is steps from the bustling Chapel Street filled with cafes, restaurants, bars and shops.  Windsor train station is within a 5 minute walk, with a direct line into the Melbourne CBD  and to Richmond (MCG, Melbourne Park tennis centre, AAMI Stadium) in circa 10 minutes.  A tram service (Route 78) is also provided along Chapel Street travelling to Richmond to north and Balaclava to the south.  There are so many places nearby to explore including iconic Prahran Markets,  Albert Park Lake, the Botanical Gardens and St Kilda. All within walking distance, or via public transport.
properties.access: Guests will enjoy the privacy of the entire property during their stay. Upon confirmation of your reservation details of how to access the property will be provided.
properties.interaction: Guests are welcome to contact me directly before of during their stay with any queries.
properties.house_rules: Strictly no party policy and low noise level. We ask you respect the neighbours surrounding us. No smoking is allowed at the property.
properties.host_about: I love travelling and have spent time living overseas in New York and London and have travelled to many parts of the world and throughout Australia.  I am originally from a country town in NSW however now call Melbourne home, a city I love and I hope you will during your stay here.

properties.name: Kitsch animal lover's home from home
properties.summary: A chilled home open to people of all walks of life - we are a 100% safe space for LGBTQ+ folk, poly people, kinksters, nudists... or even your average Joe. Whoever you are, you're welcome in our home - as long as you love animals! Close to convenient public transport, Preston market and a bunch of cheap tasty food. Good for anyone wanting a relaxed house in the northern suburbs
properties.space: Space on offer is not a fancy set up, more your low-key flatshare situation. We do live here, and prefer to treat our visitors as (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) rather than hotel guests. We foster both cats and dogs, so the house will generally have at least one of each (currently to tally is 5 cats and one dog) as such only animal lovers will probably feel comfortable here. You are welcome to bring your own animal (please let us know). They are welcome in the house if they are dog and cat friendly, otherwise we have outdoor areas they can hang out. We do have the option of a single mattress (sprung, not an airbed) we can put in the room for a third guest if you don't mind being cosy.

properties.neighborhood_overview: Preston is a great suburb just north of the bustling and interesting Westgarth - Northcote - Thornbury trio. Fashionable Melbourne hasn't quite got here yet, but the craft beer and jaffles at Hard Rubbish up the road and the hot meat donuts at Dexter on the corner certainly indicate that it's coming!
properties.notes: We aim to keep the house clean and tidy, but please keep in mind that we will be living here while you do, so things might not be 100% perfect 100% of the time.
properties.transit: We're located a quick two minute walk from the 86 tram line which takes you to the city (via all the interesting and cool places) For a quicker bee-line to the CBD, the Preston train station is about a 10-15 minute walk away (depending on the length of your legs and sense of urgency)
properties.access: Anyone staying with us is more than welcome to treat the house as their own. Kitchen pantry and fridge are yours to augment any meals you might want to cook in the house, and bathroom items are for sharing. So make yourself a cuppa and chill out on the couch with a cat and a book (we've got spares of those too if you need one) Just ask if you're eyeing up the cocktail cabinet ;-)
properties.interaction: My husband and I live in the house and will be home most evenings. I do sometimes work from home, so might be around during the day also. We won't force our company on you, but you're more than welcome to share the space if we're in it.

properties.name: Peaceful Oasis in the heart of Heidelberg
properties.summary: My place is close to restaurants and dining La Trobe University The Austin/Mercy hospitals Easy walk to shopping strip and supermarkets, public transport, restaurants and pubs.. You’ll love my place because of the location, the relaxed and peaceful atmosphere, the spacious kitchen, the cosiness, the gorgeous garden.. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and families (with kids).
properties.space: The space is the rear 'half' of a 5 bedroom house. It comprises 3 bedrooms, Lounge room, kitchen, bathroom, laundry, toilet and opens out onto the garden. There is a fire pit bbq and veggie garden with lettuce and herbs that you can use if desired.

properties.name: Arty Décor Apartment 10mins to CBD
properties.summary: Stylish apartment located in the center of the leafy neighborhood---Kensington. Beautiful arty decoration, homey and comfy. Super easy get accesses to public transports and local shops. You'll find your stay absolutely safe, nice and convenient.
properties.space: Your room is one of the two in my CUTE apartment, which located right in the centre of the leafy suburb of Kensington. The entire apartment is decorated with stylish vintage furnitures that I collected locally from some artists. Every single piece has its own story, some of them even been made decades ago.  Your spacious bedroom has a comfortable double bed, with natural light all day long. Although there are no lockers in the entire apartment, but with respect, I'm sure your belongings are safe at the place.  Therefore, if you're looking for somewhere homey, cozy, also stylish to stay, then this is definitely the place to be!

properties.neighborhood_overview: Having been living in this area for five years, I could proudly say that I love Kensington. It has such peaceful atmosphere, close to the CBD, but away from the crowds.  Whether you have been busy working or travelling, at the end of the day, you can return to Kensington, winding down and enjoying the peace and quiet.  As they say:"Slow down, let the spirit follow"... I must also highlight the safe environment here in Kensington, even when you are out till late, you won't feel nervous when you walk down on the streets. Some other nice things about Kensington: • You will not find it hard to find a parking spot near the apartment. • The neighbourhood is peaceful and quiet at night. • As we are so close to the CBD taking a taxi will not cost the world; a trip to the airport is about 35 to 40. Kensington is a well established inner suburb of Melbourne. Kensington village has some great cafes and the local hotel regularly has bands playing.  Racecourse Road (Flemington) is an easy walk to
properties.notes: Check-in and -out time can be more flexible on days when I am not on duty, so communicate with me of your preference and together we can work things out to make every party happy :) You are more than welcome to use the kitchen to make your own breakfast, but you will need to get your own supplies :) Otherwise, cooking is not recommended in this apartment.
properties.transit: Kensington Train Station: 5 minutes walk, travel time to Melbourne CBD - 10 minutes 402 Bus: 3 minutes walk, travel time to Melbourne University and Carlton - 15 minutes Simply open a "Gogetcar" account and then pick up a car nearby for only 10+ an hour. If only want to go for a quick shopping or look around, then this is the best option ever. For details feel free to communicate with me.  Otherwise, Uber or Taxi, all easy to get access with.
properties.access: 1) Easy public transport: Kensington train and bus station only 5 minutes away---10 minutes travel to Melbourne Central station and Federation Square station by Train, and about 15 minutes travel to Melbourne University buy Bus ; if you don't mind walking for 8 minutes, you would be able to hop on the tram 57, which goes towards Flinders station and will pass Victoria Market.  2) Great restaurants, cafes and pubs (with life music) nearby (either in Kensington or Newmarket); no matter what food you are after, there will be something for you: From Asian to African, or from Vegetarian to fast food...All are very well priced.  3) Woolworth (one of the biggest supermarkets in Australia) is about 10 minutes walking which opens till midnight. The local smaller shop, Foodwork, is only 4 minutes away opens until 9PM.  4) If you want to go for a walk, Womens Peace Garden, a beautiful park with stunning view, is only within a stone's throw away. If you feel like a swim or going to a gym, then all
properties.interaction: You will be sharing my apartment with me, who is a very loving and easy going person, which I believe that I am :)  Therefore, don't hesitate to ask me questions about your stay during your trip. If you like, we would have afternoon tea together and I'd love to hear your travel stories which I enjoy most of doing AirBnb :)
properties.house_rules: Basically just be RESPECTFUL with people and the property.  Then ENJOY and MAKE the most of it!!!
properties.host_about:
Full time International Flight Attendant and part time artist, love painting and hand crafting, love people, love travelling, love all sets of things making life more meaningful. 

Hosting a small hostel is always listed on the top of my MUST DO THINGS. Nursing and caring are my natural, and I enjoy great conversations with people all around the world to exchange ideas and understanding of life.

It's not a party house, I'm sorry, but we have to get up early in the morning and go to work.  The key cost 100 dollars, try not to lose it, or you will have to pay for it.
