properties.neighborhood_overview: ‘FRESHWATER PLACE’ is right in the heart of ‘SOUTHBANK’ at ‘Queensbridge Square’: Southbank's entertainment hub; where buskers and street performers entertain the crowds - Crown Casino to your left, and Southgate / Arts Centre to your right.  Within the Freshwater Place Plaza it has a supermarket plus liquor, chemist, doctor’s clinic, ATM’s, restaurants and fast food cafes A little about…. ‘SOUTHBANK’ stretches along the Yarra River from Princes Bridge/St Kilda Rd to Queensbridge Square [apartment location], continuing on past the Crown Casino through to the Melbourne Exhibition Centre at the other end of the Crown Complex.  Southbank offers an extensive choice of dining and entertaining options for most people’s choices, including the Crown Casino and Arts Centre. The closeness of the CBD just across the footbridge on the opposite of the river bank, Southbank is well deserving of its reputation as Melbourne's premier entertainment district. Southbank is across the river from the city
properties.notes: Bookings made via AirBNB are subject to the standard booking terms and conditions displayed on the Platinum Apartments website.  Payment of your deposit constitutes acceptance of our terms and conditions. Please contact us if you would like a copy of these terms prior to booking.  For security reasons, a copy of your Australian Drivers License or International Passport is required prior to check-in along with confirmed names for all guests staying at the property along with a signed Booking Agreement before access details can be provided.  This is not negotiable!  Please don't book with us if you are not comfortable providing this information.
properties.transit: The apartment centrally located to all of Melbourne's best attractions including the stunning Southbank Promenade, Crown Casino, Arts Centre, Eureka Tower, Melbourne Sea Life Aquarium and all the restaurants, shopping and entertainment that the CBD has to offer. With a location so central most people prefer to explore on foot, and as a bonus trams are now free in the CBD which makes getting around even easier. There is a tram stop outside Freshwater Place about 30-40m about away on Queensbridge Street or catch a train at nearby Flinders St Train Station only 100m over the foot bridge…transport if needed, is so close.  If you are venturing further out, Myki cards can be purchase at the 24 hour convenience store in the Freshwater Place Arcade [6 each]. The apartment is also easily accessible by the Melbourne Airport Skybus shuttle. There are instructions in the apartment about how to arrange a shuttle back to the airport. We do use a preferred chauffeur service - no kickback just good s
properties.access: All Platinum Apartments guests receive a bottle of wine plus a gourmet welcome hamper including tea, coffee, sugar, milk, tasty treats and some basic essentials to get you through the first night or two. We supply luxury toiletries and towels and our beds are made up with top quality linen ensuring a comfortable stay.
properties.interaction: One of Platinum Apartments friendly staff meet you on arrival to give you the security fob, key to the apartment and we will show you how to access the building and all facilities.  We have a home/office within Freshwater Place and are always available to help if and when needed by our guests. FREE APP: Download the Freshwater Place App - it has lots of helpful information about the Building, local area, shopping, transport, facilities, local services, emergency services and procedures...plus lots more
properties.house_rules: Our guests enjoy a truly relaxing and enjoyable stay. In return we ask you display common manners and courtesy for other people.  For us to be able to provide a high standard for our guests, while respecting the rights of the residents who live in the apartment building, we require our guests to comply with certain regulations.  We appreciate that most people do the right thing, however the occasional bad experience has forced us to impose the following conditions.   TERMS & CONDITIONS. A quick explanation – you are renting a self-contained, self-catering short term apartment, you are NOT booking a fully serviced hotel/apartment, so there are requirements that guests/tenants are responsible for that would not apply at a hotel - such as emptying the rubbish bins, and making sure the apartment is left in a tidy manner upon departure. Housekeeping will arrive upon your departure to thoroughly clean and inspect the apartment.  Please treat the property with the same respect as you would yo
properties.host_about:
Hello my name is Helen. Platinum Apartments has been brought to LIFE through the unique collaboration of my husband Heath and I. Our DREAM is to provide apartment style accommodation to the HIGHEST calibre. We have been guided by an uncompromising DESIRE to bring together INTIMATE luxury apartment accommodation that is furnished and serviced to the highest level. 

Beautifully located on the southern BANKS of the YARRA RIVER in Melbourne, PLATINUM APARTMENTS sets the BENCHMARK for LUXURY self-contained apartment accommodation in AUSTRALIA. 

LAVISHLY appointed and offering an IMPECCABLE standard of customer service and attention to detail. Platinum Apartments is a vacation rental that truly UNDERSTANDS the meaning of OPULENCE.

We want our guests to feel WELCOME from the moment they walk through the door.  Our MOTTO is, Enter as strangers, leave as FRIENDS, and for many of our guests, this is exactly what happens. 

Our team strives hard to bring unrivalled PERSONAL touches and QUALITY, ensuring Platinum Apartments is not just an apartment but a HOME AWAY from HOME and an experience you will LOVE. 

All of Platinum Apartments Melbourne luxuriously apartments have SPECTACULAR VIEWS to the city or Port Phillip Bay and feature a TRULY UNIQUE level of comfort and finish. Our inventory also includes PENTHOUSE apartments that overlook the beautiful skyline of Melbourne.

When you are staying in Platinum Apartments you are right in the HEART of Melbourne, close to all the attractions to make your holiday a MEMORABLE one. 

You will find ACTIVITIES and ATTRACTIONS for you and your significant other as well as to suit your entire FAMILY. There will also be many restaurants that will TEMPT your taste buds. So what are YOU waiting for, reserve online today and enjoy a luxurious short stay holiday in beautiful MELBOURNE, Australia.

Our expert STAFF are also HERE to HELP you plan or answer any questions you may have. We are available and on call 24 hours a day for any issues that may arise while you are here. For further information please do not hesitate to CALL us. 

All PHOTOS are TRUE, the apartment booked is the apartment you stay in. The location is the best right in the HEART of the CBD and situated right next door to Melbourne's Crown Casino on SOUTHBANK Promenade.

Why Stay With Us? Our apartments are stylish, sophisticated, exciting, luxur
properties.neighborhood_overview: UNBEATABLE LOCATION "QUEENSBRIDGE SQUARE" is at the heart of Southbank's entertainment hub.; where buskers and street performers entertain the crowds. SOUTHBANK stretches along the Yarra River from Princes Bridge/St Kilda Rd to Queensbridge Square [our apartment location], continuing on past the Crown Casino through to the Melbourne Exhibition Centre at the other end of the Crown Complex. Southbank offers an extensive choice of dining and entertaining options for most peoples choices. The closeness of the CBD just across the footbridge on the opposite of the river bank, Southbank is well deserving of its reputation as Melbourne's premier entertainment district. MELBOURNE's EXHIBITION & CONVENTION CENTRE is just a 2 minute stroll along the Promenade & the City Centre [CBD] is just a walk across the foot bridge; all so close. YOU WANT TO SHOP?  Melbourne is brimming with a myriad of fantastic spots to shop! Take a deep breath and dive into the bustling hive of shops; like the Bourke Stre
properties.notes: Bookings made via AirBNB are subject to the standard booking terms and conditions displayed on the Platinum Apartments website.  Payment of your deposit constitutes acceptance of our terms and conditions. Please contact us if you would like a copy of these terms prior to booking.  For security reasons, a copy of your Australian Driver’s License or International Passport is required prior to check-in along with confirmed names for all guests staying at the property along with a signed Booking Agreement before access details can be provided.  This is not negotiable!  Please don't book with us if you are not comfortable providing this information.
properties.transit: You can WALK everywhere, you're so close. On the GROUND LEVEL of the Apartment Building is a Retail Shopping Area with the convenience of:  * Licensed IGA, well stocked SUPERMARKET  * Freshwater DOCTOR's Clinic  * Freshwater PHARMACY  * BAKERY  * ATM's  * 24 hour 7/11 CONVENIENCE Store  * Food Outlets & McDonalds & Subway  * CAFES  * RESTAURANTS such as the 'Meat & Wine Co' Restaurant & TGI Friday's  * Public Car PARKING - Wilsons Parking [their prices apply]  * PRIVATE Secure Parking - Needs pre-booking and charges apply * TRAM STOP on Queens Bridge Street in front of building * TAXI's on the corner of Freshwater Place or c  * City Centre just 150 metres across foot bridge * CROWN CASINO approximately 50 steps out the front of building.
properties.access: All Platinum Apartments guests receive a bottle of wine plus a gourmet welcome hamper including tea, coffee, sugar, milk, tasty treats and some basic essentials to get you through the first night or two. We supply luxury toiletries and towels and our beds are made up with top quality linen ensuring a comfortable stay.
properties.interaction: One of Platinum Apartments friendly staff meet you on arrival to give you the security fob, key to the apartment and we will show you how to access the building and all facilities.  We have a home/office within Freshwater Place and are always available to help if and when needed by our guests. FREE APP: Download the Freshwater Place App - it has lots of helpful information about the Building, local area, shopping, transport, facilities, local services, emergency services and procedures...plus lots more
properties.house_rules: Our guests enjoy a truly relaxing and enjoyable stay. In return we ask you display common manners and courtesy for other people.  For us to be able to provide a high standard for our guests, while respecting the rights of the residents who live in the apartment building, we require our guests to comply with certain regulations.  We appreciate that most people do the right thing, however the occasional bad experience has forced us to impose the following conditions.   TERMS & CONDITIONS. A quick explanation – you are renting a self-contained, self-catering short term apartment, you are NOT booking a fully serviced hotel/apartment, so there are requirements that guests/tenants are responsible for that would not apply at a hotel - such as emptying the rubbish bins, and making sure the apartment is left in a tidy manner upon departure.Staff will arrive upon your departure to thoroughly clean and inspect the apartment.  Please treat the property with the same respect as you would your own h
properties.host_about:
Hello my name is Helen. Platinum Apartments has been brought to LIFE through the unique collaboration of my husband Heath and I. Our DREAM is to provide apartment style accommodation to the HIGHEST calibre. We have been guided by an uncompromising DESIRE to bring together INTIMATE luxury apartment accommodation that is furnished and serviced to the highest level. 

Beautifully located on the southern BANKS of the YARRA RIVER in Melbourne, PLATINUM APARTMENTS sets the BENCHMARK for LUXURY self-contained apartment accommodation in AUSTRALIA. 

LAVISHLY appointed and offering an IMPECCABLE standard of customer service and attention to detail. Platinum Apartments is a vacation rental that truly UNDERSTANDS the meaning of OPULENCE.

We want our guests to feel WELCOME from the moment they walk through the door.  Our MOTTO is, Enter as strangers, leave as FRIENDS, and for many of our guests, this is exactly what happens. 

Our team strives hard to bring unrivalled PERSONAL touches and QUALITY, ensuring Platinum Apartments is not just an apartment but a HOME AWAY from HOME and an experience you will LOVE. 

All of Platinum Apartments Melbourne luxuriously apartments have SPECTACULAR VIEWS to the city or Port Phillip Bay and feature a TRULY UNIQUE level of comfort and finish. Our inventory also includes PENTHOUSE apartments that overlook the beautiful skyline of Melbourne.

When you are staying in Platinum Apartments you are right in the HEART of Melbourne, close to all the attractions to make your holiday a MEMORABLE one. 

You will find ACTIVITIES and ATTRACTIONS for you and your significant other as well as to suit your entire FAMILY. There will also be many restaurants that will TEMPT your taste buds. So what are YOU waiting for, reserve online today and enjoy a luxurious short stay holiday in beautiful MELBOURNE, Australia.

Our expert STAFF are also HERE to HELP you plan or answer any questions you may have. We are available and on call 24 hours a day for any issues that may arise while you are here. For further information please do not hesitate to CALL us. 

All PHOTOS are TRUE, the apartment booked is the apartment you stay in. The location is the best right in the HEART of the CBD and situated right next door to Melbourne's Crown Casino on SOUTHBANK Promenade.

properties.name: Auto ceiling bed
properties.summary: This is a small room but has a queen size sofa bed, with a lovely ironbark slab desk and an amazing queen sized ceiling bed that lowers at the press of a button.
properties.space: This would be one of the few rooms in Melbourne with a bed that lowers from the ceiling.  We had seen these on youtube videos of apartments in New York and Europe and thought it would work a treat in this small room.  It creates so much space and means we get an office, loungeroom, bedroom, spare bedroom and storage in the one small room._
properties.description: This is a small room but has a queen size sofa bed, with a lovely ironbark slab desk and an amazing queen sized ceiling bed that lowers at the press of a button. It creates so much space and means we get an office, loungeroom, bedroom, spare bedroom and storage in the one small room._ You are welcome to our lounge/dining room, kitchen, bathroom, extensive garden and deck. Well i guess as much or as little as you like.  Some folk are whizzing through with busy schedules and just need somewhere to crash, others want to play in the garden, come on a bike ride or prepare a meal with our uber fresh produce.  We are happy with all. Most of the homes were built after the second world war though many are being demolished and mansions or apartments constructed.  Our neighborhood i
properties.neighborhood_overview: Most of the homes were built after the second world war though many are being demolished and mansions or apartments constructed.  Our neighborhood is transforming around us.  We currently have a lovely mix of people, some older originals, later southern European immigrants and more recent gentry.
properties.notes: There are probably not many more sustainable homes in Melbourne.  We have an extensive water harvesting and recycling system, solar electricity, 6 aquaponic systems, compost toilet, chickens, bees, orchard, vegie patch, straw and earth rendered walls in some rooms, found wood fired heater and lots more.  We are kinda more like an urban farm than a suburban home and it probably  looks and feels like this.  There are usually several projects on the go.
properties.transit: It is actually pretty convenient - 10 mins and no traffic light from the airport, 900m walk to a well serviced zone one railway station, 1100m to the No.55 tram, and couple of hundred metres to Bell St with two bus services.  Best of all we think, there are a host of lovely bikeways including a choice of three to pedal car free into the CBD.
properties.access: You are welcome to our lounge/dining room, kitchen, bathroom, extensive garden and deck.
properties.interaction: Well i guess as much or as little as you like.  Some folk are whizzing through with busy schedules and just need somewhere to crash, others want to play in the garden, come on a bike ride or prepare a meal with our uber fresh produce.  We are happy with all.
properties.house_rules: Our house is alive with all sorts of plants and animals busy growing and working away. The bees furiously making honey, the fish growing and providing nutrient for the plants, the worms processing fish wastes, the plants de-nitrifying the water for the fish, the chickens processing kitchens scraps into eggs, the spiders catching bugs and compost and all sorts of microbes and subsoil biota providing for the plants. We have all sorts of people stay and are pretty flexible. Here are some of the usual practices 1. We take our shoes of at the door. We do this cause if feels nice, reduces the work cleaning floors and means we are not traipsing compost throughout the house. We have several crocs at the doors for us and guests. We usually just have a thickish pair of socks for the house in winter. 2. We don't kill all our household spiders. They do a job keeping the insects down in the house, especially when processing honey and they are fascinating to watch. 3. We turn appliances off at the p
properties.host_about: We are having a ball with Airbnb, meeting lovely people from all over the world and sharing lots of stories of life and adventures.  Our home is a somewhat rambling old austerity era home that we have 'ecofied' with PV panels, water tanks, straw walls, earthern render, water recycling, compost toilet, chooks, aquaponics, extensive food garden with over 100 edibles, combustion heater and more.  The rooms vary, a couple with straw walls with an earthern render, loft queen size bed, desk and a queen size corner sofa bed (that we designed, built and upholstered ourselves).  Oh and its 900m from a zone one train, close to bikeways including one direct from the airport.

properties.name: Convenient Modern Apartment
properties.summary: Comfortable modern apartment in the heart of Brunswick. A modern easy space in a warehouse conversion building close to all the action. Walk out the front door to some of Melbourne's best cafes, restaurants and bars or catch a 12 min train to the CBD.
properties.space: The space is clean, comfortable and user friendly. It has the benefit of a fridge, dishwasher, washing machine, TV with Foxtel, toaster, Nutribullet and Sandwich press all of which are available for guests.
properties.description: Comfortable modern apartment in the heart of Brunswick. A modern easy space in a warehouse conversion building close to all the action. Walk out the front door to some of Melbourne's best cafes, restaurants and bars or catch a 12 min train to the CBD. The space is clean, comfortable and user friendly. It has the benefit of a fridge, dishwasher, washing machine, TV with Foxtel, toaster, Nutribullet and Sandwich press all of which are available for guests. The apartment is only let out while i'm not there so full access is available for guests. Happy to meet on site if possible to introduce guests to the space and outline the key benefits of the area and tips for their stay. If guests have any issues throughout their stay I am contactable on the phone. Brunswick is an awesome place which covers all bases. There are great bars (Howler, The Railway, Brunswick Green), pubs (The Retreat, Cornish Arms), cafes (Carpenters Sun, Tom Phat) and restaurants (Tom Phat, Los Hermanos, Misoya Sake Bar)
properties.neighborhood_overview: Brunswick is an awesome place which covers all bases. There are great bars (Howler, The Railway, Brunswick Green), pubs (The Retreat, Cornish Arms), cafes (Carpenters Sun, Tom Phat) and restaurants (Tom Phat, Los Hermanos, Misoya Sake Bar) all within 100m of the apartment.  Alternatively Princes Park is a 5 minute walk away which is a great place to relax in. It has the best of both worlds.
properties.transit: By train: Jewell Station is 300m from the apartment and is only five stations from Southern Cross (the Melbourne CBD central train station). The journey from the CBD takes 12-18min. Airport: If you are going to or from the Melbourne Airport there is a bus service called the Skybus which goes to and from Southern Cross Station. Alternatively is is usually a 25-35 Uber ride. Tram: The number 19 tram line is 10m from the property and will take you into the Melbourne CBD in around 10-15min. Go Get Carshare: Directly outside the apartment there are to 'Go Get Carshare spaces that are usually available. Extremely convenient for travelers looking to do a small road trip.
properties.access: The apartment is only let out while i'm not there so full access is available for guests.
properties.interaction: Happy to meet on site if possible to introduce guests to the space and outline the key benefits of the area and tips for their stay. If guests have any issues throughout their stay I am contactable on the phone.
properties.house_rules: Happy for guests to have fun and a few drinks in the space so long as they are considerate and respectful of the property and the neighbours throughout their stay.

properties.neighborhood_overview: Love my neighbourhood. St Kilda is world famous, it is an eccelectic mix of travellers and locals. Famous for it's proximity to the city, beautiful parks, pumping nightlife, shopping and world famous beach. I live in a super quiet, safe, pretty leafy street next to botanical gardens and a short walk to pumping Acland/Fitzroy St and the beach. Close enough to the action but far enough you get a good night sleep and stay in a local "village feel" area.
properties.transit: Easy!! Trams are everywhere. I will show you where the closest stops are and provide a timetable. Tram 67 (3 min walk from home) direct into centre of Melbourne (Fed square/Flinders St) in bout 15 mins. Tram 96 (10 min walk from home through beautiful botanical gardens) scenic route past beach and through St KIlda into city centre and then outer suburbs. If you want a train Balaclava is the closest station (10 min walk from home).
properties.access: You can borrow my bike and use anything you like in the house, treat it as your home.
properties.interaction: I've just returned home so I'm doing a bit of work from home so I'm in and out. Happy to give you all info/tips/recommendations for the area and Melbourne. Can show you around so you can get your bearings, you can walk to everything from here. You will have your own key so can come and go as you please. Can pick you up from closest tram or train station. I love to share a glass of wine, a meal and exchange travel stories or if you want to do your own thing all good, I'm super easy going.
properties.house_rules: No drugs in home Smoking outside Dinners/socialising cool but no wild parties please Please be quiet after 10pm as this is a residential area (you can keep partying on nearby Acland Street) Please clean up after yourself
properties.host_about: I'm from Melbourne, I'm 34 and am studying my masters. I also work as a counsellor and arts therapist. I love travel, meeting new people, nature, food and wine. I'm very easy going and enjoy a laugh.

properties.name: Carlton apartment easy living
properties.summary: Our place is in the perfect location to explore Melbourne hassle free. We're right on the edge of the city with a big beautiful park to walk through on your way! Or just jump on the tram (at our door). Located between Brunswick street (shopping, bars, live music, cafes, restaurants) and Lygon street (Italian food Mecca, the Nova cinema, Readings bookstore, Brunetti's desert) Or walk to the Carlton Gardens which house the museum, IMAX Theatre and exhibition building. So much to explore on foot!
properties.space: Our space is great for city trips with public transportation at our doorstep, we love its city feel and the action all around us but if you're not used to city sounds - trams and traffic at peak hour (we're just off an intersection) It could be a bit loud for you.  It's not to loud for us and hasn't been for others who have stayed but if you need total silence to sleep this is just a heads up. Newly renovated kitchen with dishwasher as well as Aircon/heating, Wifi, Netflix, Applemusic, record player and a unique collection of books to browse.

properties.host_about:
37 year old female from Melbourne Australia. I travel often and have lived abroad for many years. I am currently back 'home' and renting out my spare room so that I can stay connected to fellow travellers.

I love the outdoors and will happily take guests out on road trips to see some of the local areas and maybe even go for a hike. I can also show you around Melbourne - if you have access to a bike it's a great way to get around and see what this amazing city has to offer (all time permitting, of course).

When I travel I often use air bnb or couchsurfing - I love it - it's such a great way to meet the locals and see a city from their perspective. I don't tend to visit touristy locations, I prefer to see the true essence of a city/ country. Hopefully I can help you do the same when you are here in Melbourne.

I like to keep my home tidy and clean and expect my guests to treat my home and my furniture with respect, as if it were their own. I am considerate of guests sleeping patterns and am always careful not to make too much noise if they are home, I hope my guests will be also respect this.

Try the Moroccan Quinoa Salad or the Best Ever BLT. (It's actually named that). Fran, the owner is normally on site and super welcoming. The smell of Azzuro Pizza hits you like a freight train when you walk in. You know it's good when the locals pack it out every night. Try the lemon grass beef with coconut rice at Ta We Wan or red curry at 2B Jimmys. The Prim Rose Deli makes a yum pastrami sandwich. The Hustle has the best coffee on the strip and delicious cheap sandwiches.  A short 3k to Brighton Beach. The local cinema and a whole heap of shops on Bay St about 1k away.

properties.host_about: My husband,Tony and I have 4 grown children, all of whom currently live overseas with their partners, which ensures we are avid and frequent travellers. We have stayed in some of the best and some of the 'not so great' accommodation around the world, so we understand the importance of the quality expected when travelling. Although I was born in New Zealand and have made Melbourne my home for the last 34 years, I consider myself a global citizen travelling constantly to the UK, Europe and USA to visit family.  Tony and I are easy-going, well-travelled, passionate about our home and garden, enjoy a glass of wine or two and love to cook! And we love living in Melbourne.Melbourne is one of those rare cities that combines true charm with big city cultural attractions. It is a magnificent city and as one of the most liveable cities in the world you will be hard pressed to find a more exciting, well thought out place to visit.

properties.neighborhood_overview: Narre Warren is strategically situated in between the Melbourne City and the tourist attractions in the southeast such as Mornington Peninsula, Philip Island, Yarra Valley, and lots more. Many of our guests make our home their short stay while traveling to the southeast, or their base while visiting Melbourne. The neighbourhood is quiet and peaceful with joggers and families walking their dogs almost every evening. There is a park just opposite the house, so you can relax and take a walk whenever you like around the neighbourhood.
properties.notes: The popular Mornington Peninsula is only 40 minutes drive away, and has a long history of being a favourite holiday destination in Melbourne. The Dandenong Ranges and Belgrave (Puffing Billy steam engine) are 30 minutes to the north and there are several beautiful beaches within 30 minutes drive to the south. The famous Phillip Island is just an hour away, where there are fantastic tourist attractions - the little penguins, the koala conservation park, the seals at the Nobbies and other attractions.
properties.transit: There is a bus stop 5 minutes walk away and also the Narre Warren Train Station less than 10 minutes drive away. Nearby is the Fountain Gate Shopping Centre, one of the largest shopping centre in Australia which is less than 10 minutes drive away. For emergency supplies, there is a milk bar just around the neighbourhood.

My wife and I are from Malaysia. 

Back in 2013, we went for a backpacking trip to the Middle East and Europe for three months. We visited 17 countries and 27 cities throughout that period, and that was when we learnt about Airbnb. Our hosts were great to us, and now, we want to return the favour to welcome guests from all around the world at our home.

properties.neighborhood_overview: Clarendon Street is a 5 minute walk and has something for everyone - beautiful wide streets and footpaths, cobblestone lanes, restaurants, cafes and bars, eclectic shopping, a great market.  It's much more local and friendly, and still within walking or tram distance of the city.
properties.notes: There are NO cleaning fees. I will email directions for arrival following booking confirmation.  More detailed information is available on arrival, along with Myki PT cards and WIFI password.
properties.transit: Catch a #55 tram at my door step to take you straight to Melbourne Convention Centre,  Southbank and Crown Casino, the Aquarium, the city centre, then on to Queen Victoria Market and even Melbourne Zoo. Hop off at the river for a waterside walk to Exhibition Centre, South Wharf.  The domain interchange tram stop is just two minutes away, where you can catch trams to almost anywhere in inner Melbourne.  It takes just ten minutes to almost everything - for the city, Federation Square, Southbank and major sporting venues, take any tram northbound.  For St Kilda it's #16, Chapel Street #6, Toorak Road #8 south bound. For drivers, it's two minutes to Citylink, twenty to the airport.   Street parking is free overnight and on weekends.
properties.access: Amenities  For breakfast, you're welcome to help yourself to tea/coffee, cereal and home made bread for toast. For those who like to cook, you have full use of the kitchen, or there are plenty of restaurants, cafes and pubs close by for those who don't!    A supermarket and bottle shop is a handy 50 metres away.  There's a barbecue on the balcony too. Full laundry with large washer, dryer and laundry products is available to freshen up those travel clothes. Fast wireless internet is included and available through the whole apartment.  A 40" flatscreen TV is in your room, plug in your laptop for big screen access or Netflix. Other bonuses are a heated pool, tennis court (two racquets available) and a gym. And just in case it rains (in Melbourne??) there are plenty of new and old movies, books, Kindle and audio books for your phone/ipad and board games to keep you entertained.
properties.interaction: The whole apartment is available for guests to utilise, except of course my bedroom and ensuite.  I am home most nights, watching my new favourite TV series or a movie. You're welcome to join me with a glass of wine or a cuppa.
properties.house_rules: Please respect my home by keeping it clean and using the amenities sensibly.  Turn off lights and fans when not in use. Shoes off inside please. Please eat at the dining room table, not in the bedroom. Please be careful not to let suitcases scratch the walls. I do have to work during the week, so quiet homecomings if you are late on week nights. Please note this is a pet and child free zone. Smokers are welcome to use the balcony.  If it's really cold out there, we have blankets.
properties.host_about:
Hello!
I love living in marvellous Melbourne, and you will love it too!  There is always a festival on somewhere, whether it's food, cultural or music, so there is somewhere interesting to go in between all the other things you'll be doing!

I've been hosting and guesting with Airbnb since 2011, and it's been a life changing experience on both sides, with new friends made and new places experienced.
  
Airbnb has enabled me to achieve some of my dreams too -  criss-crossing USA by train, plane, car and bus, staying in a heritage listed 16th century attic flat in Paris ooh la la, walking inside Stonehenge, standing on that palace roof in Ho Chi Min city, and staying Airbnb in all these places. 
I started my travels later than most, but I'm making up for it now......

Places I've been so far are New Zealand, Bali, USA, Vietnam, France, Wales,  England and Spain (with a quick wiz around the Mediterranean on an all  Spanish cruise ship). Back to France this year, and south East USA in 2017.
I have an enquiring mind, enjoy the company of interesting people, love music, movies and history. 
I'm never without my Kindle or a GPS either.
I can also speak terrible Spanglish and Franglish after a couple of glasses of wine.

Just two trams from everything, while still hidden enough to allow for days when you want nothing more than creature comforts and quiet, let us give you a home you love coming back to as you explore the world's most liveable and loveable city.

Yep. A fireplace. Venture out into the rest of the house when you feel like fresh roasted coffee, tea or a friendly chat with one of your hosts. Soak up the sun in the comfort of our lounge room as floor-to-ceiling glass panels fill the lounge room with natural light.

Soak up the sun in the comfort of our lounge room as floor-to-ceiling glass panels fill the lounge room with natural light. Access into our h
properties.neighborhood_overview: North Fitzroy is the perfect balance between convenient location and quiet tranquility. Easy access into Melbourne's CBD means that regardless of traffic, on any given day you're only 10 minutes from town. The 96 tram sits right on your doorstop with trams scheduled to arrive every 10 minutes.  Away from the hustle and bustle of Brunswick Street, North Fitzroy hugs the Merri Creek and our house isn't too far of a walk from Dights Falls along the Yarra Trail. The falls mark the point where salt water from the sea meets the fresh water of the Yarra River and it's a stunning little spot for a picnic on a sunny, summer afternoon. Locally here in North Fitzroy we have some of the best bars, food and live entertainment that Melbourne has on offer. We love food and we also Melbourne so hit us up for any recommendations that we may have for that place to grab a quick bite or our top picks on local beer gardens. We're more than happy to steer you in the right direction when it comes to the Melb
properties.notes: Make use of our kitchen, chuck on a load of washing or use the clothes dryer. Make use of the house and it's communal spaces because we would like for it to feel like your home (away from home) too. We provide all guests with coffee, tea and things to prepare a light breakfast with in the mornings.  Scout Niblett lives here too. She's an adorable 8 year old english staffordshire terrier. She's internet famous and friendly to a fault. Scout's great with tiny humans and all other animals so we've listed this property as pet-friendly. And it is, to a point. Please message us prior to booking if you're travelling with your canine companion so we can work out the rest from there. Sometimes we do airport transfers also. If you're flying into Melbourne and you want to see if your luck will get you a lift to or from the Airport please contact us with your flight details and we can compare diaries/logistics.
properties.transit: Public transport: Trams are iconically Melbourne and they don't just look cute, they're actually great for getting around. The 96 is right on our doorstep and takes you from North Fitzroy through the city and all the way down into St Kilda (and the beach) in just under an hour! Trams are safe, affordable and run like clockwork (approximately every 12 minutes). They also link in with the Melbourne Metro network (rail lines) which are an affordable and convenient way to get further afield with relative ease. Ask us when you arrive if you're planning on using PT to get around and we'll help you get your bearings and plan some of your journeys should you need. Bicycle:  We've got a bicycle for guests if that's something you're into. A security deposit is required but it's a quick and invigorating way to get around the local area with ample bike paths making getting anywhere a breeze.  Driving: On street parking is available. And free!
properties.access: Access into our home is via the front door. The property is wheelchair accessible and any guest requiring additional support with getting around is encouraged to get in contact with us at the time of your booking. We want to provide you with the best support we can snd leaving you the time to enjoy what the space has to offer.
properties.interaction: We keep ourselves pretty busy day to day so generally the house is pretty quiet and throughout the day is mostly yours to enjoy. That said, we are always available should guests need further assistance and you'll have contact details for Rory and myself should the matter be urgent. Otherwise, we subscribe to the saying "mi casa es su casa".
properties.host_about:
I am an Education Specialist and Social Researcher who spends the bulk of my time either working with marginalised young people in Melbourne's outer west or moonlighting as a public health worker in the world of HIV treatment and prevention. What little time I have left over gets poured straight into a little NGO social enterprise start-up called EEVA. I am the Founder and Director of Engaged Education Via Advocacy Inc an organisation dedicated to uncovering the links between socio-economic status and educational attainment in Australia. 

We love our piece of paradise in North Fitzroy and have endeavoured to create a space where guests can feel at home. More than just a place to stay, we want your time in Melbourne to be memorable, stress free and relaxed.

properties.name: Sunny room with garden view

properties.space: The room has a double bed, clothes wardrobe, shelves, fresh linen and towels.  It is light and airy and looks onto the back garden. There's also an open living and dining area and fully equipped kitchen. The bathroom is shared with one other person (me). It has a shower and separate bath. There's a separate laundry with clothes washing machine and  heating and cooling. Self-serve breakfast of tea, cereal, yoghurt and fruit is included. You're welcome to use the kitchen to cook and help yourself to the fresh produce out the back!  Having lived in Melbourne for a long time, I can give you some tips on what to see and do. I'm easy going and am happy to have a chat in the evenings and perhaps share a home cooked meal. I'm equally happy for guests to do their own thing. Our block of units is surrounded by gardens with friendly and quiet neighbours. It's easy to get to most things - great cafes and a supermarket, yoga studio and more on Miller St. Bars, live music venues, clothes stores, res

properties.neighborhood_overview: Our block of units is surrounded by gardens with friendly and quiet neighbours. It's easy to get to most things - great cafes and a supermarket, yoga studio and more on Miller St, Thornbury. Bars, live music venues, clothes stores, restaurants and general coolness on High St Northcote and Thornbury. Cycling distance to the lovely Northcote outdoor pool. Both Latrobe Uni and the Austin hospital are around 15 mins drive away. NMIT Preston campus is 5 mins drive.
properties.notes: My home is a  villa unit, essentially a small house.
properties.transit: Tram: An easy ten minute walk to the West Preston tram (no. 11) on St Georges Rd. The tram journey to the city takes around 25 mins. Train:  15 minutes walk to Thornbury station on the South Morang line. The train journey takes 20 mins to Melbourne city. The East Coburg tram (no. 1) and Moreland tram (no. 8) on Nicholson St are also within walking  distance to take you on a night out in Brunswick! An easy cycle into the city (around 8 kms). there's a bike path that is out of the traffic pretty much all the way to the city. To/from the airport: it's also a 20-30 minute car trip to the airport, depending on traffic.  There are a couple of ways you can get to my house form the airport without taking a taxi. My apologies for the long instructions! Option 1: You can catch the Skybus (19 one way, 38 return) from the airport Southern Cross station, depending on traffic, it takes about 25-30 mins from. You can then by a myki card at the station and take a tram or train from Southern Cross st
properties.access: The bathroom is shared with one other person (me). It has a shower and separate bath. There's also a clothes washing machine that you're welcome to use.  Also free wi-fi and heating and cooling. Self-serve breakfast of tea, cereal and fruit is included. You're welcome to use the kitchen to cook and help yourself to the fresh produce out the back.
properties.interaction: I'm fairly flexible about the level of interaction. I've found most guests are happy to do their own thing, but I'm happy to have a chat in the evenings if we're both free.
properties.house_rules: The usual courtesies around keeping the noise down late at night and washing up after cooking.
properties.host_about: I enjoy good food, like to grow some of my own and get out in nature too. I love to check out interesting places and wander in a new city. My past housemates always said I was easy-going and clean and tidy! Prefer independent films than those at the multiplex and have always got some half finished books on the go.

properties.neighborhood_overview: Richmond is urban city suburb (but not manic!) filled with hidden gems of cafes, eateries, galleries and breweries! It's vibrant, it's multi-cultural and easy to get to! Trams and trains are right at your door step or at close proximity. Bridge Road, is known for its boutique bars and food, as well as Swan Street, with its Greek streak, and Victoria Street, known as Little Saigon for its Vietnamese restaurants. It’s also just a punt kick from some of the city’s best sporting venues, including the MCG for AFL, Melbourne Park for tennis and AAMI Park for soccer and rugby league, and gardens. Get exploring!
properties.notes: I'm more than happy to accommodate and work with your check in/ check out times as I've travelled and understand how important timing can be, so please message me in advance so we can work something out. ***Lost of house keys and toggle is 125***
properties.transit: The main public transport in Melbourne are trams (and trains)! But before you hop on/off one, you'd need to get a pass (daily, weekly, monthly) at the local newsagent (in the shopping centre) which is conveniently located just across the street. The 109 tram on Victoria Street (just on the corner, 2 min walk) takes you straight into the city in 15 minutes. Or just grab your first FREE ride with Uber (download the app) and using this code: jesslynm24ue There is free parking on Burnley Street. Please read parking signs for time restrictions. There is also 5 overnight parking at the shopping centre across the street when you enter after 6PM and leave before 7AM the next day.

properties.neighborhood_overview: What's South Yarra like? Who wouldn't love staying in the center of Melbourne's best shopping, best restaurants, best night life and entertainment. From here you can walk to some of Melbourne's finest spots, the Yarra River, the Botanical Gardens, Fed Square,the city, Southbank and more. Dine on street, people watch, enjoy fashion, glamour and style all day, every day, all year round. Shopping’s the name of the game in South Yarra, where Chapel Street reigns supreme. The fashion strip contains all manner of high-end designer boutiques, chain-stores, hipster hang-outs, cinemas and gift shops. There’s also a seemingly unlimited array of cafes and restaurants to help revive weary shoppers by day, and bars and clubs to keep the buzz going at night. Naturally then, South Yarra attracts the young, hip and fashion conscious, at least on its main strip and the streets immediately surrounding. The residents are a mix of young professionals, families and empty nesters – all attracted to this sal
properties.transit: Super central location.  - Trams almost at front door. short ride to CBD and surrounds  - South Yarra railway station is around corner / next door (6mins to CBD)  - Yarra walking/riding trails close by, walk to CBD or AAMI Park/Melbourne Park/MCG/Hi Sense Area.

properties.host_about:
Hi, I work in the travel industry so I know a lot about traveling. good and bad. I love it all, from the beaches in Bali (a regular for me) to sights of Italy and shopping in Hong Kong Or London. I prefer to stay in 5 stars rather than under the stars camping. I like to keep fit  so know all the top running tracks near here and  I visit the fabulous Pilates or Yoga studio which are really close to me often. I love champagne and travelled to Reims for 3 months learning all about the art of champagne making. Visiting my local cafes or wine bar with friends on the weekend is what I love most. 
 I have children, so I know what I want when traveling on my own: great restaurants, bars and a bit of glamorous shopping compared to when kids are with me and we want playgrounds, fun activities, family friendly restaurants or meals at home after an exhausting day out sightseeing. So when staying in my home I want to go that extra mile and give you tips to make your trip great.
I have been staying in 5 star hotels for last 20 years so know a thing or 2 about what makes a good stay, a Great Stay. 
I want guests in my home to feel like it is their home. I can help with organising tickets to sporting events, meals at home waiting for you when you get in late, or organising a haircut or doctors appointment. The list is endless. Bit like a private assistant or concierge for a small fee. Let's make your trip, great fun.

properties.name: Straw and Earth room in Eco home
properties.summary: We took of the plaster, squashed in some straw we found on the bikeway, rendered with sand and clay, built a queen size loft bed and put a red ironbark slab desk and corner queen size sofa bed underneath,
properties.space: We have a gorgeous straw/earth rendered room in an rambling old austerity era home that we have 'ecofied' with PV panels, water tanks, water recycling, compost toilet, chooks, aquaponics, extensive food garden with over 100 edibles, combustion heater and more.  You can check us out on Vasili's Garden here - (URL HIDDEN) We are 900m from a zone one train, close to bikeways including one direct from the airport.  The taxi fare from the airport is usually less than 30.  There are shops close by and we can arrange some lovely bikes to explore Melbourne. The room has a loft queen size bed, redgum/ironbark slab desk and a corner queen size sofa bed on the floor.  The room/s are smallish but the design kinda creates space.  Julia and I were not sure how it would feel sleeping up so we tried it and loved it.  its a little like a cubby house or a nest.  Julia can be upstairs reading whilst I am banging away on the computer.  It means that instead of just having a room with a bed in it we have
properties.description: We took of the plaster, squashed in some straw we found on the bikeway, rendered with sand and clay, built a queen size loft bed and put a red ironbark slab desk and corner queen size sofa bed underneath, We have a gorgeous straw/earth rendered room in an rambling old austerity era home that we have 'ecofied' with PV panels, water tanks, water recycling, compost toilet, chooks, aquaponics, extensive food garden with over 100 edibles, combustion heater and more.  You can check us out on Vasili's Garden here - (URL HIDDEN) We are 900m from a zone one train, close to bikeways including one direct from the airport.  The taxi fare from the airport is usually less than 30.  There are shops close by and we can arrange some lovely bikes to explore Melbourne. properties.neighborhood_overview: Heres some things we enjoy about pascoevale - its close enough to the city with great transport.  easy biking distance with great bikeways, a choice of a train or tram and good cross town bus services and for driving the freeway is soooo close - the cafes and eateries.  We might not be as quiche as brunswick (which is a short pedal anyways) but we have lots of super delicious and cheap food from all over the world - our favourites are the Sri Lankan place in Glenroy, Chinese in Preston, Japanese at the end of the street, Jack and Daisies, Andrew's, Lebanese in Coburg and the 2.20 coffee joint in the Vic mall - the people of Pascoevale - varied, real, ungentrified
properties.notes: Children are welcome and we ask that any that walk are included in the number of people for the booking.
properties.transit: heaps and heaps and zone 1 or two at your choice.
properties.access: You will have access to the bathroom, loungeroom, garden (if you help garden you can eat from it), BBQ, kitchen (we ask that when the stove flames are on, you remain in the kitchen), laundry (we ask for a contribution of 2 per wash).... hmmm pretty much everything except other folks bedrooms I guess.
properties.interaction: We are happy to interact (strange word that eh) with folk as much or as little as you like.  Some folk keep to themselves and most bedrooms have a couch and desk and other folk like to hang out and do stuff.  Some like to share cooking and meals and others are whizzing through with busy lives and little time.  We have even caught up with guests and completed overseas adventures in their countries.
properties.house_rules: Our house is alive with all sorts of plants and animals busy growing and working away. The bees furiously making honey, the fish growing and providing nutrient for the plants, the worms processing fish wastes, the plants de-nitrifying the water for the fish, the chickens processing kitchens scraps into eggs, the spiders catching bugs and compost and all sorts of microbes and subsoil biota providing for the plants. We have all sorts of people stay and are pretty flexible. Here are some of the usual practices 1. We take our shoes of at the door. We do this cause if feels nice, reduces the work cleaning floors and means we are not traipsing compost throughout the house. We have several crocs at the doors for us and guests. We usually just have a thickish pair of socks for the house in winter. 2. We don't kill all our household spiders. They do a job keeping the insects down in the house, especially when processing honey and they are fascinating to watch. 3. We turn appliances off at the p
properties.host_about: We are having a ball with Airbnb, meeting lovely people from all over the world and sharing lots of stories of life and adventures.  Our home is a somewhat rambling old austerity era home that we have 'ecofied' with PV panels, water tanks, straw walls, earthern render, water recycling, compost toilet, chooks, aquaponics, extensive food garden with over 100 edibles, combustion heater and more.  The rooms vary, a couple with straw walls with an earthern render, loft queen size bed, desk and a queen size corner sofa bed (that we designed, built and upholstered ourselves).  Oh and its 900m from a zone one train, close to bikeways including one direct from the airport.

COURTYARD We have a large courtyard, it's a great space and is perfect for BBQ's or relaxing in the fresh air. We do have a BBQ that you are welcome to use. BATHROOM There is only 1 bathroom in our house although there are 2 separate toilets, 1 upstairs and 1 downstairs. LAUNDRY Having travelled myself I understand the need for washing facilities.
properties.neighborhood_overview: I live in Hawthorn which is a beautiful riverside suburb with lovely parks, restaurants, cafes, pubs and generally a nice friendly vibe. Hawthorn is a very safe area with a lot to offer for visitors and brilliant access to the CBD via public transport options. 250m down the road is a little shopping strip of a variety of shops including: Supermarket, pharmacy, organic butcher, bakery, fish & chips, chicken shop, nail bar, gift shop, beauty treatments, several cafes, pub, wine bar, hairdressers, dry cleaners and a couple of restaurants.  1km away is the Glenferrie Road shopping precinct which is larger and has more to offer including more clothing and specialty shops a larger supermarket and cinema.
properties.notes: Our house is set back a decent distance from the road. It is quite and mostly peaceful, it can be a nice escape from the busy CBD although very easily accessible.
properties.transit: Train: Hawthorn Train Station is a 4min walk from our house which gets you to the city in 9min. Tram: The tram no.75 goes right past our doorstep and the tram no.70 is a 3 minute walk down the road. Bike: We are located close to the Yarra River and a bike path that follows the river to the CBD.  Parking: Parking may be available by request on the property. Parking is also available on the street. From the airport: You can Skybus (30 return trip) to Southern Cross Station and train to our nearest station. Taxi from the airport depending on traffic is approx 70-80. Great Access to the MCG, Rod Lava Arena and Melbourne Park via train and trams or walk.
properties.access: KITCHEN Access to all kitchen equipment, space in the fridge will be allocated for guests. Tea, coffee and DIY breakfast provided (muesli, cereal, toast, eggs, fruit & yoghurt). COURTYARD We have a large courtyard, it's a great space and is perfect for BBQ's or relaxing in the fresh air. We do have a BBQ that you are welcome to use. BATHROOM There is only 1 bathroom in our house. It has a shower over bath set up. There are 2 separate toilets, 1 upstairs and 1 downstairs. LAUNDRY Having travelled myself I understand the need for washing facilities. You are welcome to use our washing machine and dryer.
properties.interaction: I will always try to be there greet guests for arrival and ensure a smooth settling in. I work and travel a bit so I might be in and out of the house but would always welcome a chat and catch up when we cross paths. I would like to help as much with your stay and will give advice on getting around, activities to do and offer our recommendations. Occasionally I do travel on weekends visiting family and friends, so arrangements will be made for your welcome in this case. I will let you know at the time of enquiry if I am planning to be away for a night or two.
properties.house_rules: Please be respectful. Smoking is allowed outside in the courtyard, not inside. Kitchen must be cleaned after use.
properties.host_about:
I am also a passionate traveller, exploring Australia and other parts of the world. My travel experiences are ones I treasure. To describe myself as a traveller I tend to plan things at the last minute and hope for the best, this has generally worked out for me perhaps with a few extra stories involved. 

My character is very easy going, I am a relaxed person who likes to make the most out of all situations.

Some of my favourite things to do are play tennis, cooking, have drinks with friends at bars and explore all that Melbourne has to offer.

Experience the very best of World Cuisine, Fashion, Retail, Art and Live Music. Brunswick is a really funky neighbourhood with plenty going on and all within close proximity to the city and major sights.  It is a great base for exploring by tram, train, bike or foot!
properties.notes: Prefer single travellers but if you are a couple please message and we can see what we can do.  Please note breakfast is not included. We have a small cat 'Bubbles' who lives with us. She is super friendly and mainly just wants to cuddle up and sit on your lap.
properties.transit: We have great transport links - Trams run regularly to the city from Sydney Road (1 min from the flat) and takes about 20 mins to the CBD. Brunswick train station is a 5 minute walk and gets you into the city in 15 mins. We also have a bike you are welcome to borrow, this is a great way to get around the local area with plenty of bike paths nearby.

properties.interaction: Interaction is entirely up to you - We are both working full time but different hours so sometimes we may be home during weekdays and most evenings. Would love to share tips on Melbourne with you and help enhance your visit in any way we can. We will otherwise leave you to your own privacy.
properties.house_rules: Gay friendly apartment.  We would prefer if no extra guests were bought back to the apartment.  Outdoor smoking only.
properties.host_about:
Myself and my wife Elsa have been living and working in Melbourne, Australia for the last 8 years. 
We enjoy food, music and sunshine!
Our apartment in Brunswick is a great place to enjoy all that this great city has to offer, we hope we can share it with you. 
We love to travel to every corner of the globe at every opportunity and meet like minded easy going people. Really enjoy the Airbnb community.

properties.host_about:
Art and Dance Therapist, self entrepreneur, residing in  Australia. I love new cultures, nature, creativity and adventures. I enjoy socialising and meeting new people and sharing some stories and laughs. I love creating a beautiful and nurturing home atmosphere, and doing things such as cooking delicious meals, pottering about in the garden, going on beach walks, catching up with friends, having quiet time at home and making and creating art. I also love cats!  
My favourite holiday destination so far is Byron Bay and Bali. I love the hot weather, and all things tropical. And the people in both places are very friendly and open minded and fun. 
I like British comedy, Australian drama series on abc, and documentaries by people such as Louis Theroux. 

5 things I can't live without are: a cat, my friends, my expressive dance classes, music, nature and colour!

My style of hosting is to be friendly and warm, yet respect the space and people and allow ease and comfort to prevail. 

The beauty of Airbnb, is that it seems to bend the truth on the line 'there's no place like home'. It is wonderful that there is this system set up, whereby we can travel anywhere and experience other places, like home, but different, and be warmly welcomed, and do the things we do at home. I like that we can belong anywhere we go, with like-minded people, it opens doors which before never would have been explored.

properties.name: Best of Both-City & Beach Apartment
properties.summary: A perfect place to base and explore Melbourne. Easy access to the city and attractions. Located in lively Port Melbourne, this self-contained apartment is bright and spacious. A short block from the beach with bay/city views. Metres from cafes, shops.
properties.space: This is our city home. Feel like a local in one of the best locations close to Melbourne. While in a side street, our apartment is in the heart of Port Melbourne, a popular beach resort and only a short block from famous Bay Street. There are two seperate balconies, one has views to the city and both have a view to the beach, with plenty of room to relax. There is a fully equiped large modern kitchen, with oven, stove, microwave, dishwasher and two door fridge/freezer. The apartment has a dining and lounge area with a large TV. This room opens onto the larger balcony, with table, chairs and bbq. The bedroom has a small TV. which opens onto the second balcony, which has a smaller table and chairs. It has direct access into the bathroom. The bathroom has a vanity unit, toilet, shower/ bath and washing machine. It has direct access into the bathroom. Th
properties.neighborhood_overview: Port Melbourne is a beautiful bay side beach suburb with something for everyone.  It is a delight to meander along the our beautiful close beach promenade, sampling the fantastic cafe food and admire the stunning sunsets.  If you are into exercise, there are miles of beach and river paths for walking and bike riding. The paths head in both directions. One way via Station Pier to Sandridge Beach, Westgate bridge and to the river.  The other direction, Albert Park, Middle Park, famous St Kilda beach and marina, or continue kilometres past Brighton Beach. There are numerous local parks. For energetic people there is also bike hire, kite-surfing on the bay, rollerblading, a new skate park, Albert Park Lake and Melbourne Sports and Aquatic Centre all close-by. If you prefer to relax, the area has an expanse of beautifully manicured beaches to laze or swim at, clothes and homeware shops or a vast variety and cuisine of cafes/restaurants and convenience shops. All these are within a short wal
properties.notes: The shops, are all within a short walking distance of our apartment and can cater for your needs-  3 large supermarkets, cafes, restaurants, large gourmet health food store, specialist ice cream shops, beauty salons, skin and beauty therapy, bottle shops, chemists, Doctors, Dentist, gyms and more.
properties.transit: The public transport is excellent. We are located just 3.8 kms from Melbourne's CBD. The light-rail tram 109 is a regular service, only a short walk, and approximately a 12 minute trip to the city.  It runs all through the night both Saturday and Sunday. There is also, bus route 606 in Bay St and route 236 in Bridge St. They travel in all directions, including Albert Park and the popular St Kilda precinct. Melbourne’s red 'Hop on Hop Off' City sightseeing tourist bus, is located near Station Pier, only a few minutes walk from our apartment.  One of Melbourne's bike share stations is approximately 100 metres from the apartment, adjacent to the end of the street.  No necessity for a car, however, there is plenty of street ample parking.
properties.access: Our apartment is located in a secure building. It has swipe-key, key and video security. There is a full intercom system and the building is under 24 hour video surveillance for your securiy. We have lift access to level 5.
properties.interaction: We will be available via email and phone should you have any queries or need any advice or suggestions prior or during your stay.  Having stayed with Airbnb over many years, we endeavour to provide our guests with a memorable and relaxing stay as we have experienced.
properties.house_rules: This is a non smoking space.   No additional unspecified guests. Refer to conditions prior to using BBQ. Airconditioner and fan to be turned off when leaving the apartment. Please care for this home as you would your own and leave it as you find it. Thank you.
properties.host_about: I am an Artist and Art teacher and live in Melbourne with my husband Leigh. Travel is my passion. Airbnb has provided me with a whole different angle to travel and the local living. We have therefore decided to extend our experiences and become hosts.
properties.street: Port Melbourne, Port Melbourne, VIC 3207, Australia

properties.name: Seaford - relaxing by the sea
properties.summary: Seaford is a hidden gem only 50 mins from Melbourne CBD on the Frankston train line and is the gateway to the Mornington Peninsula. Everything you are looking for in a weekend or longer stay. The pristine beach , local cafes or walks and rides .
properties.space: Queen size bed with pillow top mattress with wooden side tables  and fresh 1000 thread  cotton sheets and donna with a mohair rug for that extra comfit with an over head fan. The bed is so comfortable you will never want to get up in the morning . Private ensuite toilet , shower and large mirror. Body wash, shampoo & conditioner supplied . Plush towels and tissues in the bathroom.  The bedroom looks through wooden venetian blinds to a private Italian styled alfresco deck with natural light flooding in . Through the sliding doors to the deck , you will find a table and chairs to enjoy a morning coffee or a wine that you picked up after exploring the 100 's of the Mornington peninsula wineries . The deck is private at the front of  the family home where you can  enjoy the garden and peace and quiet . On the table there are candles, mossie coils, matches for use. Pot plants of herbs and tomatoes to enjoy and use . Wine glasses are chilled in the fridge to use and enjoy the garden . The ro

properties.neighborhood_overview: Seaford is  a quiet residential suburb with a community feel. The local shops include- beach cafe's, book shop, florist ,coffee shop, Thai restaurant, Spanish cafe with music and takeaways. There are safe bush tracks for bike riding and walking and beach board walks. Lots of nature animals and wild life .Frankston offers music festivals, Arts, culture , galleries,movies. There are over 100 wineries on the Mornington Peninsula. Frankston is one of melbournes vibrant waterfront destinations with the International Iron Man , Life saving carnivals, Bands and concerts . The roof top bar at "The Deck" and restaurants "Waves"  and "Crackerjack"all have beautiful bay views.
properties.notes: There are 3 small steps to the deck then 2 steps to the bed room .
properties.transit: Seaford is 50 mins train or car from melbourne on the Franston train line or driving on Monash and Eastlink freeways . My house is 10 mins walk from the station and on the local bus route . Frankston is a 15 mins bus trip. The local Woolworths supermarket and Seaford shops are 10 mins walk through a quiet safe bush track or take the foot path   Budget car hire is close by   Two push bikes  & helmets are available to borrow. Taxis can be hired locally and Uber .  Easy walk to the beach  .Maps and information on the Peninsula, restaurents, places to see and visit are all  in a folder. Emergency phone numbers also included .
properties.access: Guest access is via a secluded path , with security lighting and garden lights to guide you if you arrive after dark , to their own private deck. Front yard quests can use. Guests can park on the front lawn off the road or in the street . No access to the main area of the house but i am avaiable to help any time . Sliding fly wire screens on the windows and door - can be locked for security .
properties.interaction: If guests require assistance, they can use the main front door to contact me. I will be able to greet guests on arrival and would happy to chat and give ideas of where to go and what to do .
properties.house_rules: No loud music, no pets, no smoking, no cooking.
properties.host_about:
i am a happy , relaxed, friendly  person. I love adventure holidays and never sit and do "nothing " . I love scuba diving, swimming, bush walking, snow skiing , gardening and bike riding along the bike trails  .
i am always planning a new holiday and enjoy meeting new people and listening to their "story" . i love my town and hope you will too .

properties.neighborhood_overview: Prepare to play in St Kilda, where you can kick up your heels by the seashore, along with live music or on the whirligigs at Luna Park. Melbourne's favourite beachside suburb Join locals who walk, cycle and skate under the palms on the foreshore or sail, windsurf or kitesurf on the bay. Keep an eye out for little penguins at the St Kilda Breakwater and visit the Sunday St Kilda Esplanade Arts and Craft Market. Return to the neighbourhood's genteel resort days with a dip in the heated seawater spas and pools at the historic St Kilda Sea Baths. Enjoy fine dining at Donovan's and Circa, Asian flavours at Uncle and tasty Mexican at Radio Mexico. Catch live music at the Palais Theatre, the Esplanade Hotel and the Prince Bandroom, and get a thrill on a ride at the iconic Luna Park. Fitzroy, Acland and Carlisle street days Choose the street to suit the mood. Fitzroy and Acland streets have cool cafes, restaurants and bars, fashion boutiques and independent music and book stores. Hear the lang
properties.notes: We live with our placid and very friendly Labrador.

properties.host_about:
UNIQUE SHORT STAYS, SOUTH YARRA

Hi There!

I'm a corporate events professional based in East Melbourne/South Yarra in Melbourne. Friendly, easy going & accommodating. I am passionate about events, travel, food, wine, meeting new people & new experiences! 

Our homes are in inner city Melbourne. South Yarra/St Kilda Rd Precinct/East Melbourne. Brillant access to CBD but slightly removed for peace and quiet at night. They are certainly mere minutes from Melbourne's CBD and all major inner Melbourne attractions that make Melbourne "Marvellous".

We aim to provide the most cost effective and best value designer/boutique accommodation in inner Melbourne.  

They are ideal for leisure travellers who are looking for a unique place to call home whilst in Melbourne,or for corporate professionals working short-term in CBD/inner city. Perhaps you're coming to our fair city for one of our many special events....?

If you are interested in one of the properties i have listed but the dates are unavailable, please check my other listings under my profile or please email me through airbnb messaging system, as l will likely have another apartment/home available that will suit your needs.  I am here to provide suggestions where you see fit

Any questions please don't hesitate to call out, look forward to chatting with you about your finer requirements. 

Myself and our events network are here to assist you. More than happy to provide sights/restaurant/event/cafe or transport tips to ensure a memorable, extraordinary, safe  and convenient trip!

I have airbnb on my iphone, so i normally reply rapidly.

Feel free to contact me anytime.

Cheers Alex, Unique Short Stays

properties.neighborhood_overview: ‘FRESHWATER PLACE’ is right in the heart of ‘SOUTHBANK’ at ‘Queensbridge Square’: Southbank's entertainment hub; where buskers and street performers entertain the crowds - Crown Casino to your left, and Southgate / Arts Centre to your right.  Within the Freshwater Place Plaza it has a supermarket plus liquor, chemist, doctor’s clinic, ATM’s, restaurants and fast food cafes A little about…. ‘SOUTHBANK’ stretches along the Yarra River from Princes Bridge/St Kilda Rd to Queensbridge Square [apartment location], continuing on past the Crown Casino through to the Melbourne Exhibition Centre at the other end of the Crown Complex. properties.notes: Bookings made via AirBNB are subject to the standard booking terms and conditions displayed on the Platinum Apartments website.  Payment of your deposit constitutes acceptance of our terms and conditions. Please contact us if you would like a copy of these terms prior to booking.  For security reasons, a copy of your Australian Drivers License or International Passport is required prior to check-in along with confirmed names for all guests staying at the property along with a signed Booking Agreement before access details can be provided.  This is not negotiable!  Please don't book with us if you are not comfortable providing this information.
properties.transit: The apartment centrally located to all of Melbourne's best attractions including the stunning Southbank Promenade, Crown Casino, Arts Centre, Eureka Tower, Melbourne Sea Life Aquarium and all the restaurants, shopping and entertainment that the CBD has to offer. With a location so central most people prefer to explore on foot, and as a bonus trams are now free in the CBD which makes getting around even easier. There is a tram stop outside Freshwater Place about 30-40m about away on Queensbridge Street or catch a train at nearby Flinders St Train Station only 100m over the foot bridge…transport if needed, is so close.  If you are venturing further out, Myki cards can be purchase at the 24 hour convenience store in the Freshwater Place Arcade [6 each]. The apartment is also easily accessible by the Melbourne Airport Skybus shuttle. There are instructions in the apartment about how to arrange a shuttle back to the airport.
properties.access: All Platinum Apartments guests receive a bottle of wine plus a gourmet welcome hamper including tea, coffee, sugar, milk, tasty treats and some basic essentials to get you through the first night or two. We supply luxury toiletries and towels and our beds are made up with top quality linen ensuring a comfortable stay.
properties.interaction: One of Platinum Apartments friendly staff meet you on arrival to give you the security fob, key to the apartment and we will show you how to access the building and all facilities.  We have a home/office within Freshwater Place and are always available to help if and when needed by our guests. FREE APP: Download the Freshwater Place App - it has lots of helpful information about the Building, local area, shopping, transport, facilities, local services, emergency services and procedures...plus lots more

We appreciate that most people do the right thing, however the occasional bad experience has forced us to impose the following conditions.   TERMS & CONDITIONS. A quick explanation – you are renting a self-contained, self-catering short term apartment, you are NOT booking a fully serviced hotel/apartment, so there are requirements that guests/tenants are responsible for that would not apply at a hotel - such as emptying the rubbish bins, and making sure the apartment is left in a tidy manner upon departure.Staff will arrive upon your departure to thoroughly clean and inspect the apartment.  Please treat the property with the same respect as you would your own h
properties.host_about:
Hello my name is Helen. Platinum Apartments has been brought to LIFE through the unique collaboration of my husband Heath and I. Our DREAM is to provide apartment style accommodation to the HIGHEST calibre. We have been guided by an uncompromising DESIRE to bring together INTIMATE luxury apartment accommodation that is furnished and serviced to the highest level. 

Beautifully located on the southern BANKS of the YARRA RIVER in Melbourne, PLATINUM APARTMENTS sets the BENCHMARK for LUXURY self-contained apartment accommodation in AUSTRALIA. 

LAVISHLY appointed and offering an IMPECCABLE standard of customer service and attention to detail. Platinum Apartments is a vacation rental that truly UNDERSTANDS the meaning of OPULENCE.

We want our guests to feel WELCOME from the moment they walk through the door.  Our MOTTO is, Enter as strangers, leave as FRIENDS, and for many of our guests, this is exactly what happens. 

Our team strives hard to bring unrivalled PERSONAL touches and QUALITY, ensuring Platinum Apartments is not just an apartment but a HOME AWAY from HOME and an experience you will LOVE. 

All of Platinum Apartments Melbourne luxuriously apartments have SPECTACULAR VIEWS to the city or Port Phillip Bay and feature a TRULY UNIQUE level of comfort and finish. Our inventory also includes PENTHOUSE apartments that overlook the beautiful skyline of Melbourne.

When you are staying in Platinum Apartments you are right in the HEART of Melbourne, close to all the attractions to make your holiday a MEMORABLE one. 

You will find ACTIVITIES and ATTRACTIONS for you and your significant other as well as to suit your entire FAMILY. There will also be many restaurants that will TEMPT your taste buds. So what are YOU waiting for, reserve online today and enjoy a luxurious short stay holiday in beautiful MELBOURNE, Australia.

Our expert STAFF are also HERE to HELP you plan or answer any questions you may have. We are available and on call 24 hours a day for any issues that may arise while you are here. For further information please do not hesitate to CALL us.

properties.neighborhood_overview: What's South Yarra like? Who wouldn't love staying in the center of Melbourne's best shopping, best restaurants, best night life and entertainment. From here you can walk to some of Melbourne's finest spots, the Yarra River, the Botanical Gardens, Fed Square,the city, Southbank and more. Dine on street, people watch, enjoy fashion, glamour and style all day. Lifestyle Fashion, Dining and Entertainment Chapel Street is home to a myriad of international and local fashion boutiques, whilst Toorak Road boasts an impressive array of acclaimed restaurants and cafés.  Celebrated as the city’s most fashionable suburb, South Yarra showcases the very best in fashion, dining and entertainment. Parklands We are  surrounded by the Royal Botanic Gardens, Fawkner Park, Como Park and the Yarra River - beautiful, open spaces and lush greenery are only a short stroll from your apartment Transport South Yarra Train Station is located 2-3mins walk  from our Apartment Building, transporting you to the Melb
properties.transit: South Yarra Train Station is located 2-3mins walk  from our Apartment Building, transporting you to the Melbourne CBD in less than 6 minutes. An abundance of transportation options including road, train and tram effortlessly connect you to broader Melbourne.

properties.host_about:
UNIQUE SHORT STAYS, SOUTH YARRA

Hi There!

I'm a corporate events professional based in East Melbourne/South Yarra in Melbourne. Friendly, easy going & accommodating. I am passionate about events, travel, food, wine, meeting new people & new experiences! 

Our homes are in inner city Melbourne. South Yarra/St Kilda Rd Precinct/East Melbourne. Brillant access to CBD but slightly removed for peace and quiet at night. They are certainly mere minutes from Melbourne's CBD and all major inner Melbourne attractions that make Melbourne "Marvellous".

We aim to provide the most cost effective and best value designer/boutique accommodation in inner Melbourne.  

They are ideal for leisure travellers who are looking for a unique place to call home whilst in Melbourne,or for corporate professionals working short-term in CBD/inner city. Perhaps you're coming to our fair city for one of our many special events....?

If you are interested in one of the properties i have listed but the dates are unavailable, please check my other listings under my profile or please email me through airbnb messaging system, as l will likely have another apartment/home available that will suit your needs.  I am here to provide suggestions where you see fit

Any questions please don't hesitate to call out, look forward to chatting with you about your finer requirements. 

Myself and our events network are here to assist you. More than happy to provide sights/restaurant/event/cafe or transport tips to ensure a memorable, extraordinary, safe  and convenient trip!

I have airbnb on my iphone, so i normally reply rapidly.

Feel free to contact me anytime.

Cheers Alex, Unique Short Stays
