properties.name: Single handy room
properties.summary: This is a single room in an rambling old 'austerity era' that we are gradually ecofying.  The room is pretty standard and this is eco filled with chooks, bees, combustion heater, pellet oven, water harvesting, straw rooms, solar grid connect elec, aquaponics, extensive food garden and loads more.  We all share the one internal toilet/bathroom and this works amazingly well.  We sometimes have a range of projects on the go as we are renovating with timber I mill myself.
properties.description: This is a single room in an rambling old 'austerity era' that we are gradually ecofying.  The room is pretty standard and this is eco filled with chooks, bees, combustion heater, pellet oven, water harvesting, straw rooms, solar grid connect elec, aquaponics, extensive food garden and loads more.  We all share the one internal toilet/bathroom and this works amazingly well.  We sometimes have a range of projects on the go as we are renovating with timber I mill myself.
properties.house_rules: Our house is alive with all sorts of plants and animals busy growing and working away. The bees furiously making honey, the fish growing and providing nutrient for the plants, the worms processing fish wastes, the plants de-nitrifying the water for the fish, the chickens processing kitchens scraps into eggs, the spiders catching bugs and compost and all sorts of microbes and subsoil biota providing for the plants. We have all sorts of people stay and are pretty flexible. Here are some of the usual practices 1. We take our shoes of at the door. We do this cause if feels nice, reduces the work cleaning floors and means we are not traipsing compost throughout the house. We have several crocs at the doors for us and guests. We usually just have a thickish pair of socks for the house in winter. 2. We don't kill all our household spiders. They do a job keeping the insects down in the house, especially when processing honey and they are fascinating to watch. 3. We turn appliances off at the p
properties.host_about: We are having a ball with Airbnb, meeting lovely people from all over the world and sharing lots of stories of life and adventures.  Our home is a somewhat rambling old austerity era home that we have 'ecofied' with PV panels, water tanks, straw walls, earthern render, water recycling, compost toilet, chooks, aquaponics, extensive food garden with over 100 edibles, combustion heater and more.  The rooms vary, a couple with straw walls with an earthern render, loft queen size bed, desk and a queen size corner sofa bed (that we designed, built and upholstered ourselves).  Oh and its 900m from a zone one train, close to bikeways including one direct from the airport.

properties.house_rules: This is my home and I take care of it, so please treat it as you would your own :) NO SMOKING: This a no smoking house. Fantastic opportunity for a fabulous, magical holiday, staying in our wonderful house (we LOVE it here!), with it's private bush garden, brilliantly convenient location and lovely spaces. Sleeping includes magnificent master bedroom with king size bed, gorgeous second bedroom with double bed, beautiful huge attic with 4 beds. Lovely garden space, undercover verandah, trampoline, swings, fire bunker. Main house listed. The Cabin is separately listed on Airbnb but may be booked simultaneously with Heaven in Healesville, for groups up to 10. The two buildings are on different levels, connected with a glass house/stairwell. There
properties.neighborhood_overview: Located in the famous Yarra Valley with it's wineries,  including Rochford Winery concert venue, cafés, specialty stores, galleries, beautiful bush walks, close to Maroondah Park Dam, on the way to Marysville, Lake Mountain Ski Resort and populated with friendly locals!
properties.notes: Fires may be lit in outdoor fire pit during non total fire-ban times, plenty of wood is available. Fires must be supervised at all times and extinguished when guests leave fire pit area.
properties.transit: A train from Melbourne runs to Lilydale and from there one may take a bus to the DON ROAD stop, then walk up the hill approx 800m - or ask the bus driver if they are going further and if you can be dropped at Juliet Crescent,
properties.access: Lovely garden space, undercover verandah, trampoline, swings, fire bunker. Main house listed. The Cabin is separately listed on Airbnb but may be booked simultaneously with Heaven in Healesville, for groups up to 10. The two buildings are on different levels, connected with a glass house/stairwell. There is also another little dwelling on the property where a very nice friend of mine stays sometimes.
properties.interaction: I will be available by messaging  for any queries. I am sometimes there in which case it is always a pleasure to meet the guests, but if not, instructions are provided re access and other details and someone is nearby locally should the need arise.
properties.house_rules: NO SMOKING IN HOUSE! Smoking is permitted outside but butts to be disposed of in the rubbish only. Leave the house as you found it please. No food/drinks to be taken beyond Kitchen/Dining area. House trained pets only and must be cleaned up after. Thanks! :)
properties.host_about:
I am an Architect and I love travelling, animals, being healthy and beautiful things. Heaven in Healesville is my own design, built on land now in our family for 5 generations, together with The Cabin, originally built by my grandmother in 1942, which I have tastefully and respectfully restored, renovated and extended. 
When we are not living a quiet life in our country house, we are often exploring other parts of the world. I have been to nearly 80 countries, many of them several times. Many design ideas for our house were inspired by incredible places visited on these trips.

properties.name: Chapel St Designers' Bunker+Carpark
properties.summary: In the heart of South Yarra, just a minute from Toorak Rd and Chapel St Jam Factory, this private bunker is a Designer's haven. Luxurious bathroom, open living and a quirky NY style loft bed. A small space suited for up to 2 people! Complete with coldpress juicer, Sheridan towels, dvd player, this is the cosiest stay around town!  Self check-in makes it more convenient for you to access the studio upon arrival at any hour of the day or night.
properties.space: It's a bunker studio which is suitable for one person or a couple. There is the chaise-long couch which can double up as a bed.  *NOTE, the length of the bed is 180cm so those that are taller might have to sleep on an angle. Otherwise, the couch is equally comfy. *The space is suited for 1-2 people at most given it's size

properties.neighborhood_overview: This is where you want to stay in Melbourne. Chapel St and South Yarra is the Nottinghill of Melbourne. One of the greatest shopping strips around town, located adjacent to 2 of the best cinemas, hippest cafes, nightclubs and restaurants in town. A place to be seen.
properties.notes: Cinemas- Jam Factory, Como Centre for all European and Art House screenings, 2 min Cafes for Breakfast- Drugstores Espresso for the hip crowd, Two Birds One Stone-incredible coffee, Top Paddock 10min walk (voted Melbourne's Best Cafe!), Church St is 2 tram stops away and is the Interior Design St of Melbourne. Chapel St is also considered the nightclub/bar strip of Melbourne.
properties.transit: This is the most well-connected suburb in Melbourne to all transport. Hop on a tram, take the train 2 stops to the centre of Melbourne or taxi in in less than 10 minutes.
properties.access: All amenities, fridge,  wifi, cooking appliances, toaster, kettle, teas, bathroom, washing machine, television, dvd player, internet, soaps, hairdryer, handles, iron, ironing board, Sheridan sheets, blankets, sheridan feather pillows(soft like a babies bottom),
properties.interaction: The bunker is a self-checkin and checkout ( i provide you with a code to a lock that has keys inside) so it reduces the stress of arriving on time or flying in late at night. Always reachable 24/7!
properties.house_rules: Please be respectful of neighbours and no excessively loud parties please. That aside, make yourself right at home!
properties.host_about: Avid traveller and adventurer. I run Almo Milk- an Australian Almond Milk company. Love meeting and hosting new people!

properties.name: Victorian style little house in North Melbourne
properties.summary: Hi, I living in a nice little house in North Melbourne, 2 mn walking to tram stop and Errol st, 10mn to the CBD. I share the house with Eddy a friendly 26y Aussie and Coline, his 24y french gf. This room is perfect for student, if you want a cheap place to stay for holidays or if you freshly arrived.  Your free to do what you feel like when staying here but be mindful of Eddy and also respect the house rules..cleaning after yourself is a must. Room for couple or single person.
